Passive Ability.Name: Super Luck
Passive Ability.Description: This Pokémon's critical-hit rate is increased by an additional 15%.

Absol.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, and decreasing their Defense by 15% for 2s when the attack hits. If this boosted attack hits only a single target, it deals bonus damage.

Move 1.Name: Feint
Move 1.Description: The user dashes in an arc forward, damaging Pokémon in the path and increasing the user's basic attack speed by 60% for 0.5s when this move hits. This move ignores the Defense and shield effects of Pokémon hit. Each use alternates between a rightward and leftward arc.

Upgrade 1.Name: Night Slash
Upgrade 1.Description:
The user dashes in a leftward arc forward, damaging non-allied Pokémon in its path and increasing the user's basic attack speed by 60% for 0.5s when this dash hits. If this dash hits, the move can be used again within 6s. This second use has the user dash straight ahead, repeating the effects of the first dash when it hits. The critical-hit rate of this move is increased by 0.8% for every 1% missing HP of opposing Pokémon hit, up to 30% increased critical-hit rate at 38% missing HP or more.

  The first use is a rightward arc forward from the perspective of the orange team (right-side team, which has the map flipped horizontally when in battle).
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Restores the user's HP for 50% of damage dealt with the second dash hit.

Upgrade 2.Name: Pursuit
Upgrade 2.Description:
The user dashes forward, empowering the next auto attack for 3s. With this empowered attack, the user leaps to a non-allied Pokémon and attacks. This damage is increased against targets hit in the back. If this empowered attack hits any target in the back, this move's cooldown is reduced by 70%.

  When the user has an empowered attack readied, nearby non-allied Pokémon have their backs highlighted.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increases the user's movement speed by 35% for 2s after using this move and before using the empowered attack.

Move 2.Name: Slash
Move 2.Description: The user slashes in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon hit. This move's critical-hit rate is increased by 15%.

Upgrade 1.Name: Psycho Cut
Upgrade 1.Description:
The user throws a psychic slash in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon hit and decreasing their movement speed by 90% for 2s (decaying by 25% every 0.5s). 3 marks are applied to opposing Pokémon hit by the psychic slash for 5s. When the user deals damage to a marked target, 1 mark is consumed, dealing additional damage. The third mark deals increased damage when consumed.

  The critical-hit rate of the psychic slash and consumed marks is increased by 15%. The marks can be cleansed.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increases the user's movement speed by 20% when an opposing Pokémon is marked by this move.

Upgrade 2.Name: Sucker Punch
Upgrade 2.Description: The user becomes unstoppable and targets an opposing Pokémon and enters a counter stance for 1s, decreasing the movement speed of the user and the target by 50% for the duration. After 1s, the user leaves the counter stance to counterattack, charging behind the target and damaging the target and other opposing Pokémon. If the user is attacked or the target attacks during the counter stance, however, the user dodges the damage and effects of the first hit and immediately counterattacks, shoving the target and dealing increased damage to the target and other opposing Pokémon.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increases the user's basic attack speed by 40% for 3s after using this move.

Unite Move.Name: Midnight Slash
Unite Move.Description: The user briefly becomes unstoppable before becoming untargetable and invulnerable for 1.15s while unleashing a flurry of 5 slashes in front of themself in the designated area, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect. The user then becomes unstoppable again and unleashes a final slash in front of them with 3 blades of energy, shoving opposing Pokémon and dealing damage, up to 4 times at close range and down to 1 time at maximum range. The damage of the flurry of 5 slashes is divided by the number of targets hit. The first hit from the final slash deals full damage to each target hit; subsequent hits deal 30% of the full damage to the same target.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 80% Movement Speed, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: No Guard
Passive Ability.Description: Honedge and Doublade do not gain the stat benefits of Stance Change; their auto attacks act like Aegislash's Sword Forme auto attacks.
Passive Ability.Description 2:
Changes to Sword Forme when using blade moves (Shadow Sneak, Sacred Sword, or Shadow Claw, and Coup de Grace); increasing Attack, increasing movement speed by 5%, and increasing auto attack speed by 15%. Changes to Shield Forme when using shield moves (Iron Defense, Wide Guard, or Iron Head), increasing Defense and Sp. Def, and decreasing auto attack speed by 20%.

Increases movement speed and auto attack speed by an additional 15% for 3.5s when changing stances.

Aegislash.Attack:
When in Sword Forme: slashes at opposing Pokémon, damaging those hit. When in Shield Forme: rams at opposing Pokémon, damaging those hit. Becomes a boosted attack if the boost count is at 1 or more, consuming 1 boost count; the boosted attack changes based on the current Forme. The boost count caps at 4, and boosted attacks remain readied until used.

As a boosted attack in Sword Forme: pierces through the target, damaging opposing Pokémon hit. As a boosted attack in Shield Forme: slams into the target, damaging opposing Pokémon hit and stunning them for 0.1s; restores HP, and reduces the cooldown of Sacred Sword or Shadow Claw by 1s when it hits.

Move 1.Name: Shadow Sneak
Move 1.Description: Casts a shadow toward the designated location, damaging opposing Pokémon hit. After hitting an opposing Pokémon or traveling maximum distance; warps to the shadow’s location, damaging opposing Pokémon at the location. Increases the boost count by 1 if the warp hits an opposing Pokémon.

Upgrade 1.Name: Sacred Sword
Upgrade 1.Description:
Thrusts their blade into the ground and creates a triangular zone that erupts with a hidden power, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and throwing them for 0.6s. At the same time as the eruption, slashes forward, dealing more damage to opposing Pokémon hit; and increasing Defense penetration by 25% for 3s if the slash hits.

  Increases the boost count by 1 for each target hit by the triangular zone erupting (up to 2 from hitting wild Pokémon).
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increases Attack by 50 for 3s after the triangular zone hits.

Upgrade 2.Name: Shadow Claw
Upgrade 2.Description:
Slashes forward with their blade twice, damaging opposing Pokémon with each attack, then follows up with a final rising slash, damaging opposing Pokémon and throwing them for 0.75s when the rising slash hits.

  Increases the boost count by 1 if this move hits.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increases critical-hit rate by 20% for 1s after the final slash.

Move 2.Name: Iron Defense
Move 2.Description: Envelops the user in a powerful protective force for up to 3s, blocking the next attack. Increases the boost count by 1 when this move blocks an attack.

Upgrade 1.Name: Wide Guard
Upgrade 1.Description:
Focuses in place, becomes unstoppable and grants a shield effect for up to 1.2s; and shoves opposing Pokémon in front for 0.6s. This move can be used again to end the move early. When the shield effect is depleted or the move ends; shoves opposing Pokémon in front for 0.6s and decreases their movement speed by 45% for 2s.

  Increases the boost count by 1 unconditionally when granting the shield effect. Increases the boost count by 1 more for each instance of damage received by the shield effect (up to 2 times). Increases boost count by 1 more if an opposing Pokémon is shoved at the end or unconditionally when the shield effect is depleted before it can end normally.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Reduces this move's cooldown by 1s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Iron Head
Upgrade 2.Description:
Dashes barreling forward, damaging opposing Pokémon hit. Protects the user with a special shield for 1s afterward; this shield blocks the damage of the next attack then disappears; reducing this move's cooldown by 3s after a successful block.

  Increases the boost count by 1 unconditionally after barreling forward. Increases the boost count by 1 more if the shield blocks an attack.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increases Attack by 10% for 3s when the special shield blocks an attack.

Unite Move.Name: Coup de Grace
Unite Move.Description: Becomes unstoppable and unleashes a ground-splitting slash in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon in the line area of effect, dealing additional missing HP damage to those hit. Increases the boost count by 2 if this Unite Move knocks out an opposing Pokémon.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Aroma Veil
Passive Ability.Description: When an ally is under the effect of one of Alcremie's shields or buffs, remove any hindrances that are applied or are currently affecting that ally. This ability will go on cooldown for 10s after removing a hindrance. This ability can also work on Alcremie as well.  When Milcery evolves into Alcremie, gain a Sweet Gauge. When the Sweet Gauge is filled at 15 stacks, the cooldown of one charge of Recover and Decorate will be reset. These moves will also be empowered.

Alcremie.Attack:
Attacks by throwing whip cream.

Milcery and Alcremie do not have a boosted attack.

Move 1.Name: Helping Hand
Move 1.Description: Grant a designated ally Pokémon or yourself a shield for 3s, in addition to increasing the recipients Attack by 40 and Special Attack by 25 for 3s

Upgrade 1.Name: Decorate
Upgrade 1.Description:
Grant a designated ally Pokémon or yourself a shield for 4s. If the shield is granted to an ally Pokémon, Alcremie receives an extra shield of the same value. Basic and boosted attacks by the shielded Pokémon will deal additional damage and increase Alcremie's Sweet Gauge by 1 for 6s. The extra shield Alcremie receives when using Decorate on an ally does not apply additional damage to Alcremie's attacks. Alcremie's basic attacks will also increase the Sweet Gauge by 1. When empowered by a full Sweet Gauge, the attacks deal even more additional damage.

  The additional damage depends on the shielded Pokémon's level. Only one main Decorate shield can be active at a time.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increases the strength of the shield.

Upgrade 2.Name: Recover
Upgrade 2.Description:
Place a dollop of whipped cream at a designated location for up to 20s. When an ally Pokémon picks up the whipped cream, their HP is restored and their movement speed is increased by 15% for 2s. When whipped cream is consumed by ally Pokémon, the Sweet Gauge is also increased by 3. When the Sweet Gauge is full, the next dollop becomes sweeter, restoring more HP and increasing their movement speed by 40% for 2s instead and increases the Sweet Gauge by 5. Two dollops may be kept in reserve.

  An ally Snorlax will heal additional HP from the dollops.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: The maximum number of uses that can be kept in reserve is increased to 3.

Move 2.Name: Charm
Move 2.Description: Charm a target Pokémon with your cute voice, dealing damage to the first Pokémon hit. Pokémon hit by the charm have their Attack reduced by 30 and Special Attack reduced by 20 and movement speed reduced by 30% for 2s. Additionally, increases the sweet gauge by 2.

Upgrade 1.Name: Dazzling Gleam
Upgrade 1.Description:
Release a conal ray of light in a designated direction, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon, stunning them for 0.4s and increasing the Sweet Gauge by 4 for every opposing Pokémon hit. If an ally Pokémon has been affected by Decorate, the decorated Pokémon will also release a conal ray of light.

  Alcremie can move around while casting this move, but is slowed by 20%.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increases the damage of this move.

Upgrade 2.Name: Sweet Scent
Upgrade 2.Description: Launch a sweet scent at a designated location, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon in the area and lowering their movement speed by 30%, decaying by 10% every 0.5s. The outer ring of the scent remains for 3s, dealing damage, applying a 100% slow lasting 0.5s to oppposing Pokémon who touch the ring. Both the intial area and outer ring can hit at the same time. Increases the Sweet Gauge by 2 for every hit.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increases the duration of the outer ring slow to 1.5s.

Unite Move.Name: Fluffy Cream Supreme
Unite Move.Description: Create a giant cake and stand atop it becoming unstoppable and gaining a shield for 6s. Then throw whipped cream at allies. Allies who receive whipped cream are healed and have their maximum HP buffed for 8s. This move ends early if this move's shield is lost, Alcremie becomes bound, or if the move is manually cancelled. The shield is 60% of Alcremie's max HP
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 40% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 30% Max HP Shield (Applied when the move ends)

Passive Ability.Name: Snow Warning
Passive Ability.Description: Causes snow to fall on an enemy, dealing damage to it and decreasing their movement speed by 30% for .75s. This ability has a 4s cooldown. Boosted attacks, Snow Warning, and all moves (except Aurora Veil) sling snow; hitting the same target with snow 4 times will freeze them for 1s.

Alolan Ninetales.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack. When this boosted attack hits, it deals damage to nearby enemies and decreases their movement speed for a short time.

Move 1.Name: Powder Snow
Move 1.Description: Ninetales attacks with a chilly gust of powdery snow; dealing damage to enemies hit and decreasing their movement speed by 50% for 1s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Avalanche
Upgrade 1.Description: Ninetales attacks with a gust of chilly ice toward the designated direction. The ice damages enemies and forms a wall that can't be walked through. After a short time, this wall melts and collapses; further damaging enemies in a radius around the wall.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Also decreases the movement speed of enemies by 50% for 1s when this move hits.

Upgrade 2.Name: Dazzling Gleam
Upgrade 2.Description: Ninetales attacks with a powerful cone of blinding light; damaging and stunning enemies hit for .8s.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increased damage and stun duration to 1s.

Move 2.Name: Icy Wind
Move 2.Description: Attacks with a gust of freezing air; damaging, and slowing Pokémon hit by 20% for 1s. Icy Wind shoves Pokémon hit in the direction of the wind for a short distance unless they are already at the maximum range of the move.

Upgrade 1.Name: Blizzard
Upgrade 1.Description: Ninetales blasts twice in a line. The first blast penetrates walls and slows enemies. The second blast deals double damage, shoves enemies back, and if it hits a wall it creates a frost area at the impact location for 4s; dealing damage every 0.5s and slowing enemies in the area by 35% for 1s on each tick.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increased damage.

Upgrade 2.Name: Aurora Veil
Upgrade 2.Description: Ninetales dashes a short distance and creates an aurora centered on their position for 5s; reducing damage received by Ninetales and allies within the veil by 35%, healing Ninetales with each boosted attack, and increasing Attack Speed by 15%. While Ninetales is inside the aurora, movement speed is increased by 10% and all auto attacks are boosted.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Damage reduction increased to 40% and cooldown reduced by 2s.

Unite Move.Name: Snow Globe
Unite Move.Description: Attack with a chilly blast of snow and ice; dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect around Ninetales when it hits. Deals increased damage to enemies that are frozen. Ninetales is unstoppable during the cast.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Static
Passive Ability.Description: Upon receiving damage: paralyzes all nearby opposing Pokémon (30s CD).
Passive Ability.Description 2:
Paralysis from Static decreases opposing Pokémon movement speed by 30% and reduces auto attack speed by a flat 10% for 2s.

Alolan Raichu can use basic attacks while moving but is slowed by 30% when using basic attacks, Electro Ball or Thunderbolt.

After using a move or a boosted attack: dashes in the direction of movement.

Alolan Raichu.Attack:
Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing increased damage and paralyzing the opposing Pokémon hit.

Paralysis from Pikachu's boosted attacks decreases opposing Pokémon movement speed by 30% and reduces auto attack speed by a flat 10% for 2s.

After hitting 4 basic attacks or moves, the next basic attack becomes a boosted attack. Boosted attacks release electricity at the target that can chain to other nearby opposing Pokémon, dealing increased damage to up to 5 opposing Pokémon.

Move 1.Name: Thunder Shock
Move 1.Description: Releases electricity at the designated opposing Pokémon; damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and paralyzing those hit. Paralysis from this move decreases opposing Pokémon movement speed by 30% and reduces auto attack speed by a flat 10% for 2s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Stored Power
Upgrade 1.Description:
Increases auto attack speed by 35% and empowers the next 6 auto attacks for 5s.

  Each empowered auto attack also launches a star-shaped electric blast at the target, dealing additional damage. This move goes on cooldown after all 6 electric blasts have been launched or after 5s.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: The electric blasts also decrease the target's Sp. Def by 10% for 3s (up to 3 times; maximum 30%).

Upgrade 2.Name: Electro Ball
Upgrade 2.Description:
Hurls an electric orb toward the designated location, where it remains for up to 30s if it doesn't hit an opposing Pokémon on the way. When an electric orb and an opposing Pokémon touch; the orb releases its electricity and damages nearby opposing Pokémon.

  A maximum of 2 uses can be kept in reserve, with a 0.5s cooldown between uses. A maximum of 3 orbs can be on the map at a given time.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Deals damage every 0.5s over 3.5s (8 times) to opposing Pokémon hit by this move.

Move 2.Name: Thunder Wave
Move 2.Description: Discharges a weak jolt of electricity in the designated direction; damaging nearby opposing Pokémon and paralyzing those hit. Paralysis from this move decreases opposing Pokémon movement speed by 30% and reduces auto attack speed by a flat 10% for 2s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Thunderbolt
Upgrade 1.Description:
Channels for 0.5s then releases a strong electric blast in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect, and paralyzing them when it hits. Paralysis from this move decreases opposing Pokémon movement speed by 30% and reduces auto attack speed by a flat 10% for 2s.

  If this move hits an electric orb created by Electro Ball; the orb releases its electricity, dealing increased damage to nearby opposing Pokémon.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Immobilizes opposing Pokémon hit for 1s instead of paralyzing them.

Upgrade 2.Name: Psychic
Upgrade 2.Description:
Releases a strong telekinetic force in the designated area, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and applying a debuff which decreases their movement speed by 23% for 3s when it hits. If the user hits debuffed opposing Pokémon with an auto attack, it deals additional damage.

  If this move hits an electric orb created by Electro Ball; the orb is pulled to the center of this move's area of effect. This does not extend the duration the electric orb remains.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Creates a damage-over-time area of effect, damaging opposing Pokémon inside the area every 0.5s over 2s (up to 5 times).

Unite Move.Name: Thunderstorm Aerial
Unite Move.Description: Creates a star-shaped zone of electricity in the designated area for 4s, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect when created, then damaging opposing Pokémon over time (up to 5 times) and decreasing their movement speed by 60% while in the zone. If the user hits an opposing Pokémon that is in the zone with an auto attack, the next basic attack becomes a boosted attack.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 35% Attack Speed, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Flash Fire
Passive Ability.Description: When this Pokémon takes Sp. Atk-based damage from opposing Pokémon, the damage this Pokémon takes is reduced by 20% for 3s, and their next auto attack deals additional damage. This Ability goes on a 10s cooldown after it ends.

Armarouge.Attack:
Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing increased damage.

Every time the user hits an opposing Pokémon with a basic attack, the user's cannon gauge increases, up to 5 times. When the cannon gauge is full, the user's next basic attack consumes the entire cannon gauge, hitting in a large area of effect with the basic attack damage and additionally in a second close range area of effect with the boosted attack damage.

When the user hits an opposing Pokémon with a basic attack, a blazing mark is applied to them for 7s. Up to 3 marks can be applied, with subsequent marks refreshing the duration. If the user hits an opposing Pokémon with 3 blazing marks using Fire Spin or Armor Cannon, all the marks are consumed and additional damage is dealt to the opposing Pokémon, equal to 10% of their max HP, capped to 1000 damage. There is a 6s cooldown after consuming the marks before the user can apply blazing marks on the same opposing Pokémon again.

Move 1.Name: Incinerate
Move 1.Description: Has the user attack the designated opposing Pokémon with a flame, setting them ablaze and dealing damage over time for 4s. When a Pokémon on the opposing team that's ablaze picks up a Berry, the Berry's effects are halved.

Upgrade 1.Name: Fire Spin
Upgrade 1.Description:
Has the user generate a fierce vortex of fire around themself, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon hit every 0.5s. Each time Armarouge deals damage while Fire Spin is active, gain a shield. This shield can stack up to six times.

  Gain 20% movement speed while the vortex is active. The vortex lasts 3s, and its duration is increased by 1s if the user hits opposing Pokémon with an auto attack. This extended duration can stack up to 3 times, to a total vortex duration of 6s. Moving towards an enemy will additionally increase movement speed by 10%.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Upon using Fire Spin+, gain 3 stacks of shields.

Upgrade 2.Name: Armor Cannon
Upgrade 2.Description:
Has the user combine their shoulder armor and start charging power. When charged past a minimum duration, the user then fires a blazing ball of flame. The user releases a shock wave in front of themself when firing, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon in close range.

  The fired ball of flame explodes when it hits an opposing Pokémon or after it travels a set distance, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon and leaving them unable to act for 0.45s. The user's Defense and Sp. Def are decreased by 5% while this move is on cooldown.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increases the range of this move and auto attacks.

Move 2.Name: Will-o-Wisp
Move 2.Description: Has the user shoot a flame in the designated direction, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon hit, leaving them burned and decreasing their movement speed by 20% for 2s. After using this move, the user's next auto attack becomes a boosted attack.

Upgrade 1.Name: Flame Charge
Upgrade 1.Description:
Has the user cloak themself in flame and charge in the designated direction, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon the user hits and shoving them for 0.45s. When this move hits an opposing Pokémon, the user is granted a shield for 3s and this move's cooldown is reduced by 20%.

  For 3s after using this move, the cannon gauge becomes full and will not decrease after boosted attacks are used.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Reduces the damage the user receives by 20% for 3s after this move hits an opposing Pokémon.

Upgrade 2.Name: Psyshock
Upgrade 2.Description:
Has the user materialize odd psychic waves to attack in three areas of effect in front of themself, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon hit while ignoring 35% of their Sp. Def. The third attack throws opposing Pokémon hit for 0.7s. Multiple of the areas of effect can hit the same opposing Pokémon but the second damage instance will be reduced by 25% and the third by 50%.

  For 3s after using this move, the cannon gauge becomes full and will not decrease after boosted attacks are used.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increases this move's area of effect for the third area blast.

Unite Move.Name: Psykaboom
Unite Move.Description: Has the user jump up, becoming unstoppable for 1.85s, and charge psychic power for 1s, then create an area that leaves opposing Pokémon unable to act. While the user is charging psychic power, the Unite Move can be used again to adjust the position of the area. The user then fires a ball of flame towards the center of the area, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon and throwing them away from the center of the area.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Huge Power
Passive Ability.Description: When this Pokémon hits only a single enemy with an auto attack, a move, or their Unite Move, the hit is always a critical hit. However, when hitting two or more enemies at once with an auto attack, a move, or its Unite Move, the hits are never critical hits.  Critical hits deal 170% rather than 200%.

Azumarill.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing increased damage to enemies within a cone area of effect in front of this Pokémon.

Move 1.Name: Tackle
Move 1.Description: Charge forward; dealing damage to any enemy hit and leave them unable to act for 0.5s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Play Rough
Upgrade 1.Description:
Increase movement speed by 30% for 4s and change the next auto attack. When performing the next auto attack, lunge at one enemy in range and deliver repeated blows dealing damage to that target and leave it unable to act for .75s.

  Using Play Rough will overwrite any active Aqua Tail attack change. Play Rough attacks count as auto attacks for the purpose of items, lifesteal and other benefits.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Further increases movement speed to 35% when this move is used, and also reduces this move’s cooldown by 1s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Water Pulse
Upgrade 2.Description: Shoot a pulsing blast of water in front of Azumarill. When shooting the blast, Azumarill may perform a short rolling dash in a designated direction. When the blast of water hits an enemy, decrease their movement speed by 40% for 2s and deal damage to all enemies in an area of effect around the initial target. The blast of water then automatically bounces to another target if one is available. Including the first target, the blast of water can bounce between up to three targets consecutively, and each hit behaves in the same way as the first.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increase the maximum number of targets that the blast of water can bounce between by 2.

Move 2.Name: Bubble
Move 2.Description: Spray bubbles in a cone dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect and decreasing their movement speed by 30% for 2s. This move can be used while moving.

Upgrade 1.Name: Whirlpool
Upgrade 1.Description:
For 5s, four small whirlpools appear that swirl around Azumarill as it moves. If a whirlpool hits a wild Pokémon, the whirlpool deals damage to them and restores Azumarill's HP. If a whirlpool hits an enemy player, an increased amount of HP is restored.

  Moving clockwise against your target will grant more hits against that target, and counter-clockwise will reduce the number of hits.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Reduces this move’s cooldown by 2s and increases the amount of HP restored.

Upgrade 2.Name: Aqua Tail
Upgrade 2.Description:
Increase area-of-effect and attack speed for the next three auto attacks by 20% for 6s. If these auto attacks hit from a distance, they also deal increased damage and restore HP. Using Aqua Tail will overwrite any active Play Rough attack change.

  Aqua Tail attacks count as auto attacks for the purpose of items, lifesteal and other benefits.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Aqua Tail attacks that hit from a distance reduce the cooldown of all moves by 0.8s.

Unite Move.Name: Belly Bash
Unite Move.Description: Azumarill targets an enemy player and then pounds their belly three times; losing 5% remaining HP with each pound in exchange for a 6.5% max HP shield that stacks with each pound and lasts 6s. Azumarill gains 60 Attack for 5s and can move while pounding their belly. Azumarill then charges at the target damaging and throwing all Pokémon hit while charging and Pokémon within the area effect around the target. Azumarill is unstoppable during this move.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Torrent
Passive Ability.Description: While at 50% max HP or below: increases Attack and Sp. Atk by 20%.

Blastoise.Attack:
Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, reducing the cooldowns of the user's moves by 1s; damaging opposing Pokémon 3 times over 0.2s, and decreasing their movement speed by 50% for 1s when hit.

Boosted attacks used during Rapid Spin hit 3 times over 0.5s, do not reduce the cooldowns of the user's moves, nor decrease the movement speed of opposing Pokémon hit.

Move 1.Name: Water Gun
Move 1.Description: Shoots a jet of water in the designated direction after 0.2s, damaging opposing Pokémon hit, shoving them for 0.6s and decreasing their movement speed by 30% for 1s when hit. Opposing Pokémon hit before the jet of water reaches halfway are shoved the full distance; those hit beyond halfway are shoved a short distance instead.

Upgrade 1.Name: Hydro Pump
Upgrade 1.Description:
Blasts out a huge amount of water in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon hit 3 times in 0.1s, shoving them and stunning them for 0.6s when hit. Opposing Pokémon hit before the blast of water reaches halfway are shoved the full distance; those hit beyond halfway are shoved a short distance instead.

  When used during Rapid Spin: Blastoise unleashes a large burst of water in a radius around themself, damaging enemies, knocking them back and stunning those hit for 0.75s. Blastoise also gains a 30% movement speed bonus for the duration of this move.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increased move damage.

Upgrade 2.Name: Water Spout
Upgrade 2.Description:
Casts down a barrage of water at the designated area, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect every 0.5s over 3s (up to 6 times) and decreasing their movement speed by 20% for 2s when hit.

  When used during Rapid Spin: increases movement speed by 30%, and rapidly spouts bursts of water in different directions around themself, damaging opposing over time when held for the duration of Rapid Spin (up to a possible 17 times). The first hit of Water Spout during Rapid Spin on an opposing Pokémon decreases the target's movement speed; subsequent hits will not.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increased move damage.

Move 2.Name: Skull Bash
Move 2.Description: Tucks in their head then dashes forward after 0.5s, damaging opposing Pokémon in the path and stunning them for 0.5s when it hits.

Upgrade 1.Name: Surf
Upgrade 1.Description: Blastoise rides a wave of water, becoming Unstoppable for 1.6s. Blastoise can then jump off the wave in the designated direction, while the wave continues to travel. Blastoise gains a shield if the wave damages a Pokemon. Enemy Pokemon that make contact with the wave take damage and are stunned and shoved for 1.6s. The wave can be stopped by walls, and will deal no damage once Blastoise has jumped off.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increases the strength of the shield.

Upgrade 2.Name: Rapid Spin
Upgrade 2.Description:
Withdraws into their shell, resetting the cooldown of Hydro Pump or Water Spout and gaining hindrance resistance for the duration of this move; then starts rapidly spinning while moving freely for up to 5s or when used again to stop spinning and end this move. Damages opposing Pokémon in contact with the user every 0.5s while spinning (up to 10 times).

  While spinning: changes the mechanics of auto attacks and Hydro Pump or Water Spout. When this move ends: comes out of their shell and readies a boosted attack. The user cannot perform any actions for 0.45s while withdrawing or coming out of their shell.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increases Defense and Sp. Def while using this move.

Unite Move.Name: Hydro Typhoon
Unite Move.Description: Becomes unstoppable for 2s and gains a shield for 4s; shoots immense jets of water in a large circle around themself after 1.1s, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and throwing them for 1.5s when it hits.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 40% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Blaze
Passive Ability.Description: When this Pokémon hits an enemy with an auto attack or move, that enemy receives a fire fragment for 4s and the duration of all other fire fragments on that enemy are refreshed. When an enemy has 5 fire fragments, all 5 are consumed to deal additional damage to the enemy and restore the user's HP. When this Pokémon's HP is at half or lower, more HP is restored.

Blaziken.Attack:
Deals damage to nearby enemies. While in Kick Style, basic attacks have a higher area-of-effect and reach. While in Punch Style, attack speed is increased by 40%.

For the purpose of auto attacks, Torchic is treated as punch style while Combusken is treated as kick style. Once Blaziken has access to their Unite move, they can swap between styles.

Move 1.Name: Aerial Ace
Move 1.Description: Dash in a designated direction, dealing damage to enemies that come in contact with the dash. If this move hits an enemy, this move may be used again once within 4 seconds before being put on cooldown.

Upgrade 1.Name: Fire Punch
Upgrade 1.Description: Unleash 2 flaming punches in the designated direction, dealing damage to enemies hit. The designated direction can be changed during this move. When the user hits an enemy with this move, for a short time, this move can be used once more.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increases damage dealt.

Upgrade 2.Name: Overheat
Upgrade 2.Description: Become Hindrance Resistant, reduce incoming damage by 25%, and charge power in place in a designated direction. If used again, unleash a flaming kick in the designed direction, dealing damage to enemies hit. The longer the duration the charge is held for, the more damage this move deals. If the user charges a certain amount of power (when the gauge reaches the line indicator), this move also shoves enemies hit.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increases damage dealt.

Move 2.Name: Ember
Move 2.Description: Release a small ball of fire in the designated direction, dealing damage in a small area around the first enemy hit and decreases their movement speed by 50% for 1s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Focus Blast
Upgrade 1.Description: Fire a ball of focused energy in the designated direction. The ball of focused energy explodes upon hitting an enemy or after traveling a set distance, dealing damage to enemies in the explosion's area-of-effect and decreasing their movement speed by 35% for 2s.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increases the movement speed decrease to 60%.

Upgrade 2.Name: Blaze Kick
Upgrade 2.Description: Jump backwards then kick while leaping towards a designated location, becoming Unstoppable during the jump and kick animation. Deal damage to enemies hit by the kick and shove them. The shoved enemies will have their movement speed decreased by 30% for 2s. If the shoved enemies come in contact with a wall, they will be stunned instead for 1s. Blaze Kick cannot go over walls.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increases the movement speed decrease to 50%. Increases the stun duration to 1.5s if hitting a wall.

Unite Move.Name: Spinning Flame Fist
Unite Move.Description: Perform a flaming punch around itself, dealing damage to nearby enemies hit and increase the user's movement speed by 20% for 4s. After using this move, the user switches to Punch Style and all Punch Style cooldowns are reset.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 9% Max HP Shield; Has an internal cooldown of 30s to activate Energy Amplifier; Has an internal cooldown of 60s to activate Buddy Barrier;

Passive Ability.Name: Natural Cure
Passive Ability.Description: Automatically cleanses this Pokémon every 6s, even if there are no effects to cleanse.

Blissey.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack after 6s, dealing increased damage. This boosted attack remains readied until used.

Move 1.Name: Pound
Move 1.Description: The user pounds in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and decreasing their movement speed by 40% for 2s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Egg Bomb
Upgrade 1.Description:
The user hurls an egg at the designated location that explodes, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and throwing them away from the center of impact for 0.8s. A maximum of 2 uses can be kept in reserve for this move, and there is a 2s cooldown between uses.

  If the user learns both Soft-Boiled and Egg Bomb, the uses kept in reserve for Egg Bomb is added to Soft-Boiled's reserve pool; this reserve pool is shared between both moves. The base cooldown for both moves becomes 5s. The cooldown between using the same move remains at 2s.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Decreases the movement speed of opposing Pokémon hit by 40% for 2s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Helping Hand
Upgrade 2.Description: The user increases the movement speed and basic attack speed of themself and nearby teammates by 30% for 4s. When buffed, the user's auto attacks also become boosted attacks.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increases the auto attack damage of all teammates buffed by this move by 15% for 4s.

Move 2.Name: Heal Pulse
Move 2.Description: The user restores the HP of themself and a designated teammate every 0.5s over 2s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Soft-Boiled
Upgrade 1.Description: The user throws an egg to a designated teammate, restoring the HP of themself and the designated teammate. The user and the designated teammate restore HP over time every 1s over 2s afterward. Subsequent uses of this move overwrites any HP over time the user and the designated teammate is yet to restore from previous uses. A maximum of 2 uses can be kept in reserve for this move, and there is a 2s cooldown between uses.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Gains 1 additional use kept in reserve.

Upgrade 2.Name: Safeguard
Upgrade 2.Description: The user cleanses themself and a designated teammate, and grants the user and the teammate a shield that makes them unstoppable for 4s.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Strengthens the value of the shield effect.

Unite Move.Name: Bliss Assistance
Unite Move.Description: The user becomes unstoppable and dashes to the designated ally Pokémon to give it an egg, granting that ally a shield and increasing their Attack and Sp. Atk by 20% for 6s. The user also intercepts 50% of the post-mitigation damage received by that ally as unmitigated damage for 6s. While dashing, opposing Pokémon hit are damaged and thrown into the air for 0.8s. When reaching the target ally, nearby opposing Pokémon are damaged again.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Beast Boost
Passive Ability.Description: When Buzzwole knocks out an enemy player, movement speed is increased by 100% and basic attack speed increased by 50% for 3s. When Buzzwole assists in knocking out an enemy player, movement speed is increased by 50% and basic attack speed increased by 25% for 3s. Each time Buzzwole hits an enemy with basic attacks, Mega Punch, Lunge, or Smack Down - muscle gauge increases. Conversely, when Buzzwole has been out of combat for 10s, muscle gauge depletes by 1 increment every 5s. Up to 6 muscle gauge increments can be stored.

Buzzwole.Attack: Each time a basic attack hits an enemy, increase muscle gauge by 1 increment. Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, throwing two consecutive punches while restoring Buzzwole's HP and increasing muscle gauge by 1 increment for each hit.

Move 1.Name: Mega Punch
Move 1.Description: Jump in the designated direction before slamming the ground with a powerful punch. The shock from the punch deals damage to enemies in the area. Muscle gauge increases by 1 increment for each target hit.

Upgrade 1.Name: Lunge
Upgrade 1.Description: Lunge in the designated direction, dealing damage to enemies, decreasing their Attack by 30% for 2.5s and slowing them by 30% for 1s. If this move deals damage, muscle gauge increases by 1 increment for each enemy hit. After this move is used, Buzzwole's basic attack speed is increased by 30% for 2s. Holds 2 uses in reserve and cannot be used more than once every 1s.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Whenever this move hits enemy players, Buzzwole's Attack increases by 10% for 2s for each player hit (up to a max of 5 stacks).

Upgrade 2.Name: Smack Down
Upgrade 2.Description:
Deliver an uppercut punch in the designated direction. The first Pokémon hit takes damage and is thrown into the air, ending with a slam on the ground that deals damage to all enemies in an area centered on the previously airborne enemy. Muscle gauge increases by 1 increment for each enemy damaged by the initial hit and slam.

  For a time after the initial hit, buzzwole can activate this move again to teleport to the target and slam them into the ground at their current position, ending the airborne travel instantly.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Widens the area-of-effect in which damage is dealt when the grappled enemy slams the ground. Additionally, muscle gauge will now increase by 2 increments for each enemy player hit from the slam.

Move 2.Name: Fell Stinger
Move 2.Description: Consumes the entire muscle gauge and has the user deal damage to an enemy in the designated direction, briefly shoving and stunning them for .2s. The damage dealt by this move increases for each muscle gauge increment consumed at a rate of 12.5% per increment. If this move knocks out any Pokémon, the user recovers 10% of maximum HP.

Upgrade 1.Name: Leech Life
Upgrade 1.Description:
Grab and restrain an enemy in the designated direction, becoming unstoppable and dealing damage-over-time while restoring Buzzwole's HP. When this move is used, consume the user's entire muscle gauge. The number of hits and the amount of damage dealt per hit increases for each muscle gauge increment consumed. Number of hits starts at 4 and increases by 1 per 2 increments of muscle gauge consumed. Initial damage increases by 1.5% per muscle gauge increment. This move ends if Buzzwole becomes unable to act for any reason or if the restrained enemy escapes by using an Eject Button or through some other means.

  Against Unstoppable Targets: Only 1 instance of increased damage and healing will occur.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Also causes each instance of damage dealt by this move to be stronger than the last by 5% additively.

Upgrade 2.Name: Superpower
Upgrade 2.Description:
Consumes the entire muscle gauge and has the user run in the designated direction and grab an enemy. The user then slams the target down on the ground at full strength, dealing damage to all enemies in the area. If Buzzwole is successful in grabbing a target, Buzzwole receives a shield that lasts for 2s. Buzzwole is unstoppable during this move.

  The damage dealt by this move is increased at a rate of 12.5% per muscle gauge increment.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Reduces the cooldown of this move by 3s when the user's muscle gauge reaches maximum.

Unite Move.Name: Ultra Swole Slam
Unite Move.Description: Buzzwole flies at high speed, dealing damage to enemies in the area-of-effect. Afterward, the user targets the enemy with the lowest percentage of HP remaining among those hit and charges down at them from the sky, dealing area damage once again and additional damage to the targeted enemy based on their missing HP. Buzzwole is Unstoppable during this move. Against Wild Pokemon: Missing HP damage is not dealt.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Flame Body
Passive Ability.Description: When Charcadet hits an enemy with an auto attack, Charcadet deals damage around themself with flames. This ability goes on a 4s cd after it's triggered.
Passive Ability.Description 2: When the user takes Attack-based damage, Ceruledge's movement speed is increased by 10% for 3s. This effect can stack up to 2 times. If Ceruledge deals damage to enemies with basic attacks or moves, the enemy hit receives a wound. Life energy leaks out of these wounds for 3s, causing damage on hit and then every 0.5s. This effect can stack up to 6 times, each stack after the first adding 50% of the first stack's damage and refreshing the duration of the damage over time. If the effect stacks 6 times on an enemy, that Pokémon takes 15% increased damage from Ceruledge.

Ceruledge.Attack:
Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing increased damage.

Becomes a boosted attack every 4 attacks, dealing damage twice. The next basic attack after using a move becomes a boosted attack, lunging Ceruledge towards the target. After evolving to Ceruledge, basic and boosted attacks have an additional 20% lifesteal.

Move 1.Name: Lava Plume
Move 1.Description: Torch the area around the user with an inferno of scarlet flames, dealing damage to enemies hit. The user's next basic attack deals 15% increased damage.

Upgrade 1.Name: Bitter Blade
Upgrade 1.Description: Ceruledge focuses bitter feelings towards the world of the living into a slashing attack. The user recovers HP equals to 50% of the damage dealt with this move. Damage dealt to wild Pokémon only heals for half of the normal amount. Any HP recovered that exceeds the user's max HP is converted into a shield.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increases the amount of HP recovered to 70% of damage dealt.

Upgrade 2.Name: Psycho Cut
Upgrade 2.Description: Ceruledge launches a blade formed by psychic power in the designated direction, dealing damage and slowing enemies hit by 30% for 3s, and reducing their Defense for 4s. If Ceruledge hits enemies with a basic attack, this move's cooldown is reduced by 0.5s.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increases the Defense reduction of enemies hit by this move.

Move 2.Name: Take Down
Move 2.Description: Has the user charge recklessly in the designated direction, dealing damage to enemies hit. The user's basic attack speed is increased by 20% for 3s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Phantom Force
Upgrade 1.Description: Dash and disappear into darkness, where Ceruledge hides for 1s. While hiding, Ceruledge cannot move. When this move is used again or after 1s has passed, the user appears in the designated direction while slashing around themself, dealing damage that ignores Defense and shields of enemies and applies a 60% slow to them. If this move hits an enemy, this move's cooldown is reduced by 40% of the max cooldown.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Reduces this move's cooldown by 2s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Flame Charge
Upgrade 2.Description:
Ceruledge cloaks themself in flame and charges in the designated direction, dealing damage to enemies hit. Ceruledge's basic attack speed is increased by 30% for 3s after using this move. A maximum of 2 uses can be kept in reserve for this move.

  There is a 1 second cooldown between each use, which is reduced with cooldown reduction.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Ceruledge's basic attack speed is instead increased for 5s after using this move.

Unite Move.Name: Revenant Rend
Unite Move.Description: Ceruledge charges both of their arm blades gaining unstoppable and 70% Damage reduction for 0.5s before slashing through to the designated location, leaving Ceruledge unable to act for 0.7s. Ceruledge also leaves enemies hit unable to act for 0.7s and applies a mark to them. After 0.7s, marked enemies are dealt damage with three slashing blows. The mark can be cleansed, preventing the damage.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Infiltrator
Passive Ability.Description: When this Pokémon deals damage, receive a stacking buff that makes Special damage dealt by this Pokémon ignore 2.5% of Special Defense per stack. This buff lasts 4s, can stack up to 8 times, and the duration refreshes when gaining a new stack.

Chandelure.Attack: Gains a Boosted Attack every 5s, dealing increased damage, slowing enemies by 30% for 2s and burning enemies hit for 2.5s.

Move 1.Name: Ember
Move 1.Description: Shoot out a small flame, dealing damage to Pokémon it hits, slowing them by 30% for 2s and leaving them burned for 2.5s. After the first cast, this move may be used again within 5s before going on full cooldown. Burns tick every 0.5s for 5 damage ticks.

Upgrade 1.Name: Flamethrower
Upgrade 1.Description:
Shoot an intense blast of fire in the designated direction, dealing damage to Pokémon and leaving them burned for 2.5s. The end of the blast explodes, dealing increased damage. If the explosion hits a Pokémon, this move's cooldown is reduced by 65% of its current cooldown.

  Burns tick every 0.5s for 5 damage ticks.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: If the explosion hits a Pokémon, Chandelure deals 20% increased damage for 3s. This effect also applies to the triggering explosion itself.

Upgrade 2.Name: Overheat
Upgrade 2.Description:
Throws consecutive flames in an arc into designated areas up to 3 times by holding the move input down. Pokémon in the area are hit and are left burned. The area may be aimed and changed during the use of this move. When one of the flames hits a Pokémon, the user gains one heat energy. If this move is used again, an exploding flame is shot out, dealing damage to Pokémon based on the heat energy and leaves them burned. The exploding flame hitting with 0, 1 or 2 heat energy reduces the cooldown of this move by 75%, 50% or 30% respectively. After the follow-up attack, the user cannot use basic attacks for a short time.

  Burns tick every 0.5s for 5 damage ticks.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: This move's cooldown is reduced by 1s.

Move 2.Name: Night Shade
Move 2.Description: Makes Pokémon in the area of effect see a frightening mirage, dealing damage to them and marking them. When Chandelure deals damage again to the marked Pokémon, the marked Pokémon are stunned for 1s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Poltergeist
Upgrade 1.Description: Create a zone of mysterious power and mirages of floating furniture. Pokémon that come in contact with a mirage take damage. Pokémon that come in contact with a mirage or the edge of the zone are slowed by 65% decaying to a 40% slow over 1s. Then the 40% slow lingers for an additional second.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increases the slow to 80% for 1s decaying to 50% for 1s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Imprison
Upgrade 2.Description: Creates a zone in front of itself lasting 4s. The first enemy caught in the zone will be immobilized for 0.7s. Furthermore, all enemy Pokémon in the zone or enter the zone become imprisoned and cannot use Moves.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Changes the Imprison to briefly immobilize all Pokémon caught in the zone on creation.

Unite Move.Name: Ignite Midnight
Unite Move.Description: Reduce the vision of enemies around itself by 30% for 3s. If this Unite Move is used again, Chandelure continuously fires a beam of fire in a designated direction, dealing damage to Pokémon it hits. The beam may be redirected while firing and its final blast deals increased damage. Ignite Midnight can be cancelled early.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 40% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Blaze
Passive Ability.Description: While at 50% max HP or below, this Pokémon's critical-hit rate is increased by 20%.

Charizard.Attack:
Breathes fire at opposing Pokémon, dealing damage 4 times per basic attack. Charizard may move while attacking but is slowed by 5% while breathing fire. Charizard deals additional damage to opposing Pokémon that have been burned by the user's moves. This additional damage cannot land critical hits; additional damage benefits from regular lifesteal. Basic attacks gain increased range upon evolving into Charmeleon and into Charizard.

Against wild Pokémon: total damage is capped at 250 per hit. CHARIZARD'S BASIC ATTACKS ARE A SET ANIMATION LENGTH. ATTACK SPEED HAS NO EFFECT ON THIS POKÉMON. DO NOT USE RAPID FIRE SCARF ON CHARIZARD.

Move 1.Name: Flame Burst
Move 1.Description: The user attacks with a flame in the designated direction which bursts on the first opposing Pokémon hit or after traveling max distance, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and burning them for 4s (dealing damage 5 times). When this move hits, the user's movement speed is increased by 20% for 3s. The Attack of opposing Pokémon burned by this move is decreased by 5%.

Upgrade 1.Name: Flamethrower
Upgrade 1.Description:
The user attacks with a blast of fire in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon in a line and burning them for 4s (dealing damage 5 times). When this move hits, the user's movement speed is increased by 40% for 3s. The user is able to move freely when using this move.

  The Attack of opposing Pokémon burned by this move is decreased by 5%.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increases the damage of this move and its burns.

Upgrade 2.Name: Fire Punch
Upgrade 2.Description:
The user dashes with a fiery fist forward, damaging opposing Pokémon hit and shoving them, and burning the first opposing Pokémon hit for 4s (dealing damage 5 times).

  The Attack of the target burned by this move is decreased by 5%.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Reduces this move's cooldown by 0.4s per target hit every time the user's basic attack hits an opposing Pokémon. (1.6s total for an entire basic attack animation on a single target).

Move 2.Name: Fire Spin
Move 2.Description: The user shoots fire in the designated direction which bursts into a vortex of fire on the first opposing Pokémon hit or after traveling max distance, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect. The vortex of fire remains for 5s, dealing damage over time to opposing Pokémon in the area of effect every 0.5s (up to 10 times) and decreasing their movement speed by 25% for 1s when hit.

Upgrade 1.Name: Fire Blast
Upgrade 1.Description: The user shoots an intense blast of fire in the designated direction which explodes on the first opposing Pokémon hit or after traveling max distance, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect. The blast of all-consuming fire remains on the ground for 5s, dealing damage over time to opposing Pokémon in the area of effect every 0.5s (up to 10 times) and decreasing their movement speed by 30% for 1s when hit. The user is able to move freely when using this move.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increases the damage of this move and the damage over time.

Upgrade 2.Name: Flare Blitz
Upgrade 2.Description: The user charges at the designated opposing Pokémon cloaked in fire, damaging opposing Pokémon, throwing the target, and granting the user a shield for 5s when this move hits.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Decreases the movement speed of the target by 40% for 3s when this move hits.

Unite Move.Name: Seismic Slam
Unite Move.Description: The user briefly becomes unstoppable and grabs the designated Pokémon from the opposing team. The target is bound, and the user and the target become invincible as the user flies up then slams them onto the ground, damaging the target and nearby opposing Pokémon, dealing an additional 8% max HP damage to each opposing Pokémon hit. The user gains hindrance resistance the moment they slam into the ground and fly up into the air for 10s. While flying in the air, the user is able to use basic attacks and move freely over obstacles. Unite Move basic attacks burn opposing Pokémon for 1s (dealing damage 2 times). The user restores HP for 80% of the damage dealt with Unite Move basic attacks (excluding burns or additional damage). Damage dealt by burns from Unite Move basic attacks also benefit from regular lifesteal. The Attack of opposing Pokémon burned by Unite Move basic attacks is decreased by 5%.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 50% Movement Speed, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Blaze
Passive Ability.Description: When at 50% max HP or below, increases critical-hit rate by 10% and auto attack speed by 20% for 5s (30s CD).  When hitting an opposing Pokémon with an auto attack or move, places a cinder on the target for 5s; applies 2 cinders with boosted attacks and moves. When placing a 5th cinder on a target, consumes the cinders, dealing additional damage to the target.

Cinderace.Attack:
Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack or after using a move, dealing increased damage. Boosted attacks remain readied until used.

Against wild Pokémon: basic attack damage is capped at 1000; boosted attack damage is capped at 1300.

Move 1.Name: Ember
Move 1.Description: Shoots a small flame at the designated opposing Pokémon, damaging the target and burning them for 3s (dealing damage 3 times). The Attack and Sp. Atk of the burned target are decreased by 5% for 2s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Pyro Ball
Upgrade 1.Description:
Kicks up a stone and ignites it, then kicks the ball of flame in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon hit and burning them for 3s (dealing damage 3 times).

  The Attack and Sp. Atk of burned opposing Pokémon are decreased by 5% for 2s.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Reduces the cooldown of Flame Charge or Feint by 4s when this move hits.

Upgrade 2.Name: Blaze Kick
Upgrade 2.Description:
Becomes unstoppable and performs a fiery flying kick dashing toward the designated opposing Pokémon, damaging the target with a guaranteed critical hit, shoving them for 0.5s, and burning them for 3s (dealing damage 3 times); then jumps back a set distance from the target or in the direction of movement and becomes vulnerable to hindrances when they land.

  The Attack and Sp. Atk of the burned target are decreased by 5% for 2s.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increases basic attack speed by 45% for 3s when this move hits.

Move 2.Name: Low Sweep
Move 2.Description: Dashes forward with a low sweep, damaging opposing Pokémon in their path.

Upgrade 1.Name: Flame Charge
Upgrade 1.Description: Dashes forward cloaked in flame, damaging opposing Pokémon in their path.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: The next boosted attack after this move ends decreases the movement speed of the opposing Pokémon hit by 30% for 2s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Feint
Upgrade 2.Description: Becomes invincible for 0.73s while dodging and increases their movement speed by 40% for 2s.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: The next 3 auto attacks after dodging restore HP for 30% of damage dealt.

Unite Move.Name: Blazing Bicycle Kick
Unite Move.Description: Becomes unstoppable and kicks up a giant ball of flame, then kicks it toward the location of the designated opposing Pokémon. The ball releases a fierce shock wave upon impact, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect, dealing additional missing HP damage to those hit; and increasing movement speed by 10% for 5s when this Unite Move hits.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 35% Attack Speed, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Magic Guard
Passive Ability.Description: This Pokémon receives a shield for 3s when restoring an ally Pokémon's HP. The strength of this shield is proportional to 50% of the amount of HP restored.

Clefable.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing increased damage.

Move 1.Name: Heal Pulse
Move 1.Description: Immediately restores HP to itself and nearby allies.

Upgrade 1.Name: Moonlight
Upgrade 1.Description: Continually restores HP to Clefable and nearby allies for 3s at one tick per half second excluding activation at 0s. Clefable’s movement speed is increased by 20% while this move is active.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Widens this move’s area-of-effect and increases the duration of its effects by 1s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Draining Kiss
Upgrade 2.Description: Attacks nearby enemies with an energy-draining kiss. Each enemy hit by the kiss receives damage and releases an air kiss. These air kisses will travel to a nearby ally with the lowest HP and restore their HP. If no allies are near, the air kisses will return to Clefable and restore its HP for 180% of the damage dealt.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Widens this move’s area-of-effect and increases the amount of HP restored to 200% of the damage dealt.

Move 2.Name: Disarming Voice
Move 2.Description: Let out a charming cry, dealing damage to nearby enemies and decreasing their movement speed by 40% for 2s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Gravity
Upgrade 1.Description: Create a gravity zone centered on Clefable that persists for 3s. Inside the gravity zone, auto attacks change and deal increased damage. Enemies in the gravity zone have their movement speed decreased by 15% stacking up to 3 times gaining a stack whenever a set amount of time passes. These enemies are also unable to use Dash moves. If an enemy attempts to enter the gravity zone with a dash move, the dash move is stopped and that enemy is left unable to act for 1s.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Widens this move’s area-of-effect and increases the duration of its effects to 4s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Follow Me
Upgrade 2.Description: Clefable moves to the designated location while waving its finger receiving a 3s shield. Attention of enemies hit and enemies near the designated location are drawn. These drawn enemies are forced to approach the user and attack Clefable with their auto attacks for 2s.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increases Clefable's Defense by 150 for 3s and Sp. Def by 100 for 3s when this move is used.

Unite Move.Name: Wonder Wish
Unite Move.Description: Clefable waggles their finger, restoring HP to allies in the area-of-effect. The lower an ally's HP is, the more HP this move restores to that ally. Afterward, Clefable gets a random move that can be performed by using the Unite Move again within 10s. Note: Some random moves will activate immediately.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Triage
Passive Ability.Description: Increases movement speed by 25% when near ally Pokémon at 50% max HP or below. Stores up to 8 flowers; consumes all flowers when using Synthesis, Floral Healing, or Sweet Kiss while attached, boosting their effects. Gains 1 flower every 1.5s. Gains 4 flowers when entering tall grass while detached (5s CD). Attaches to a designated ally Pokémon when using Synthesis, Floral Healing, or Sweet Kiss while detached, granting a Triage shield effect to the ally based on Comfey's max HP.  While attached: becomes untargetable, restores 1% max HP every 1s; takes Aeos energy gained in excess of the maximum the ally can hold, and scores the same amount of Aeos energy into a goal as the ally if not using a move while the ally channels the score. Detaches from the ally in the designated direction when the button to return to base is used (or a separate detach button on mobile). When detaching: removes the Triage shield effect from the ally; becomes invincible for 0.5s, and readies a boosted attack.

Comfey.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing increased damage and gaining 2 flowers when it hits.

Move 1.Name: Synthesis
Move 1.Description: If detached attaches to the designated ally Pokémon and grants them a Triage shield effect. If attached to an ally Pokémon: restores the HP of the ally. Restores additional HP with for each flower that is consumed (up to 8 flowers).

Upgrade 1.Name: Floral Healing
Upgrade 1.Description:
If detached: attaches to the designated ally Pokémon and grants them a Triage shield effect.

  If attached to an ally Pokémon: restores the HP of the ally; restores additional HP for each flower that is consumed (up to 8 flowers). Converts any HP restored in excess of the ally Pokémon’s max HP into an overheal shield effect for 5s when this move is used (up to 4 times, refreshing duration with additional uses); adds additional value to the overheal shield effect for each additional flower that is consumed.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: While attached: increases the movement speed of the ally Pokémon by 30% for 2s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Sweet Kiss
Upgrade 2.Description:
If detached: attaches to the designated ally Pokémon and grants them a Triage shield effect; adds additional shield value to the Triage shield effect with Sweet Kiss.

  If attached to an ally Pokémon: charges power for up to 2.5s, reaching maximum charge after 1.5s; then infatuates opposing Pokémon in the area of effect when released for a minimum of 0.6s. Increases the range of this move with charging. Infatuated Pokémon are unable to act and approach the user against their will. Infatuates opposing Pokémon hit for an additional 0.1s for each flower that is consumed (up to an additional 0.8s with 8 flowers; maximum 1.4s). (Note: it is impossible to use Sweet Kiss with fewer than 2 flowers due to the rate of gaining flowers and the cooldown reduction cap.)
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: While attached: increases the movement speed of the ally Pokémon by 50% for 2s while charging power.

Move 2.Name: Vine Whip
Move 2.Description: Strikes out with whiplike vines in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon in the line area of effect and decreasing their movement speed by 40% for 2s when it hits. While attached to an ally: increases this move's range.

Upgrade 1.Name: Magical Leaf
Upgrade 1.Description:
Launches 3 curious, scattering leaves every 1s for 5s (up to 18 leaves) at random opposing Pokémon in the area of effect (even when in tall grass or in stealth), prioritizing Pokémon from the opposing team; damaging opposing Pokémon and applying a mark to them for 4s when hit by a leaf. When a marked target is damaged by 6 leaves, stuns them for 0.5s.

  While attached to an ally: increases this move's range of targeting.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increases the number of leaves launched to 4 leaves every 1s (maximum 24 leaves).

Upgrade 2.Name: Grass Knot
Upgrade 2.Description:
Unleashes vines in the designated direction, damaging up to two opposing Pokémon hit and immobilizing them. If this move hits two opposing Pokémon (within 75% of this move's max range from each other), pull the second target to the first target's location and deal additional damage to both.

  While attached to an ally: increases this move's range.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increases this move’s area of effect.

Unite Move.Name: Flowery Fields Forever
Unite Move.Description: Briefly becomes unstoppable and creates a large area of tall grass around their location for 6s. Pokémon in this tall grass cannot be seen, just as with other tall grass on the map. Restores the HP of teammates in this Unite Move's tall grass every 0.5s. Gains special flowers from this tall grass, which grant access to an empowered use of Floral Healing or Sweet Kiss.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Gulp Missile
Passive Ability.Description: This Pokémon can catch some form of prey in their mouth when entering Whirlpool, Surf, or Dive. When receiving damage, counterattacks by spitting the prey in their mouth at an opposing Pokémon, damaging them and bouncing to 1 other opposing Pokémon nearby.  When above 50% max HP, catches Arrokuda as prey, which also decrease opposing Pokémon's Defense by 20% and Sp. Def by 5% for 3s. When below 50% max HP, instead catches Pikachu as prey, which decrease opposing Pokémon's movement speed by 50% and attack speed by 10% for 1s.

Cramorant.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every fourth attack, catching some form of prey. This boosted attack spits prey at an opposing Pokémon, damaging them and bouncing to 1 other opposing Pokémon nearby.

Move 1.Name: Whirlpool
Move 1.Description: The user creates a whirlpool at a designated location, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect over 1.8s (up to 10 times). The area of effect shrinks in size over the duration; opposing Pokémon standing at the outer edge of the whirlpool are hit only up to 3 times. The movement speed of opposing Pokémon in the area of effect is decreased by 50% for 0.2s when hit. The user can enter the whirlpool to catch prey for Gulp Missile (up to 2 times).

Upgrade 1.Name: Surf
Upgrade 1.Description:
The user sends a wave in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon in the wave. The wave reaches its maximum distance after 0.8s, then returns to its starting point at the same speed, damaging opposing Pokémon and pulling them with the returning wave, stunning them for 0.4s during the pull.

  The user catches prey with the first wave, and can enter the returning wave to catch more prey for Gulp Missile.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: The first wave decreases the movement speed of opposing Pokémon hit by 40% for 3s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Dive
Upgrade 2.Description:
The user becomes unstoppable for 0.5s as they change the designated location into a puddle then dive to the puddle, damaging opposing Pokémon and shoving them for 0.5s when the user emerges from the puddle. The next boosted attack within 5s deals additional damage; boosted attacks after 5s have passed become regular boosted attacks. A maximum of 3 uses can be kept in reserve for this move, and there is a 2s cooldown between uses.

  The user catches prey for Gulp Missile as they emerge from the puddle.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increases the damage of the dive.

Move 2.Name: Feather Dance
Move 2.Description: The user throws a circle of feathers at the designated area, decreasing the Attack of opposing Pokémon in the area of effect by 30% and their movement speed by 20% for 4s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Hurricane
Upgrade 1.Description: The user creates a fierce wind at the designated location. After 0.5s, a hurricane catches opposing Pokémon in the area of effect, damaging them and throwing them for 1s.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increases the user's movement speed by 20% for 3s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Air Slash
Upgrade 2.Description: The user shoots out 5 blades of air in a cone in the designated direction, damaging the first opposing Pokémon hit with each blade. The user also hops backward to create distance. This move's cooldown is reduced by 0.5s for each blade that hits (up to 2.5s).
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Restores the user's HP for each blade of air that hits an opposing Pokémon.

Unite Move.Name: Gatling Gulp Missile
Unite Move.Description: The user becomes unstoppable for up to 6.5s and catches a series of prey to spit at the nearest Pokémon from the opposing team or wild Pokémon up to 10 times. The user cannot move or use moves while using Gatling Gulp Missile. The user can use this Unite Move again to cancel it early. The prey caught for each Gatling Gulp Missile attack depends on the user's current HP. If a boosted attack is readied when this Unite Move is used, the user spits this prey out first as a regular boosted attack before catching and spitting out up to 10 Gatling Gulp Missile prey.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Max HP Shield granted at the start of the Move, 30% Movement Speed granted at the end of the turret

Passive Ability.Name: Sturdy
Passive Ability.Description: For every 7% missing HP, this Pokémon's Defense and Sp. Def are increased (up to 10 times; maximum at 70% missing HP or more).

Crustle.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and decreasing their movement speed by 40% for 2s.

Move 1.Name: Rock Slide
Move 1.Description: The user drops large rocks at the designated location, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and stunning them for 1s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Rock Tomb
Upgrade 1.Description:
The user splits open the ground in a line towards the designated location, damaging opposing Pokémon in the path and decreasing their movement speed by 60% for 2s. A curved wall of rock is then created at the designated location that remains for up to 3s. When the wall of rock is created or destroyed, opposing Pokémon near the wall are damaged and their movement speed is decreased by 60% for 2s.

  The user can use this move again to destroy the wall of rock early.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Strengthens the movement speed decrease from this move to 80%.

Upgrade 2.Name: Shell Smash
Upgrade 2.Description:
The user becomes unstoppable as they smash their shell over 0.8s, reducing their base Defense and Sp. Def stats to 0 and converting 40% of the value lost to bonus Attack and Sp. Atk respectively for 4.5s. The user's movement speed is increased by 75% for the duration of the buff (decaying by 5% every 1s; minimum 55% increased movement speed before the buff ends).

  All modifiers (except emblem color bonuses) work with 0 base Defense and Sp. Def for the duration of this buff.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Strengthens the conversion rate from lost Defense and Sp. Def to bonus Attack and Sp. Atk to 50%.

Move 2.Name: Fury Cutter
Move 2.Description: The user slashes once with their claw while dashing slightly in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon hit. Targets hit by Fury Cutter receive a mark for 9s that stacks with subsequent Fury Cutter hits (up to 3 times). Subsequent hits of this move on marked targets have 20% increased damage (maximum 40% increased damage on the third and subsequent hits from this move). Additional stacking damage from this move is always rounded up.

Upgrade 1.Name: Stealth Rock
Upgrade 1.Description:
The user launches a cluster of rocks in the designated direction which expands into a trap of levitating rocks on the first opposing Pokémon or wall hit, or after traveling their max distance. This trap deals damage to opposing Pokémon in the area of effect every 0.5s over 4s (up to 8 times). Subsequent hits on targets hit by the trap within 1.5s have 15% increased damage; this damage increase stacks with subsequent hits from that trap (maximum 105% increased damage on the eighth hit).

  Additional stacking damage from subsequent hits for each trap is always rounded up.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: The trap of levitating rocks remains for 1s longer; this move can hit up to 10 times (maximum 135% increased damage on the tenth hit). Also decreases the movement speed of opposing Pokémon hit by 35% for 1s.

Upgrade 2.Name: X-Scissor
Upgrade 2.Description: The user dashes and attacks with crossed claws three times in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon and shoving them for 0.2s with each attack. The third hit stuns opposing Pokémon for 1.5s if they are shoved into a wall.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Reduces this move's cooldown by 1s.

Unite Move.Name: Rubble Rouser
Unite Move.Description: The user becomes unstoppable as they summon a whirlwind of rocks around them, gaining a shield, and stunning nearby enemies for 1s. For 10s after, the whirlwind of rocks damage nearby opposing Pokémon every 1s. If the user receives damage during Rubble Rouser, the user deals additional revenge damage to nearby opposing Pokémon (2s CD). The value of the shield gained from Rubble Rouser is equal to 40% max HP + 600.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 40% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Bad Dreams
Passive Ability.Description: When an enemy is forcibly put to sleep near Darkrai, Darkrai deals damage to the target and gains a boosted attack. When Darkrai uses this boosted, every enemy that has been marked with bad dreams in the last 2.7s is attacked simultaneously. Sleeping enemies near Darkrai take damage over time, and Darkrai deals 10% more damage to them while they remain asleep. Damage from this Ability doesn't wake up sleeping enemies.

Darkrai.Attack: Basic attacks made against sleeping enemies will become boosted attacks with greatly increased range. Boosted attacks deal damage to enemies with an attack from a void and restore Darkrai's HP. Darkrai does not require vision to perform a boosted attack against a sleeping target.

Move 1.Name: Hypnosis
Move 1.Description: Send a hypnotic suggestion in the designated direction, dealing damage to the first enemy it hits. After 1s, the enemy will fall asleep for 2s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Dark Void
Upgrade 1.Description: Fire a ball of darkness at an enemy. Additional balls of darkness will be thrown at each enemy within in the area of effect. Enemies hit will be dealt damage and marked. The mark lasts 5s. When Darkrai deals damage to marked enemy, the marks are removed and the Enemy falls asleep for 2s.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Applies a 40% slow for 3s when applying a mark to an enemy.

Upgrade 2.Name: Shadow Claw
Upgrade 2.Description: Slash in a designated direction with sharp claws made from shadows, dealing damage in a line, applying a 40% slow for 3s and marking enemies hit. When the user deals damage twice to marked enemies, that marked enemy falls asleep for 2s and has their mark removed. When this move hits, this move can be used again. The second use of this move hits a designated target with huge claws, dealing damage. If there are any opposing Pokémon suffering from Bad Dreams, the second use of this move will deal increased damage.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increases the damage dealt by this move.

Move 2.Name: Calm Mind
Move 2.Description: The user focuses their mind, increasing their Special Attack and Special Defense by 30% for 3s and Movement Speed by 50% for 3s, decaying by 10% every 0.5 seconds to a minimum of 10%.

Upgrade 1.Name: Nasty Plot
Upgrade 1.Description:
Dash a short distance, gaining a Nasty Plot counter for 7s and refreshing the duration of all current counters. Upon using a basic attack, consume all nasty plot counters to deal damage to one of the targets hit. Upon using a boosted attack, turn the boosted and all nasty plot counters into a series of projectiles, hitting every target of Darkrai's boosted.

  A maximum of two counters may be held. Nasty Plot has no cooldown between dashes.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Gain one charge of this move in reserve when an enemy falls asleep.

Upgrade 2.Name: Dark Pulse
Upgrade 2.Description:
Hide in a shadow and create additional shadows around the hiding spot. Darkrai may freely move between the shadows. When this move is used again and held, the move ends and Darkrai appears from the shadow it dealt damage from. When this move is used again but is not held or after 4s elapses, Darkrai appears from the shadow they are currently hiding in, deals damage to enemies hit, then returns to the original shadow. Dark Pulse may then be used one more time if the move was only tapped. Darkrai will leave the shadow after 4s, dealing damage to all enemies in the shadow that Darkrai appears from.

  While hiding, Shadow Claw may be used to attack from the shadow that is being hidden in. Shadow Claws used this way will not apply the Shadow Claw mark to targets hit and deals reduced damage.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Dealing damage with this move causes Darkrai to gain a shield for 2.5 seconds.
