Unite Move.Name: Worst Nightmare
Unite Move.Description: The user becomes unstoppable and casts a sleeping spell on the designated Pokémon from the opposing team. If the target is successfully put to sleep, the user's moves' cooldowns are reset, the target is marked to receive 3% max HP damage over time every 0.5s over 10s (up to 21 times; maximum 63% max HP damage as Sp. Atk-based damage), and the user sends that target into a nightmare realm centered on their initial location for up to 8s. The user follows the target into the nightmare realm. While inside the nightmare realm, Darkrai and the target are unaffected by goal zones, jump pads, and Berries. Other Pokémon outside of the nightmare realm cannot target Darkrai or their target while they're inside. If the designated Pokémon from the opposing team cannot be put to sleep, this Unite Move is canceled and 90% of the Unite Move gauge is refunded. This energy regeneration is affected by Energy Amplifier.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 80% Movement Speed, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Long Reach
Passive Ability.Description: Increases Decidueye's auto attack and move damage by 20% to distant enemies.

Decidueye.Attack: Increases the speed of auto attacks by 3% for 2.5s after one hits. This effect can stack up to 4 times, and with every third activation of this effect, auto attacks become boosted attacks for a short time. These boosted attacks fire more quills, but the damage dealt by each quill is decreased.

Move 1.Name: Leafage
Move 1.Description: Pelts leaves in the designated direction, dealing damage in a cone to enemies hit (only hits once). For a short time after using this move, Decidueye’s Attack is increased by 10% (this also affects Leafage) and auto attack speed is increased by 25% for 3s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Razor Leaf
Upgrade 1.Description:
Summons whirling razor leaves. While active, Decidueye's auto attack is replaced by a new auto attack that targets up to 2 additional enemies in range, as well as increasing Attack by 10% and auto attack speed. This buff lasts for 5.5s.

  Adds one tick of additional damage: 2% of the main target's remaining HP and 1% for secondary targets.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Adds one tick of additional damage: 2% of the main target's remaining HP and 1% for secondary targets.

Upgrade 2.Name: Spirit Shackle
Upgrade 2.Description: Charges power before firing a large arrow in the designated direction. Damage dealt increases the longer power is charged (with 6 breakpoints and a max-charge at 1.3s), but movement speed is decreased by 25% while charging. If this move hits after power is charged to the maximum, it can stitch enemies to the ground. The affected enemy has their movement speed decreased by 80% for a short time when exiting the area, and receives damage upon leaving the area. A maximum of 3 uses can be kept in reserve for this move. There is a 2s cooldown between uses.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Deals 15% increased damage to enemies with less than 50% remaining HP.

Move 2.Name: Astonish
Move 2.Description: Deals damage to enemies and decreases their movement speed by 80% for a short time.

Upgrade 1.Name: Leaf Storm
Upgrade 1.Description: Creates a tempest of sharp leaves, dealing damage to enemies it hits and decreases their movement speed by 60% for 2.5s. The slow decays at 10% per 0.5s up to four times. At point-blank range, it also shoves and stuns enemies hit for 1s.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Movement speed decrease now lasts 3.5s but still decaying up to four times at 10% per 0.5s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Shadow Sneak
Upgrade 2.Description: Decidueye creates a shadow that lasts for up to 5s, increasing Decidueye's movement speed by 70% for 2s, decaying by 20% every 0.5s, and reveals all opposing Pokémon in range temporarily. Pokémon that are sneaking remain invisible but can be targeted by the shadow giving away their position if they were within the initial cast range. Afterwards the shadow will automatically target an enemy player that is visible to Decidueye, inflicting damage, lowering their movement speed by 30% for 1s, and decreasing their Defense by 60% for 1.5s. Wild Pokémon that are currently aggressive can also be targeted but are otherwise ignored.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Defense reduction of enemies is increased to 80%.

Unite Move.Name: Nock Nock
Unite Move.Description: Fires quills in the designated direction, dealing damage to enemies but does not pierce through them. The move ends by unleashing a large quill that deals damage to all enemies it hits (30% more damage if the target is below 50% HP) but Nock Nock can be cancelled early. While using this move, Decidueye becomes unstoppable but is unable to move.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Max HP Shield granted at the start of the Move, 30% Movement Speed granted at the end of the turret

Passive Ability.Name: Blaze
Passive Ability.Description: When using a move when below 50% max HP, that move deals additional damage with a fireball to enemies (15s CD).

Delphox.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing increased damage when it hits.

Move 1.Name: Ember
Move 1.Description: Shoot a small flame in front of itself, dealing damage to enemies hit.

Upgrade 1.Name: Fire Blast
Upgrade 1.Description: Delphox launches an intense, all-consuming fire in a forward direction; dealing damage to enemies hit. As the fire travels, it leaves behind a zone of flames in which a delayed explosion will occur; dealing damage to enemies in the area-of-effect.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Damage increased.

Upgrade 2.Name: Mystical Fire
Upgrade 2.Description: Delphox unleashes a special, hot ball of fire in a forward direction. If it hits an enemy, the fire will explode; dealing damage to enemies in the area-of-effect.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Also reduces cooldowns of all moves if this move hits by 1s. If it hits an enemy player, cooldowns are reduced even further (1.5s).

Move 2.Name: Will-o-Wisp
Move 2.Description: Conjure up sinister flames and launch them toward the designated area. These flames then explode, dealing damage to enemies hit by the explosion and decreasing their movement speed by 30% for 2s. An enemy will only be counted as being hit by one flame and one explosion, even if all 3 flames visually hit.

Upgrade 1.Name: Fire Spin
Upgrade 1.Description: Create a vortex of fire in the designated area. The vortex automatically moves toward the nearest enemy, dealing damage-over-time to all enemies caught in the area for a short time and decreasing their movement speed by 30% for 4s. After 3.5s passes or an enemy is caught in the center of the vortex; the flames increase in intensity causing a trap activation. This increases the rate at which the flames deal damage and also leaves the enemies unable to act for 1s. This trapped damage ticks four times total. The Fire Spin will otherwise deal damage as it travels. Move placement on top of enemies will apply a 'searching' tick and then apply 'trapped' damage. A maximum of 9 ticks is possible.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Applies a debuff on trap activation that increases all damage dealt by Delphox by 15% for 3s. Debuff is only cleansable after the first tick of trap damage and does not re-apply the debuff.

Upgrade 2.Name: Flame Charge
Upgrade 2.Description: Delphox charges forward in the designated direction. If there are any enemies within auto attack range when the charge ends, summon three flames to attack. These flames deal damage and decrease enemy movement speed by 30% for 2s. This move can be used while also using Fire Blast or Mystical Fire. Each subsequent flame that hits deals 70% less.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increases Delphox's movement speed by 30% for 2s when this move is used.

Unite Move.Name: Fanciful Fireworks
Unite Move.Description: Deals damage-over-time to enemies in the designated area for 8s. Enemies that are hit have 50% decreased movement speed and 50% reduced HP recovery effects for 1.75s. Recovery effects are weakened within the zone and cannot be cleansed while in the zone. Leaving the zone will have the weakened HP recovery effects linger for 1.75s and may be cleansed after leaving the zone. 8s duration (ticks at 0.5s intervals).
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Steelworker
Passive Ability.Description: Dhelmise is granted a shield whenever one of the user's moves deals damage to Pokémon from the opposing team (5s cd). Each time this Ability or other effects grant the Pokémon a shield, the Pokémon's next basic attack deals increased damage. This effect can stack up to 3 times. When the shield granted by this ability expires after 3s, HP proportional to the amount of remaining shields is restored.

Dhelmise.Attack:
The user attacks by slamming their body.

Dhelmise has no boosted attack.

Move 1.Name: Payback
Move 1.Description: Has the user swing their anchor, dealing damage and applying a 30% slow for 2s to opposing Pokémon hit. The user deals increased damage if Dhelmise was hit with an attack while this move is being used.

Upgrade 1.Name: Power Whip
Upgrade 1.Description: Has the user slash their anchor horizontally in front of themself, dealing damage, applying a 40% slow for 2s, and granting the user a shield for 3s. The edge of the anchor deals additional damage and leaves the opposing Pokémon it hits unable to act for 0.5s instead of slowing them.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increases the duration opposing Pokémon are left unable to act to 1s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Whirlpool
Upgrade 2.Description:
Dhelmise swings their anchor diagonally, dealing damage and applying a 40% slow for 2s to opposing Pokémon hit. Every third time this move is used, it generates a whirlpool centered on the user for 2s, continuously pulling in nearby opposing Pokémon every tick. This move's cooldown is reduced by 0.8s every time Dhelmise hits with a basic attack.

  Dhelmise can auto attack and cast moves while the whirlpool is active.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Further reduces this move's cooldown by 1.5s every time the user hits with a basic attack.

Move 2.Name: Bulldoze
Move 2.Description: Has the user shake the ground by slamming their anchor, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon and throwing them for 0.5s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Anchor Shot
Upgrade 1.Description:
Has the user throw their anchor in a designated direction catching the first opposing Pokémon hit, dealing damage and leaving them unable to act. The user then pulls the target toward Dhelmise.

  Stun duration is 0.6s from close range, and 0.8s at max range.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Debuffs the targeted opposing Pokémon, increasing the amount of damage they receive from all sources by 50% for 0.8s or for as long as the target is being incapacitated.

Upgrade 2.Name: Heavy Slam
Upgrade 2.Description: The user lobs their anchor in a designated direction dealing damage to opposing Pokémon at the central point of impact and leaving them unable to act for 0.5s. Opposing Pokémon near the point of impact take damage and are slowed by 40% for 2s. The user then slams their heavy body down at the anchor's point of impact, dealing damage and applying an additional 40% slow for 2s to opposing Pokémon hit.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: When the user slams their heavy body down, opposing Pokémon at the center of the point of impact are left unable to act for 0.5s.

Unite Move.Name: Seaweed Snare
Unite Move.Description: Has the user throw their anchor and ensnare a designated Pokémon from the opposing team, dealing damage and leaving the target unable to act for 0.45s. The user then charges at the target, dealing damage and leaving them unable to act for 0.45s. If other Pokémon from the opposing team are hit by the anchor or the charge, they take damage and are shoved for 0.7s. Applies a cleansable damage over time effect to Pokémon on the opposing team that deals damage on hit and every 0.5s up to 9 times, healing Dhelmise with each tick based on damage dealt. The duration of the DoT is refreshed with each hit of the Unite Move.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Run Away
Passive Ability.Description: This Pokémon receives 10% increased movement speed when within a radius of enemy Pokémon. While moving, the sprint gauge charges from 0 to 10 (2% increased movement speed per increment). At full, Dodrio runs at 20% increased movement speed. If movement speed is decreased below a threshold, the sprint gauge will rapidly deplete. When Doduo scores a goal, it evenly divides its collected Aeos energy into two portions and deposits them into the goal one at a time. As Dodrio, this is split into three portions to deposit in the goal one at a time. Only goals made by a full emptying of the Aeos Ball will count towards stacking items.

Dodrio.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack. Attacking with a full sprint gauge turns the attack into a charge in the facing direction. If the sprint gauged attack hits an enemy, all cooldowns are reduced by 1s.

Move 1.Name: Peck
Move 1.Description: Jabs forward with Doduo's beaks. When using the move, Doduo stops moving and loses sprint gauge due to dropping below the sprint gauge gaining threshold. When the sprint gauge is full, Doduo charges forward to jab the in the facing direction and fully consumes the sprint gauge.

Upgrade 1.Name: Tri Attack
Upgrade 1.Description:
Dodrio attacks with their beaks in a cone in front of themself, dealing damage to enemies and applying one of the following random effects to enemies hit: Burn, Paralyze, or Freeze. When the sprint gauge is full, Dodrio instead shoots out 3 projectiles in the facing direction. If a projectile hits an enemy, the projectile deals damage but only the first projectile of random colour/type applies one of the following enhanced random effects to enemies hit: Burn, Paralyze, or Freeze corresponding to the colour/type. After this move is used, Dodrio's next basic attack deals additional damage and restores HP. Holds 2 uses in reserve and cannot be used more than once every 1s.

  Burn: 8% Attack decrease for 2s, 12% Attack decrease if Sprint empowered. Paralyze: 8% Attack Speed decrease and 10% Movement speeed decrease for 2s, 12% Attack Speed decrease and 15% Movement speed decrease if Sprint empowered. Freeze: 20% Movement speed decrease for 2s, 40% if Sprint empowered.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: The next auto attack gains additional healing by 3% of max HP. When using full sprint gauge attack the charge time for this move is additionally reduced by 1s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Drill Peck
Upgrade 2.Description: Dodrio strikes forward with their sharp beaks multiple times, dealing damage to enemies hit. If used with a full sprint gauge, consume the sprint gauge and dash forward while striking with their sharp beaks multiple times, dealing damage to enemies hit and shoving them. During this dash, Dodrio receives 20% reduced damage.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Reduces base cd by 2s and restores a portion of Dodrio's HP equal to 30% of damage dealt by the flat damage (percent damage excluded).

Move 2.Name: Quick Attack
Move 2.Description: Dash forward, increasing the user's movement speed by 30% for 2s and dealing damage to enemies hit. This move's cooldown is reduced by 1.5s if it hits an enemy.

Upgrade 1.Name: Agility
Upgrade 1.Description: Become immune to hindrances for 0.5s and adds to the sprint gauge. Afterward, movement speed is increased by 20% for 4s, and the sprint gauge charges faster.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Fully charges the sprint gauge on use.

Upgrade 2.Name: Jump Kick
Upgrade 2.Description: Dodrio leaps forward while kicking. If this move makes contact with an enemy or obstacle, Dodrio leaps over it, stunning enemies by 0.5s, and stomps the ground when landing, dealing damage to enemies in the area-of-effect, slowing by 25% for 2s, and the sprint gauge charges by 75%. If this move makes contact with an enemy, that enemy is stunned briefly from getting kicked in the head and this move's cooldown is reduced by 3s.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Enemies in the area of the landing are also stunned for 0.6s.

Unite Move.Name: Triple Trample
Unite Move.Description: Dodrio runs to a designated location. If Dodrio makes contact with an enemy while running, they are dealt damage and thrown into the air for 1s. When Dodrio arrives at the designated location, Dodrio gains 25% increased Attack and loses 5% Sp. Attack for 3s, is granted a 10% Max HP shield for 3s, and the sprint gauge charges faster for 6s. Damage dealt at the designated location is affected by the Attack bonus. Dodrio is unstoppable during this move.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 80% Movement Speed, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Clear Body
Passive Ability.Description: Reduces the duration of debuffs inflicted on this Pokémon.

Dragapult.Attack:
Becomes boosted attacks when the boosted attack gauge is full, dealing increased damage in an area of effect centered on the opposing Pokémon they hit.

Each time the user deals damage to opposing Pokémon, the boosted attack gauge increases by 1, becoming full when the user deals damage 8 times. After not dealing damage for 3s, the boosted attack gauge decreases by 2 every 0.5s.

Move 1.Name: Astonish
Move 1.Description: Lets out a sound blast in a forward direction. The shout explodes when it hits an enemy or after traveling a set distance, dealing damage in an area and decreasing enemy movement speed by 30% for 2s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Dragon Breath
Upgrade 1.Description:
The user exhales a mighty gust in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and decreasing their movement speed by 30% for 2s. The gust leaves the ground burning for 3s, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon in the area of effect every 0.5s (up to 7 times) and decreasing their movement speed by 30% for 2s.

  If this move is used while the user is flying with Dragon Dance, the mighty gust is exhaled along Dragon Dance's flight path instead, with the same effects; the burning ground can hit up to 9 times.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increases the damage of this move and the burning ground; strengthens the movement speed decrease to 45%.

Upgrade 2.Name: Shadow Ball
Upgrade 2.Description: The user hurls a shadowy blob in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon hit and applying a marker with 4 parts to them for 5s; then dashes in the chosen direction forward. When the user hits a marked target, one part of the marker is consumed to deal additional damage. The fourth part of the mark deals increased additional damage and removes the mark when consumed, and the user restores 15% max HP.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increases the damage of this move and the additional damage from marks.

Move 2.Name: Quick Attack
Move 2.Description: Dashes in the designated direction, increasing basic attack speed by 40% for 2s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Dragon Dance
Upgrade 1.Description:
The user prepares a circular flight path in the designated direction, then moves into a direction either side to fly on the path; the flight path takes 3.5s to complete. While flying, the user increases their basic attack speed by 200% and they continuously use auto attacks, dealing 10% reduced damage to opposing Pokémon hit. If this move is used again while the user is flying, the user stops flying, becomes briefly invincible and dashes a short distance forward. If the user knocks out a Pokémon from the opposing team, this move's cooldown is reset. If the user assists in knocking out a Pokémon from the opposing team instead, this move's cooldown is reduced by 50%.

  When this move is used, Dragon Breath's cooldown is reset.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: While the user is flying, auto attacks restore the user's HP for an additional 25% of damage dealt.

Upgrade 2.Name: Phantom Force
Upgrade 2.Description:
The user enters stealth for up to 6s or until using an attack, increasing their movement speed by 30% and increasing the boosted basic attack gauge by 1 every 1s. When the user exits stealth, the user's basic attack speed is increased by 85% for 3s.

  When this move is learned, if the user knocks out a Pokémon from the opposing team, this move's cooldown is reset and the user's Attack is increased by 8 until the end of the battle (up to 10 times; maximum 80 bonus Attack).
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Reduces this move's cooldown by 0.5s per opposing Pokémon hit by the user's auto attacks.

Unite Move.Name: Dreep and Destroy
Unite Move.Description: The user launches two Dreepy at up to 2 different opposing Pokémon in range, damaging them and dealing additional missing HP damage to each target. If there is only one target in range, the second Dreepy deals 30% of the full damage to the target. A maximum of 2 uses can be kept in reserve for this Unite Move; there is a 2s cooldown between uses for this move. Against wild Pokémon: additional missing HP damage is capped at 1200.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 10% Max HP Shield, 10% Movement Speed for 3s; Has an internal cooldown of 30s to activate Energy Amplifier; Has an internal cooldown of 60s to activate Buddy Barrier;

Passive Ability.Name: Marvel Scale
Passive Ability.Description: Increases Defense by 100 for 1.5s when afflicted by a status condition (Dratini and Dragonair only).
Passive Ability.Description 2: When damaged by an enemy player, gain a buff that reduces damage taken by 30% for 2.5 seconds. This ability has a 15 second cooldown.

Dragonite.Attack:
Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, blasting water in front of Dratini, dealing increased damage, reducing the cooldown of Dratini's moves by 1s, and recover 5% max HP when this hits.

The boosted attack alternates between water and electric with every use of a boosted attack. If the water attack hits, it triggers the same effects as Dratini's boosted attack. If the electric attack hits, it leaves enemies unable to act for 0.5s and reduces the cooldown of Dragonair's moves by 1s when this hits.

The boosted attack alternates between water, electric, and fire with every use of a boosted attack. If the water or electric attack hits, it triggers the same effects as Dragonair's boosted attack. If the fire attack hits, it deals additional damage equal to 10% of the enemy's remaining HP (capped at 1200 dmg against wilds) and reduces the cooldown of Dragonite's moves by 1s when this hits.

Move 1.Name: Twister
Move 1.Description: Creates a twister and releases it in the designated direction, dealing damage to enemies hit and decreases their movement speed by 50% for 1s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Dragon Dance
Upgrade 1.Description: Dash in a designated direction, alternating each use between a left arc, right arc and a direct dash. After using this move, grant a buff increasing attack speed of the next 3 auto attacks by 80% for 4.5s, increasing movement speed by 30% for 1s, increasing Attack by 8% (capping at 24%), as well as increasing the stage of Hyper Beam. This buff stacks up to 3 times, and the duration is reset to full on reuse. All stacks are removed after a few seconds. Auto attacks reduce the cooldown of this ability by 1s.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Further increases Dragonite's movement speed by 10% for 4.5s if there are enemies nearby when the dance ends.

Upgrade 2.Name: Extreme Speed
Upgrade 2.Description: Dash toward the designated enemy, damaging and slowing all enemies in a small radius around the target upon impact by 50% for 2s, throwing the primary target and shoving others away. Using this move resets the cooldown of Multiscale.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: If Dragonite's movement speed is currently decreased when this move is used, that movement speed decrease is negated before the move is used.

Move 2.Name: Dragon Breath
Move 2.Description: Exhale a mighty gust in the designated direction. If this move hits an enemy, Dragonite's next attack becomes a boosted attack.

Upgrade 1.Name: Hyper Beam
Upgrade 1.Description:
Fires a beam of energy toward the targeted enemy after a delay, dealing damage to all enemies that it hits, as well as additional damage based on their Max HP. The move changes Stages based on the number of stacks of Dragon Dance that Dragonite has, from 0 to 3. The max HP damage is 0%/5%/10%/15%, determined by the current Stage. Dragonite cannot act while releasing the beam.

  Against Wild Pokémon: The additional damage from max HP is capped at 600/1200/1800/2400 depending on the stage.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Reduces damage taken by 50% while charging this move.

Upgrade 2.Name: Outrage
Upgrade 2.Description: Dragonite stomps the ground, dealing damage to enemies in an area around Dragonite with the bonus effect of the last Boosted Attack that was used. Additionally, Dragonite gains a buff for 5.5s, increasing auto attack speed by 35% for 5.5s, converting all attacks during the duration of Outrage into melee Boosted Attacks, and alternating through the water, electric, and fire Boosted Attacks in order. When the buff ends, Dragonite is stunned for .7s.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Reduce the duration of hindrances inflicted on Dragonite while rampaging by 40% for 5.5s.

Unite Move.Name: Draco Impact
Unite Move.Description: Briefly fly up in the air, becoming untargetable, before crashing down, approximately 2s after activating, with several comets on a designated area, dealing damage and throwing enemies in the area for 0.5s. The farther Dragonite flies, the more the Unite gauge is consumed (50% at min distance and 100% at max). Dragonite is unstoppable while using this move.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 35% Attack Speed, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Heavy Metal
Passive Ability.Description: Prevents Duraludon from being thrown or shoved by the first attempt to throw or shove them. This ability goes on cooldown after it's triggered (50s cd).

Duraludon.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, shooting a long beam that deals a large amount of damage to all enemies hit.

Move 1.Name: Laser Focus
Move 1.Description: Reduces damage received by 20% for .6s. Afterward, Duraludon's auto attacks deal additional damage to enemies hit. This buff expires after 8s or after 3 auto attacks.

Upgrade 1.Name: Flash Cannon
Upgrade 1.Description: Duraludon ruptures the ground around themself and in a designated direction; dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect and decreasing their movement speed by 50% for 1s. Afterward, go into "Cannon Mode" rooting Duraludon for 6s or if a basic attack is not made for 2.5s or this move can be cancelled early. While in Cannon Mode, basic attacks have longer range, attack speed is increased by 100% but decays by 20% per second over 5 seconds, dealing increased damage and splash damage. Exiting "Cannon mode" will prematurely remove the attack speed buff. Metal Claw, Stealth Rock, Dragon Tail, and boosted attacks can be used while in this mode and boosted attacks decrease the movement speed of enemies hit by 60% for 1s and also pierce.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Enemies in the ruptured ground's area of effect are also unable to act for 1s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Dragon Pulse
Upgrade 2.Description: Duraludon begins charging power, slowing itself by 30%. The longer the move is charged the greater the damage and area of effect. After learning this move a mark will be applied to any enemy Duraludon damages with auto attacks and moves. Each tick of damage from Duraludon (boosted attack counts as 1 instance) will apply 1 mark up to a maximum of 5 orbs and 1 ring. This mark lasts for 5s, is refreshed when Duraludon deals damage to the marked enemy and can be cleansed. When Dragon Pulse hits a marked enemy, the marks are consumed and additional damage is dealt for each mark. Opposing Duraludon's can consume the user's marks but will not gain the additional damage. Furthermore, if this move knocks out an enemy, the cooldown is reduced by 30% and Duraludon receives a buff for 8s or 3 auto attacks. While this buff is active, auto attacks deal additional damage and reduce this moves cooldown by 1.5s each.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Also restores 8% of Duraludon's max HP if this move knocks out an enemy player.

Move 2.Name: Metal Claw
Move 2.Description: Send sharp claws forward; dealing damage to enemies hit and decreasing their movement speed by 30% for 2s. After this move is used, Duraludon's next auto attack becomes a boosted attack.

Upgrade 1.Name: Dragon Tail
Upgrade 1.Description: Duraludon shoves enemies for 0.5s and moves itself backward a short distance. The next auto attack becomes a boosted attack. This move ignores obstacles. A maximum of 2 uses can be kept in reserve for this move. There is a 2.5s cooldown between uses.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Apply a mark for 5s that is consumed the next time Duraludon damages them, dealing additional damage.

Upgrade 2.Name: Stealth Rock
Upgrade 2.Description:
Hurl a stone at the designated area, creating an invisible field of stones for 60s or until triggered. The field deals damage over time to enemies in the area of effect and decreases their movement speed by 25% for 2s, stacking up to 4 times. If the hurled stone hits an enemy before the designated area, the field will instead be centered on where the stone hit that Pokémon. Once an enemy takes damage from the field, it will become visible to all enemies. When the field becomes visible this way, Duraludon is granted a shield for 3s, can stack a maximum of 5 times, and the duration is refreshed upon gaining a stack. If an enemy takes damage from this move 2 times, that enemy becomes unable to move for 1s. After this move is used, Duraludon's next auto attack becomes a boosted attack. A maximum of 2 uses can be kept in reserve for this move. There is a 1s cooldown between uses.

  A maximum of 2 Stealth Rocks may be on the game field at one time, but 2 more can still be kept in reserve.

  A maximum of 2 Stealth Rocks may be on the game field at one time, but 3 can be kept in reserve.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: A maximum of 2 Stealth Rocks may be on the game field at one time, but 3 can be kept in reserve.

Unite Move.Name: Revolving Ruin
Unite Move.Description: Fire a beam of light at the ground in a sweeping circle around Duraludon, becoming unstoppable during the rotation. If this beam hits an enemy, it deals damage to them, grants Duraludon a shield and increases Attack by 8% for 8s. Both the shield effect and the Attack increase are strengthened for each enemy that is hit by the beam, stacking up to 5 times. Damage is dealt to any enemy in the area of effect after the beam of light is fired and enemies are shoved for 0.5s. A burning ring is also left where the beam of light touched the ground for 10s; enemies that touch this ring take additional damage every 0.5s and have their movement speed decreased by 50% for 1s. Subsequent hits after the first have the Attack stat bonus from this move applied to them.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 35% Attack Speed, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Cotton Down
Passive Ability.Description: When at least 5% max HP damage is received in a single attack, restores this Pokémon's HP and increases their movement speed by 15% for 1.5s; deals revenge damage to nearby opposing Pokémon and decreases their movement speed by 30% for 1.5s (10s CD).

Eldegoss.Attack:
Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, attaching a bit of cotton fluff to opposing Pokémon for 3s and then damaging them. The user and their teammates' auto attacks against targets with cotton fluff on them deal additional damage and decrease their movement speed by 20% for 1s.

Each teammate uses their own Sp. Atk to deal additional damage on targets with cotton fluff. This additional damage has an internal cooldown of 0.35s for each teammate.

Move 1.Name: Leafage
Move 1.Description: The user shoots a bundle of leaves in the designated direction which explodes on the first opposing Pokémon hit or after traveling max distance, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and decreasing their movement speed by 40% for 2s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Pollen Puff
Upgrade 1.Description:
The user throws a Pollen Puff at the designated location which attaches to the nearest Pokémon within 0.5s. The Pollen Puff explodes 2s after attaching to a Pokémon, restoring the HP of the user's teammates and damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect.

  The Pollen Puff explodes on its own after 1s with the same effects if it doesn't attach to any Pokémon within the first 0.5s of landing.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: If the Pollen Puff attaches to a teammate, it reduces the damage that teammate receives by 15% for 2s before it explodes. If the Pollen Puff attaches to any Pokémon, opposing Pokémon that come in contact with the target receive damage over time every 0.5s before the Pollen Puff explodes.

Upgrade 2.Name: Leaf Tornado
Upgrade 2.Description:
The user launches a tornado of sharp leaves in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon hit by the tornado and creating a path in its wake that lasts for 4s. Teammates on the path have their movement speed increased by 55%, lingering for 1.5s after leaving the path. When the tornado reaches max distance, the tornado damages opposing Pokémon a second time.

  Effects that only depend on auto attacks hitting and not on auto attacks dealing damage still occur.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Effects that only depend on auto attacks hitting and not on auto attacks dealing damage still occur.

Move 2.Name: Synthesis
Move 2.Description: The user uses sunlight to heal themself and teammates in the area of effect.

Upgrade 1.Name: Cotton Guard
Upgrade 1.Description: The user grants teammates in the area of effect cotton shields for 3s. After 3s, any cotton leftover is used to restore the HP of teammates with cotton shields for 15% of the remaining shield value.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increases the movement speed of teammates in the area of effect by 30% for 2s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Cotton Spore
Upgrade 2.Description:
The user gathers spores around them for 2s, increasing their movement speed by 40% for 2s. The spores burst at the end, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect, throwing them for 0.5s and decreasing their movement speed by 40% for 2s when it hits.

  Cotton Cloud Crash can be used during this move, ending the move early and making the spores burst immediately.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increases the user's Defense and Sp. Def by 50% for 2s.

Unite Move.Name: Cotton Cloud Crash
Unite Move.Description: The user becomes invincible as they float into the air for up to 3s, moving freely over obstacles and increasing their movement speed by 10% while in the air. If used again or after 3s, the user pounds the ground, restoring the HP of the user and teammates in the area of effect, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and shoving opposing Pokémon hit for 0.7s.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 30% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Torrent
Passive Ability.Description: When this Pokémon deals damage to opposing Pokémon, or as time passes, the Torrent gauge increases to a max of 100. If a move is used when the Torrent gauge exceeds 50, 50 points of the gauge is consumed and the move becomes boosted.  The rate at which the Torrent gauge increases depends on your current HP with thresholds at: above 66% HP, below 66% HP, and below 33% HP. Every second gain 1/2/3 Torrent gauge.

Empoleon.Attack:
Piplup shoots a blast of water, becoming a boosted attack with every third attack dealing increased damage. Basic and Boosted attacks increase Torrent gauge by 2/3/4.

When evolved into Prinplup or Empoleon, basic attacks become melee ranged. The user slices with their wings, becoming a boosted attack with every third attack dealing increased damage. Boosted attack increases Torrent gauge by 10/15/20.

Move 1.Name: Water Gun
Move 1.Description: The user blasts a forceful shot of water in the designated direction, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon it hits. Increases Torrent gauge by 10/15/20 when under 50 Torrent gauge. When empowered by Torrent, this move deals increased damage.

Upgrade 1.Name: Hydro Cannon
Upgrade 1.Description:
The user launches a watery blast in the designated direction, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon it hits and stunning them for 0.5s. Increases Torrent gauge by 10/15/20 when under 50 Torrent gauge.

  When empowered by Torrent, this move leaves behind a whirlpool for 3s which deals damage to opposing Pokémon, and heals the user when they stand in it, every 0.5s.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Reduces this moves cooldown by 30% of the remaining cooldown when it hits Pokémon from the opposing team.

Upgrade 2.Name: Whirlpool
Upgrade 2.Description:
The user becomes unstoppable for 1s as they create a violent swirling whirlpool around themself, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon every 0.25s up to 4 hits. The user's HP is restored by 40% of the damage dealt against Pokémon on the opposing team, and by 20% against wild Pokémon. Increases Torrent gauge by 10/15/20 when under 50 Torrent gauge.

  When empowered by Torrent, this move will throw opposing Pokémon for 0.6s and the user will slash once at the end of the move in the designated direction extending the unstoppable duration to 1.33s. The healing of the move is increased to 50% of the damage dealt against Pokémon on the opposing team, and 25% against wild Pokémon.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increased damage.

Move 2.Name: Peck
Move 2.Description: The user jabs its sharply pointed beak in the designated direction, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon it hits. Increases Torrent gauge by 10/15/20 when under 50 Torrent gauge. When empowered by Torrent, this move applies a 40% slow for 2s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Metal Claw
Upgrade 1.Description:
Has the user charge towards a designated target, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon with wings of steel and shoving them for 0.25s. Increases Torrent gauge by 10/15/20 when under 50 Torrent gauge.

  When empowered by Torrent, this move grants the user a shield for 3s. This shield will not stack with itself.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increased the shield from Torrent.

Upgrade 2.Name: Aqua Jet
Upgrade 2.Description:
Has the user lunge at blinding speed in the designated direction, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon it hits and increasing the user's basic attack speed by 40% for 5s. Increases Torrent gauge by 10/15/20 when under 50 Torrent gauge.

  When empowered by Torrent, this move will also lower the special defense of those hit by 60% for 3s.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Lowers the base cooldown of this move by 1s.

Unite Move.Name: Sovereign Slide
Unite Move.Description: Has the user slide at high speed in the designated direction and form a whirlpool on impact, or when the maximum distance is reached, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon it hits and throwing them for 1s. The whirlpool remains centered on the user for 7s and applies a 50% slow to opposing Pokémon in the area. The slow lasts 1s when opposing Pokémon leave the area. Empoleon is unstoppable throughout this move. The longer the user slides, the faster the recovery to perform other actions. Increases Torrent gauge by 10/15/20 when the move connects. While the whirlpool is active the amount of Torrent gauge gained per second is increased to 12/18/24.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Anticipation
Passive Ability.Description: When Eevee would be affected by a hindrance, the hindrance is negated and Eevee becomes immune to hindrances for a short time (35s cd). Note: Hindrances include slows; multi-layered hindrance moves such as Pikachu's Volt Tackle will only have the very first launch negated.
Passive Ability.Description 2: When Espeon would be affected by a hindrance, the hindrance is negated and Espeon becomes immune to hindrances for a short time. At the same time, this ability deals damage to the enemy that attempted to inflict the hindrance and applies a 30% slow for 1s (35s cd). Note: Hindrances include slows; multi-layered hindrance moves such as Pikachu's Volt Tackle will only have the very first launch negated.

Espeon.Attack:
Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing increased damage.

Becomes a boosted attack whenever a set amount of time passes (5s cd), firing a beam in front of the user. The beam deals increased damage and decreases the movement speed of targets hit by 30% for 1s.

Move 1.Name: Swift
Move 1.Description: Eevee launches three stars at target location. Stars start in a horizontal line perpendicular to Eevee's facing. Stars continue to fly in the direction once past the target location until the maximum range is reached. When an enemy is hit by a star, subsequent stars deal 70% less damage.

Upgrade 1.Name: Psyshock
Upgrade 1.Description: Espeon materializes psychic projectiles and launches them at a designated location; dealing damage to enemies hit by the projectiles and decreasing their movement speed for each projectile hit by 15% for 3s (maximum 75%). Orbs start in a horizontal line perpendicular to Espeon's facing and continue flying in the designated direction until the maximum range of the move. Targets hit by all five projectiles are stunned for 1.25s. When an enemy is hit by a projectile, subsequent projectiles deal 70% less damage. When Psyshock is enhanced via Future Sight reset, it launches stronger psychic projectiles at a designated location. These projectiles at their point of convergence cause an explosion, dealing damage to enemies in the area-of-effect. There is no damage increase.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increase the speed at which projectiles travel.

Upgrade 2.Name: Stored Power
Upgrade 2.Description: Unleash blasts of psychic power at random enemies within an area; dealing damage to enemies hit and decreasing their movement speed from each projectile hit by 10% for 2s (maximum 50%). Espeon stores one blast of psychic power every 2s (unaffected by cooldown reduction), or after hitting an enemy with a boosted attack (gaining 1 stored blast per enemy hit). Up to five blasts can be stored at once. After this move is used, Espeon's movement speed is increased by 70% for 1.2s. Targets hit by a psychic blast will take 70% less damage from subsequent hits. When Stored Power is enhanced via Future Sight reset, it unleashes an increased number of psychic blasts (8 total) and restores Espeon's HP by 150 per blast.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Also deals additional damage to enemies below 50% max HP.

Move 2.Name: Growl
Move 2.Description: Growl at a designated enemy; dealing damage and decreasing their movement speed by 30% for 2s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Psybeam
Upgrade 1.Description:
Fires a peculiar ray in the designated direction. If the beam hits an enemy, it will then split beyond the first enemy hit and deal damage to other enemies in range. The initial enemy hit and these split rays deal more damage based on the max HP of the first enemy hit by the ray. If the first enemy hit by the ray is slowed or is stunned, those same effects will be applied to the enemies hit by the split rays. The split rays will never go towards Espeon and will refract at a maximum of a 90 degree angle. Distance from initial target to split ray hit is 75% of the max range. Stun copied duration is the maximum duration of the stun causing the initial Pokémon to be stunned.

  For the split ray, the damage component from the initial target's max HP damage is capped at 1000 against Wild Pokémon and capped at 2000 against Player Pokémon.

  Against Wild Pokémon: The additional damage from max HP is capped at 1000.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Against Wild Pokémon: The additional damage from max HP is capped at 1000.

Upgrade 2.Name: Future Sight
Upgrade 2.Description:
Espeon locks-on to an enemy, dealing damage 2 seconds later in an area centered on the locked-on target. Deal more damage based on the locked-on targets missing HP. While locked-on to an enemy, Espeon's other moves will target that enemy whenever possible. If the center of Psyshock is within the area-of-effect of Future Sight when released, Psyshock will home in on the Future Sight affected target. Each time Espeon deals damage to a Future Sight locked-on target through Psyshock, Stored Power, auto attacks, Future Sight's cooldown is reduced by 0.8 seconds. If the locked-on target is an opponent, and is knocked out by Future Sight or by Espeon, then a single powered-up use of Psyshock or Stored Power becomes available for a short time.

  Full Heal and other cleanses such as Blissey's Natural cure remove Future Sight. Against Wild Pokémon: The total damage is capped at 1800.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Espeon deals 15% additional damage to locked-on targets.

Unite Move.Name: Psychic Solare
Unite Move.Description: Espeon throws enemies in the area of effect into the air and suspends them using psychic power. After a delay, an explosion occurs that deals damage to all enemies in the area of effect and shoves them. Espeon is unstoppable during this move.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Battle Armor
Passive Ability.Description: The critical-hit modifier of enemies is reduced by 50% when dealing damage to Falinks. Falinks can hold 10 more Aeos Energy than other Pokémon.  Falinks is a group comprised of the Brass and five Troopers. Each member of the group has a separate hitbox and counts as a different target. The Brass always takes 10% reduced damage. Troopers will take 90% less damage while attached to the Brass. For attacks or moves that can hit multiple targets, the total damage Falinks can take from a single move or attack is 110% of that move or attack's damage.  Falinks utilize three formations: Column formation, No Retreat formation, and Dispatch formation. When a move is used in No Retreat or Dispatch formation, the effect of the move changes.

Falinks.Attack:
Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, or after the user uses Tackle, Megahorn, or Iron Head. Boosted attacks also apply a 50% slow for 1s to opposing Pokémon they hit.

When a boosted attack hits, the cooldown of Tackle, Megahorn, or Iron Head is reduced by 2.5s

Move 1.Name: Tackle
Move 1.Description: Charge in the designated direction, dealing damage to enemies hit and shoving them. The user's next basic attack becomes a boosted attack.

Upgrade 1.Name: Megahorn
Upgrade 1.Description:
Charge with its horns, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon it hits and throwing them in the air for 0.25s. Immediately afterward, strike with its horns again and gain a shield for 2.5s.

  In No Retreat formation: Falinks becomes hindrance resistant and charges power for 1s. It then strikes forward with its horns, dealing additional damage to opposing Pokémon it hits based on their max HP and gaining a shield for 2.5s. This version of the move has a 4s cd that is separate from the column version.

  In Dispatch formation: The Brass will use the column version of Megahorn, the Troopers who are away from the column will use Megahorn too, each striking once in the direction of the target hit by the Brass.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increases the shield value.

Upgrade 2.Name: Iron Head
Upgrade 2.Description:
Attacks the designated area with its steel-hard heads, dealing damage and applying 50% slow for 1.5s to opposing Pokémon it hits, as well as granting itself a shield.

  In No Retreat formation: The move's range is shortened but the area of effect is widened. Pokémon hit in the landing area are also knocked up and briefly stunned for 0.33s. After using this move, for the next 4 attacks, the user can attack while moving with the Brass and Troops all deal damage separately in front of them.

  In Dispatch formation: When this move is used, the Brass will use the Column version of the move while recalling dispatched Troopers to the Column. The returning Troopers shove and deal damage to opposing Pokémon they hit on their way back to the Column, and give additional shield to Falinks.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Iron Head and the Troopers returning deal an additional 2% max hp damage to enemies they hit, capped to 400.

Move 2.Name: Bulk Up
Move 2.Description: Increases the user's Defense, Special Defense and Attack Speed by 25%, and Attack by 30% for 3s

Upgrade 1.Name: No Retreat
Upgrade 1.Description:
Switch to No Retreat formation while shoving enemies for 0.4s in front of Falinks and become unstoppable during the formation change for 0.5s. While in No Retreat formation, the user cannot change the direction they're facing, unless they use the other move. Falinks' movement speed when moving backward is slowed by 10%, but Attack is increased by 25% and damage taken from the front is reduced by 20%. If this move is used while the user is in No Retreat formation, the user will switch to Column formation.

  While in No Retreat formation both the Brass and Troopers take 20% less damage from the front. The Brass' total damage reduction becomes 28%; the Trooper's total damage reduction becomes 92%.

  While in No Retreat formation both the Brass and Troopers take 30% less damage from the front. The Brass' total damage reduction becomes 37%; the Trooper's total damage reduction becomes 93%.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: While in No Retreat formation both the Brass and Troopers take 30% less damage from the front. The Brass' total damage reduction becomes 37%; the Trooper's total damage reduction becomes 93%.

Upgrade 2.Name: Beat Up
Upgrade 2.Description:
Has the user charge in the designated direction, dealing damage to enemies hit. The user then switches to Dispatch formation, sending out two Troopers toward enemies that were hit. The dispatched Troopers will continue to attack enemies, but they will return to the Brass after they either: take a set amount of damage, become separated from the Brass by more than a set distance, or after 5s. A maximum of 2 uses can be kept in reserve for this move with a 0.5s cooldown between each use.

  While in Dispatch formation, the Troopers sent out no longer have any damage resistance nor share damage taken with the Brass. Dispatched Troopers share the same stats as the Brass, except for HP.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Also restores HP when this move hits.

Unite Move.Name: Dust Devil Formation
Unite Move.Description: Has the five troopers run continuously around the Brass at great speed for 5s, dealing damage and slowing enemies hit by 20% for 1s. Falinks is unstoppable during the formation change for 0.25s. While this move is being used, damage taken by the troopers is reduced. While in Dust Devil formation the Troopers take 30% less damage making the Trooper's total damage reduction 93%. Moving counter to the rotation of the troopers will grant more hits against that target, and moving along the rotation will reduce the number of hits.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 30% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Pastel Veil
Passive Ability.Description: The Pokémon's psychic counter charges based on the distance they run (up to 10 times). When the counter is full, the Pokémon is granted a shield, becoming hindrance resistant while the shield remains.  When the Pokémon reaches an additional movement speed threshold, the damage dealt by moves is increased by 5/20/35/50/60%. The increased damage based on movement speed is calculated before dealing damage with moves.  Please visit the FAQ to learn more!

Galarian Rapidash.Attack: Shoots energy from their horn, damaging the opposing Pokémon hit.

Move 1.Name: Confusion
Move 1.Description: The user releases a telekinetic force around themself, increasing their movement speed by 33% per opposing Pokémon hit for 5.5s (up to 2 times; maximum 66%) before damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect when it hits.

Upgrade 1.Name: Dazzling Gleam
Upgrade 1.Description:
The user emits a powerful flash around themself after a delay, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect when it hits. The user gains 1 stack of 11% increased movement speed per wild Pokémon hit by the outer edge of the flash, or 2 stacks per Pokémon from the opposing team hit for 5.5s (up to 9 stacks; maximum 99% increased movement speed) before damaging them. If the outer edge of the flash hits Pokémon from the opposing team, the cooldown of Tackle, Smart Strike, or Agility is reduced by 30% of its current cooldown, successively with each target hit.

  Against wild Pokémon: Dazzling Gleam damage is capped at 2500.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Strengthens the cooldown reduction of Smart Strike or Agility to 50% of its current cooldown successively per Pokémon from the opposing team hit by the outer edge.

Upgrade 2.Name: Fairy Wind
Upgrade 2.Description:
The user jumps to the designated location then stirs up a fairy wind when they land, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect. This move can be used again, up to 2 times total.

  If it's used 2 times, the third attack deals increased damage and throws opposing Pokémon for 0.8s when it hits.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Decreases the movement speed of opposing Pokémon hit by 20% for 2s with each use.

Move 2.Name: Tackle
Move 2.Description: The user charges at the designated opposing Pokémon, damaging them and decreasing their movement speed by 20% for 2s when it hits.

Upgrade 1.Name: Smart Strike
Upgrade 1.Description: The user charges at the designated opposing Pokémon and stabs them with their sharp horn, dealing damage when it hits. The user then leaps in a chosen direction, shoving the target in the opposite direction and stunning them for 1s.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Charges the user's psychic counter by 5 when this move hits.

Upgrade 2.Name: Agility
Upgrade 2.Description:
The user's movement speed increases by 20% when this move is used, increasing by an additional 7.5% every 0.5s over 3s (maximum 80% increased movement speed).

  This move's duration increases by 1.5s if the user moves or hits opposing Pokémon with moves (up to 5 times for an additional 7.5s; maximum 10.5s duration).
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Also restores 2% of the user's missing HP every 0.5s while their movement speed is increased by this move.

Unite Move.Name: Triad Blitz
Unite Move.Description: The user becomes unstoppable and charges at the designated opposing Pokémon, shoving opposing Pokémon in the way and stunning them for 0.8s when hit. When the charge ends, a mysterious triangular space is created around the designated opposing Pokémon if the user hits them. That Pokémon cannot leave that space. When the mysterious space is created, this move can be used again up to 3 times within 5.5s. With each additional use, the user runs at high speed forward, damaging opposing Pokémon in their path. If the path of a dash starts or ends in the mysterious space, this move can be used again immediately afterward.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Rough Skin
Passive Ability.Description: When damaged by a nearby opposing Melee Pokémon, reflects 30% of the damage received back to that opposing Pokémon as Attack-based damage (2s CD).

Garchomp.Attack:
Gains 1 stack toward boosted attacks after hitting an auto attack or move, stacking up to 5 times. At 5 stacks, all basic attacks become boosted attacks with increased attack speed and additional 30% lifesteal, dealing increased damage to opposing Pokémon, and dealing an additional 10% remaining HP damage to them. All stacks decay after 4s of not hitting an auto attack or move.

Against wild Pokémon: basic attack damage is capped at 1000; boosted attack damage is capped at 1100; additional remaining HP damage is capped at 350.

Move 1.Name: Sand Attack
Move 1.Description: The user hurls sand in the designated direction, reducing the field of vision of opposing Pokémon by 50% and decreasing their movement speed by 20% for 2s; increasing the user's movement speed by 30% for 2s and auto attack speed by 30% for 3s when this move hits.

Upgrade 1.Name: Dig
Upgrade 1.Description: The user digs underground, becoming untargetable while underground, and dashes quickly forward. The user then jumps out from underground beneath the first opposing Pokémon hit, after traveling max distance, or when coming into contact with an unpassable wall, increasing the user's Defense and Sp. Def for 4s, dealing damage to nearby opposing Pokémon and throwing them for 0.6s.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Strengthens the duration of the throw to 1s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Dragon Rush
Upgrade 2.Description:
The user jumps back and briefly channels, reducing damage received by 30% for 0.9s, and dives forward, dragging all enemies within a small radius to the designated location, then damaging nearby opposing Pokémon afterward.

  The user can use Dragon Claw during the first half of the channel to add the Dragon Claw hits as a combo attack. This combo attack scoops up opposing Pokémon, dealing damage with both Dragon Rush and Dragon Claw's first attack and stunning them. If the combo attack hits, the user then throws opposing Pokémon back down with the second Dragon Claw attack, dealing damage with a strengthened slow.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Becomes unstoppable during this move; this includes the combo attack with Dragon Claw.

Move 2.Name: Bulldoze
Move 2.Description: The user stomps down on the ground, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect.

Upgrade 1.Name: Earthquake
Upgrade 1.Description: The user jumps up and crashes forcefully to the ground, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and decreasing their movement speed by 20% for 2s. Two aftershocks follow the initial crash, dealing less damage to opposing Pokémon in the area of effect.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Strengthens the movement speed decrease of opposing Pokémon near the center of the crash to 40%.

Upgrade 2.Name: Dragon Claw
Upgrade 2.Description:
The user charges in the designated direction viciously and attacks with two claw swipes. The first attack damages opposing Pokémon and shoves them in the designated direction. The second attack deals more damage to opposing Pokémon and decreases their movement speed by 45% for 2s.

  When this move is used in a combo attack with Dragon Rush, the movement speed decrease on the second attack is strengthened to 60% for 2s.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increases the damage of both attacks.

Unite Move.Name: Livid Outrage
Unite Move.Description: The user goes berserk, becoming unstoppable and receiving 30% reduced damage for 5s while unleashing five powerful attacks in a row. The user dashes forward and damages opposing Pokémon in a unique designated area with each attack, taking a brief moment after each attack to aim the next dash. Every attack more damage than the last. The fifth attack throws opposing Pokémon hit and decreases their movement speed by 30% for 1s. The user is left confused for 0.5s afterward.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 30% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Synchronize
Passive Ability.Description: When an opposing Pokémon decreases this Pokémon's movement speed, also decreases that opposing Pokémon's movement speed by 40% for 3s; or, when an opposing Pokémon inflicts a damage-over-time status condition on this Pokémon, also inflicts a damage-over time effect on that opposing Pokémon for 3s (8s CD).

Gardevoir.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and decreasing their Sp. Def by 10% for 2s.

Move 1.Name: Confusion
Move 1.Description: The user fires a psychic bolt in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon hit and decreasing their movement speed by 35% for 1s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Psychic
Upgrade 1.Description: The user launches a psychic bolt in the designated direction which blasts on the first opposing Pokémon hit or after traveling max distance, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect. The blast creates a lingering field that slowly moves forward, dealing damage over time to opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and decreasing their movement speed by 50% for 1s (up to 5 hits). Each time this move hits opposing Pokémon, their Sp. Def is decreased by 27% for 4s (maximum 81%).
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Reduces this move's cooldown by 1s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Moonblast
Upgrade 2.Description: The user dashes back slightly and launches a blast of moonlight in the designated direction which bursts into a cone behind the first opposing Pokémon hit, stunning that opposing Pokémon for 1.2s and damaging all opposing Pokémon in the cone area of effect, including the target.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Grants the user a shield for 3s when launching the blast.

Move 2.Name: Teleport
Move 2.Description: The user readies a boosted attack and warps forward to the designated location. When this move is learned, passively increases the damage of Synchronize, auto attacks, and Confusion by 15% until this move is replaced.

Upgrade 1.Name: Psyshock
Upgrade 1.Description:
The user channels at a designated area relative to their position before launching three attacks in succession, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and reducing the user's moves' cooldowns by 15% with each attack that hits.

  The user is able to attack and move freely while channeling this move.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increases the damage of the next attack to hit each time an attack hits an opposing Pokémon.

Upgrade 2.Name: Future Sight
Upgrade 2.Description: The user sets a delayed explosion at the designated area, damaging opposing Pokémon when the delayed explosion hits. If this move hits a Pokémon from the opposing team, the cooldown of this move is reduced by 75% and the user's movement speed is increased by 40% for 1.5s.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Resets this move's cooldown when it hits a Pokémon from the opposing team.

Unite Move.Name: Fairy Singularity
Unite Move.Description: The user warps space in the designated area, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon and pulling them toward the center 4 times. As the warped space disappears, it deals increased damage to opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and shoves them away from the center.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Levitate
Passive Ability.Description: When this Pokémon has not been in combat for 5s, their movement speed is increased by 20%.

Gengar.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, lunging at an opposing Pokémon and dealing increased damage to opposing Pokémon hit.

Move 1.Name: Will-o-Wisp
Move 1.Description: The user shoots 3 sinister flames in a cone in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon hit and burning them for 4s. The first flame deals full damage to each target hit; subsequent flames deal 50% of the full damage to the same target. The burn deals damage over time every 0.5s for 2s (dealing damage 3 times), and decreases Attack and Sp. Atk by 10% for 4s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Shadow Ball
Upgrade 1.Description: The user hurls a shadowy blob in the designated direction which stops at the first Pokémon from the opposing team hit, damaging opposing Pokémon hit, decreasing their movement speed by 90% for 1s, and decreasing their Sp. Def for 3s.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increases the damage of this move.

Upgrade 2.Name: Sludge Bomb
Upgrade 2.Description:
The user hurls unsanitary sludge to the designated area, poisoning opposing Pokémon in the path of the hurl or in the designated area for 5s (dealing 1% max HP Sp. Atk-based damage every 0.5s; maximum 10%), and damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect where the sludge lands.

  Against wild Pokémon: poison damage is capped at 120 per tick.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Strengthens poison duration to 6s (dealing maximum 12% max HP Sp. Atk-based damage).

Move 2.Name: Lick
Move 2.Description: The user extends their tongue in the designated direction, stopping at the first opposing Pokémon hit, damaging the target and pulling them toward the user's location. The user readies a boosted attack when this move is used.

Upgrade 1.Name: Dream Eater
Upgrade 1.Description:
The user projects a hypnotic orb in the designated direction, putting the first opposing Pokémon hit to sleep for 1s and applying a Dream Eater marker on them for 5s. If a nearby opposing Pokémon has a Dream Eater marker or else is asleep when the hypnotic orb disappears, this move can be used again within 5s. This second use has the user instantly teleport behind the target, damaging the target, restoring the user's HP, and reducing the cooldown of Will-O-Wisp, Shadow Ball, or Sludge Bomb by 2s.

  The user readies a boosted attack each time this move is used. If the user knocks out a Pokémon from the opposing team, the cooldown of this move is reset.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increases the damage dealt and HP restored by this move.

Upgrade 2.Name: Hex
Upgrade 2.Description:
The user becomes invincible and vanishes, then reappears at the designated location, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect. If this move hits an opposing Pokémon afflicted by a status condition, the damage dealt to opposing Pokémon is doubled and the cooldown of this move is reduced by 90%.

  The user readies a boosted attack when this move is used.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increases the damage of this move.

Unite Move.Name: Phantom Ambush
Unite Move.Description: The user becomes unstoppable as they jump forward to the designated location, then enters stealth and increases their movement speed by 30% for 7s. The user exits stealth when they use an attack. If this Unite Move is used again, the user becomes invincible as they jump out to attack, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and decreasing their movement speed by 50% for 1.5s when it hits. The user readies a boosted attack each time this move is used.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 80% Movement Speed, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Run Away
Passive Ability.Description: When Eevee would be affected by a hindrance, the hindrance is negated and becomes invincible for 1s. This Ability goes on cooldown after it’s triggered (70s cd).
Passive Ability.Description 2: When Glaceon would be affected by a hindrance, the hindrance is negated. Glaceon then starts sneaking and becomes invincible for 0.5s. This Ability goes on cooldown after it’s triggered (70s cd) and is reset after respawning.

Glaceon.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing increased damage and giving Glaceon 2 ice crystals when the boosted attack hits. Ice crystals last 5s and the duration is refreshed upon gaining additional crystals. Glaceon can hold a maximum of 8 ice crystals at a time.

Move 1.Name: Swift
Move 1.Description: Creates 4 stars around the user. For a short time afterward, each time the user hits an enemy with a basic attack or boosted attack, one or two of the stars respectively will shoot out and deal additional damage to the target.

Upgrade 1.Name: Icicle Spear
Upgrade 1.Description:
Glaceon launches all of its stored ice crystals in rapid succession at the designated enemy. If Glaceon has no ice crystals when this move is used, 2 ice crystals are instantly created and are launched. Launched ice crystals can hit enemies on the opposing team that are not the designated target of this move. The crystals shatter when they hit any enemy, dealing damage to all enemies in the area. Ice crystals launched by this move deal 5% increased damage each time they hit the same enemy (capped at 35%). When this move is used, Ice Shard's cooldown is reduced by 2s and Freeze Dry's cooldown is reduced by 2.5s. A maximum of 12 ice crystals may be launched.

  Against Wild Pokémon: This additional damage is capped at 300.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Against Wild Pokémon: This additional damage is capped at 300.

Upgrade 2.Name: Icy Wind
Upgrade 2.Description:
Jump a short distance in the designated direction; Glaceon's next auto attack within 5s gains increased range and launches all stored ice crystals at an enemy, dealing damage to them. Glaceon then regains the same number of ice crystals that were launched. If an enemy is hit by 4 or more ice crystals, their movement speed is decreased by 8% per shard (stacking up to 6 times) for 1s. If Glaceon has no ice crystals when this move is used, gain 2 ice crystals.

  Against Wild Pokémon: This additional damage is capped at 300.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Against Wild Pokémon: This additional damage is capped at 300.

Move 2.Name: Tail Whip
Move 2.Description: Has the user wag its tail at an enemy, dealing damage and decreasing their Defense and Sp. Def by 30% for 2s, and movement speed by 20% for 1.5s. The next auto attack after using this move becomes a boosted attack.

Upgrade 1.Name: Ice Shard
Upgrade 1.Description: Glaceon gains an increase in movement speed by 40% for 1s while basic attack speed is increased by 60% for 2.5s. Basic attacks change into attacks that hurl chunks of ice for 2.5s. These chunks of ice deal damage to enemies they hit and decrease their movement speed by 30% for 1s. Each time a chunk of ice hits, Glaceon gains 2 ice crystals. If this move is used while launching crystals with Icicle Spear, or if this move is used after Icy Wind but before launching all crystals with the next auto attack, gain 2 ice crystals and increase Glaceon's movement speed by 50% for 0.5s.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increases basic attack speed further to 100% for 2.5s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Freeze Dry
Upgrade 2.Description: Shoot out a freezing burst of air in a forward direction. This burst explodes upon hitting an enemy or after traveling a set distance; dealing damage to all enemies in the area. Upon hitting an enemy, increase Glaceon's Sp. Atk by 50% for 4s. For each enemy hit by the explosion, Glaceon gains 2 ice crystals. The explosion also leaves behind an ice zone which slows enemies that enter by 30% for 3s. If they remain in the ice zone for 2.5s, they become frozen for 0.6s.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: For each enemy hit by this move's explosions, Glaceon gains 1 additional ice crystal.

Unite Move.Name: Glacial Stage
Unite Move.Description: Glaceon leaps up high, creating an ice zone in front of themself that deals damage to enemies in the area-of-effect. While Glaceon is in the ice zone, their movement speed is increased by 50% for 6s, and Glaceon gains 1 ice crystals every second while in the zone. The movement speed of enemies in the ice zone is decreased by 50% for 2s.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 35% Attack Speed, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Gooey
Passive Ability.Description: When this Pokémon is hit by an attack, there is a chance it will spread slime around itself. The slime deals damage to Pokémon, Decreases their attack speed by 50% for 2s and applies a Gooey debuff. The Gooey debuff slows Pokémon by 10% for 6s and can stack up to 4 times per Pokémon. Gooey is a debuff that is applicable to Wild Pokémon and enemy players only.  When this Pokémon enters tall grass, it continually recovers HP for up to 3s, until it leaves the tall grass, uses a move, or attacks. When this Pokémon recovers HP due to Gooey, its attack gauge is progressed towards a boosted attack. This HP recovery goes on a 12s cooldown after being triggered.

Goodra.Attack:
Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing increased damage. Hitting a Pokémon afflicted with a Gooey effect with a basic attack reduces all of this Pokémon's move cooldowns by 1.5s.

Boosted attacks spew slime and if the slime hits Pokémon from a distance, a Gooey debuff is applied to those Pokémon and slows by 50% for 0.5s. If the boosted attack is used on a Pokémon in regular attack melee range, the attack deals increased damage.

Move 1.Name: Bubble
Move 1.Description: Cover itself in a bubble, granting it a shield for 3s. When the shield’s effect duration ends or if this move is used again, the bubble shield pops, dealing damage to nearby opposing Pokémon and slowing them by 30% for 2s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Muddy Water
Upgrade 1.Description: Splashes muddy water around itself, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and applying an effect to them that decreases the amount of damage they deal by 15% for 3s. If the user deals damage to opposing Pokémon with this move, the user’s Defense and Sp. Def are increased for 2s. If Muddy Water is used within 6 seconds, the defense bonus effect is increased in intensity. The defenses bonus effect can stack up to four times.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Further increases the user’s Defense and Sp. Def when this move deals damage to opposing Pokémon.

Upgrade 2.Name: Dragon Pulse
Upgrade 2.Description:
Unleashes a shock wave in the designated direction, dealing damage to Pokémon it hits up to 4 times. If the center of the shock wave hits enemy Pokémon, it deals increased damage to them and restores the user’s HP. More HP is restored when the center of the pulse deals damage to enemy Pokémon that have a Gooey slowing effect applied to them.

  The fourth tick of damage can be animation cancelled by inputs (attack or movement). It is undetermined if this is a bug or not.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Restores more HP if the center of the shock wave hits Pokémon, and even more on Pokémon that have a Gooey debuff applied to them.

Move 2.Name: Tackle
Move 2.Description: Charges at a Pokémon, dealing damage and throwing it. If this move hits, the user bounces back a short distance.

Upgrade 1.Name: Power Whip
Upgrade 1.Description: Lashes out with its horns in the designated direction, dealing damage to Pokémon in the area of effect and slowing them by 80% for 3s, decaying by 15% every 0.5s. If this move hits distant Pokémon, those Pokémon are pulled toward Goodra.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Also applies a Gooey effect when this move hits.

Upgrade 2.Name: Acid Spray
Upgrade 2.Description: Spits acidic fluid at target Pokémon, dealing damage to Pokémon in an area of effect centered on the target slowing them by 80% for 3s, decaying by 15% every 0.5s. If this move is used again within 5s, Goodra charges in the designated direction and deals damage to opposing Pokémon hit. If this charge hits a Pokémon that has been marked by acidic fluid, that Pokémon is thrown for 0.75s, and damage is also dealt to nearby opposing Pokémon.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Also applies a Gooey effect to opposing Pokémon that receive damage from either the acidic fluid or the charge.

Unite Move.Name: Right as Rain
Unite Move.Description: Causes rain to fall around the user, gradually restoring the user’s HP over 6s. While this move is active, all of the user’s basic attacks become boosted attacks.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 40% Max HP Shield, 50% Movement Speed

Passive Ability.Name: Cheek Pouch
Passive Ability.Description: When Greedent eats any berry, recover HP after receiving the effects of the berry. At the same time, Greedent stashes an Oran berry in its tail. Being hit by a single attack or combination of attacks will cause an Oran berry to drop from Greedent's tail (4.5s cd). Berries stay on the ground for 10s.  Oran berry or unite move berry heals Greedent for 1% Max HP + 3x(Lv-1) + 23; Sitrus or Salac berry heals Greedent for 1% Max HP + 0x(Lv-1) + 23. All other players heal from picking up an Oran berry for 2% Max HP + 5x(Level-1) + 45 (level and Max HP scaling is based on the player that ate the Oran berry).

Greedent.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing increased damage when it hits and causing one Oran berry to drop from Greedent's tail.

Move 1.Name: Tackle
Move 1.Description: Leap to the designated area, dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect and decreasing their movement speed by 20% for 1s. If this move is used while Covet is active, no area can be designated for Greedent to leap to. Instead, while running, damage is dealt in an area to enemies in front of Greedent. If Greedent has any Oran berries stashed, consume all of them, reducing Tackle's cooldown by 1s for each berry consumed.

Upgrade 1.Name: Bullet Seed
Upgrade 1.Description:
Spit berry seeds in the designated direction for 6s; dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect and decreasing their movement speed by 30% for 1s. Greedent fires more seeds for each Oran berry stashed.

  Fires 1 wave of seeds every 0.8s while held down (up to 7.5 waves). Launches 1 seed every 0.1s per wave; fires a minimum of 3 seeds, plus 1 additional seed per Berry stored before a Berry is consumed (up to 5 additional seeds; maximum 8 seeds total per wave).
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increased damage.

Upgrade 2.Name: Belch
Upgrade 2.Description: Deals damage to enemies in the area of effect and decrease their movement speed by 40% for 2s, decreasing by 10% every 0.5s. If Greedent has any Oran berries stashed, consume all of them, reducing Belch's cooldown by 1s for each berry consumed (capping at 4s). This move's cooldown cannot be reduced beyond 1s.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increased damage.

Move 2.Name: Defense Curl
Move 2.Description: Grants Greedent a shield (10% max HP) for 3s. In addition, an Oran berry will drop in front of Greedent.

Upgrade 1.Name: Stuff Cheeks
Upgrade 1.Description: Greedent drops 5 Oran berries, which can be eaten to recover HP. Any HP recovered from an Oran berry eaten within 5s that exceeds Greedent's max HP will be converted to a shield for 1.8% max HP per berry (capped at 9% max HP or 5 berries). If Greedent catches sight of a berry while using this move, movement speed is increased by 70% for 6s, but decreasing by 15% every 1s.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increase the number of Oran berries dropped by 1.

Upgrade 2.Name: Covet
Upgrade 2.Description: Greedent runs with all its might for 6s; becoming resistant to hindrances (for 6.1s), dealing damage to enemies hit and throwing them. While running; Greedent drops Oran berries every 1s. Eating a dropped berry increases movement speed by 22% for 1s (stacking up to 5 times). In addition, Tackle, Belch or Bullet Seed can also be used while running and using this move will reset the cooldown of Tackle or Belch.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increased damage and increased frequency of Oran berries dropping (8 berries over 6s).

Unite Move.Name: Berry Belly Flop
Unite Move.Description: Greedent eats a special berry to recover 15% max HP and then leaps to the designated area; dealing damage and throwing enemies within the area of effect for 1s. Greedent then eats another berry, allowing an unlimited amount of Oran berries to be stored for 8s and resets cooldowns of all moves. Greedent is unstoppable during this move.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 40% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Torrent
Passive Ability.Description: While at 50% max HP or below, increases Attack by 5% and movement speed by 12%.

Greninja.Attack:
Auto attacks differ depending on range, and become boosted attacks with every third attack, dealing increased damage. Auto attacks used at long range reduce the cooldown of Bubble, Water Shuriken, or Surf by 0.5s when they hit. Boosted attacks used at long range also decrease the movement speed of the opposing Pokémon hit by 25% for 0.5s.

Auto attacks used in close range instead deal a bonus 5% missing HP damage to opposing Pokémon hit.
