Boosted attacks used in close range dash through the target, dealing a bonus 10% missing HP damage to opposing Pokémon hit instead. Against wild Pokémon: the total damage of auto attacks used in close range is capped at 500.

Move 1.Name: Bubble
Move 1.Description: Sprays 2 bubbles in the designated direction which pop when they hit an opposing Pokémon, damaging opposing Pokémon and decreasing their movement speed by 25% for 1s when each bubble hits.

Upgrade 1.Name: Water Shuriken
Upgrade 1.Description: Increases movement speed by 25% for 3s and throws 4 shurikens made of water in the designated direction which explode when they hit an opposing Pokémon, damaging nearby opposing Pokémon and decreasing their movement speed by 35% for 1s when each shuriken hits; and restoring HP for each opposing Pokémon hit.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Throws 5 shurikens.

Upgrade 2.Name: Surf
Upgrade 2.Description:
Dashes on a wave forward, damaging opposing Pokémon in the path and restoring HP for each target hit. Deals bonus damage to opposing Pokémon below 50% max HP. If this move hits and the user knocks out an opposing Pokémon before it goes on cooldown, the cooldown of this move is reset.

  Against wild Pokémon: the damage of the wave is capped at 1200; bonus damage is capped at 600.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increases the HP restored by this move.

Move 2.Name: Substitute
Move 2.Description: Becomes invincible and dashes forward, leaving behind a Substitute doll in their place which lasts for 3s. The Substitute doll has the same HP, Defense and Sp. Def as the user; the Substitute doll receives 500% of the damage the user would take.

Upgrade 1.Name: Double Team
Upgrade 1.Description:
Briefly vanishes then becomes unstoppable and dashes forward, sending two illusionary copies diagonally behind which last for 3s.

  The copies have the same HP, Defense and Sp. Def as Greninja when created, but receive 500% of the damage they would otherwise take. The clones attack nearby opposing Pokémon with Bubble, Water Shuriken, or Surf (whichever move the user has learned), and auto attacks; but deal 19.44% of the damage they would otherwise deal.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Reduces this move's cooldown by 1s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Smokescreen
Upgrade 2.Description:
Becomes unstoppable and dashes forward, increasing their movement speed by 10% for 2s, entering stealth for 2s, readying a boosted attack that deals increased damage, and leaving behind a cloud of smoke which lasts for 3s. Exits stealth when using an attack.

  Opposing Pokémon in the cloud of smoke have their field of vision reduced by 60%.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increases Attack by 20% for 2s when exiting stealth.

Unite Move.Name: Waterburst Shuriken
Unite Move.Description: Becomes unstoppable and leaps up to throw a giant water shuriken toward the designated circular location, damaging opposing Pokémon it hits on the way to the circular area of effect (from beyond the range of the user's close range auto attacks) and decreasing the movement speed of those hit by 50% for 2s. The user then suddenly appears on top of the water shuriken which immediately bursts, damaging opposing Pokémon in the circular area of effect again and throwing them. Leaps off the burst water shuriken and becomes vulnerable to hindrances again as they jump down to the ground in the direction of their choosing.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 35% Attack Speed, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Rattled
Passive Ability.Description: When damaged, increases movement speed by 5% for 3s (up to 5 times; maximum 25%).
Passive Ability.Description 2:
Increases the effort gauge each time Magikarp uses an auto attack or move, hits with an auto attack or move, scores a goal, knocks out a Pokémon from the opposing team or assists in knocking out a Pokémon from the opposing team. Once the effort gauge is full, Magikarp evolves into Gyarados.

When knocking out a Pokémon from the opposing team or making an assist, reduces current move cooldowns by 30%.

Gyarados passively gains bonus 1200 HP, 100 Attack, and 40% basic attack speed until the end of the battle; these stats are not affected by boost emblem color bonuses.

Gyarados.Attack:
Magikarp has no boosted attack.

Magikarp's basic attacks are a set animation length.

Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing increased damage.

Move 1.Name: Flail
Move 1.Description: Flails on the spot, damaging nearby opposing Pokémon; damage strengthens for every 33% max HP the user is missing.

Upgrade 1.Name: Dragon Breath
Upgrade 1.Description:
Exhales a mighty gust in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and paralyzing them for 3s when it hits, decreasing their movement speed and basic attack speed by 30%.

  If this move hits, gains a buff for 5s; increasing the range and damage of auto attacks; and increasing basic attack speed by a minimum of 40%, strengthening by 15% for each additional opposing Pokémon hit (up to 2 times; maximum 70%).
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increases the damage dealt by this move and enhanced auto attacks.

Upgrade 2.Name: Aqua Tail
Upgrade 2.Description:
For up to 4s while this move is held; moves slightly in the designated direction then swings a blade of water from their tail in the designated direction (up to 5 times), damaging opposing Pokémon hit with each blade.

  If at least 3 blades of water hit opposing Pokémon before this move is released or ends, a second stage of this move can be used within 5s; becomes unstoppable and charges for up to 1.5s, then attacks with a large sweep of their tail in a wider area forward, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect. If the second stage is charged for at least 0.5s, increases the range of the area of effect and damage dealt.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: The boosted aqua tail deals an additional 20% missing HP damage to opposing Pokémon. Against wild Pokémon: additional missing HP damage is capped at 1000.

Move 2.Name: Splash
Move 2.Description: Jumps to the designated location forward. A maximum of 3 uses can be kept in reserve, with a 2s cooldown between uses.

Upgrade 1.Name: Waterfall
Upgrade 1.Description:
Charges forward up to 3 times, damaging opposing Pokémon hit with each charge; waiting for at least 0.07s before dashing forward with the next charge. The first charge is a regular dash forward; the next movement within 2s after the last charge dashes forward with the same effect. Dragon Breath or Aqua Tail can be used within the 2s duration in between charges without interrupting this move's course. Using Dragon Current ends this move early.

  If two charges hit opposing Pokémon, grants a shield for 2s. If all three charges hit opposing Pokémon, the third charge throws opposing Pokémon hit for 0.45s.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Reduce this move's cooldown by 1s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Bounce
Upgrade 2.Description:
Becomes unstoppable and charges power for up to 2.4s, becoming fully charged after 0.8s; then bounces to the designated location forward, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area upon impact. While charging power, increases the range of this move, reaching maximum range when fully charged.

  If fully charged when released, grants a shield for 5s, and throws opposing Pokémon hit for 0.45s. If this move is canceled, it goes on a 2s cooldown.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Strengthens the value of the shield effect.

Unite Move.Name: Dragon Current
Unite Move.Description: Becomes untargetable and dives underwater for up to 4s while this Unite Move is held, increasing movement speed by 45%. When released or after 4s, forcefully leaps up and attacks, damaging opposing Pokémon hit. The longer the move is held, the larger the area of effect becomes. If the user stays underwater for at least 1s before releasing the Unite Move, strengthens the movement speed increase to 55%; deals increased damage and creates a whirlpool where they surface, dealing damage over time to opposing Pokémon in the area of effect (up to 5 times) and decreasing their movement speed for 4s when hit. If underwater for at least 2s, strengthens the movement speed increase to 65%; deals even more damage and creates a waterspout where they surface instead, throwing opposing Pokémon hit for 1s.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Regenerator
Passive Ability.Description: If this Pokémon doesn't take damage from enemy Pokémon (Wild Pokémon do not count) for 3s, it will recover 3% max HP every 2 seconds. Damage to shields will not deactivate Regenerator. Ho-oh additionally recovers 0.3% max HP every 2 seconds.

Ho-Oh.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, shooting out a sweeping flame that deals increased damage and restores HP per enemy Pokémon hit. While firing the sweeping flame Ho-Oh's movement speed is decreased by 30%.

Move 1.Name: Safeguard
Move 1.Description: Create a protective field around the user that reduces the next incoming source of damage by 50%. When this field reduces damage from an attack, the user's movement speed is increased by 40% for 3s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Sacred Fire
Upgrade 1.Description:
Shoot a mystical fireball at an area, dealing damage to non-allied Pokémon it hits, stunning them for 0.6s, and leaving them burned for 3s, reducing their Attack by 10%. Then fly up high into the air for up to 6s. The next 3 basic attacks are boosted attacks. While flying, the user is able to move freely over walls and its attack is increased by 25% and movement speed is increased by 30%. If this move is used again, the user lands cancelling the attack and movement speed bonuses.

  Ho-Oh may not interact with objects on the ground such as Berries or Aeos Energy but may score on goal zones.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increases the Attack reduction of the burn to 20%.

Upgrade 2.Name: Fire Spin
Upgrade 2.Description:
Generate a blazing vortex around yourself and gain a shield. While the vortex is active, Ho-Oh slows itself by 40% and cannot attack. The first time an enemy interacts with the vortex, they receive an 80% movement speed decrease decaying by 10% every 0.5s over 4s. The vortex also deals damage to enemies. If allies are within the vortex, 60% of post-mitigation damage those allies would take is redirected to Ho-Oh as true damage (without ignoring shields).

  If there is a shield after 4s or if this move is used again while this move's shield is intact, a heat wave is released around the user, dealing damage to enemies, and additional damage equal to the percentage of the damage the shield received. The emitted heat wave additionally stuns non-allied Pokémon it hits for 0.6s,  There is a 1.5s delay before the shield may be detonated from the start of the vortex. If the shield is destroyed before detonation, no damage is dealt.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: When the shield is broken, the heat wave is now automatically released.

Move 2.Name: Tailwind
Move 2.Description: Whip up a whirlwind in designated direction, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon hit. The whirlwind then remains on the field for 5s. Allies moving in the same direction as the whirlwind have their movement speed increased by 30% as long as they are in the field and lasting for 0.5s after stepping out of the field. Opposing Pokémon moving against the whirlwind have their movement speed decreased by 30% lasting for 0.5s after stepping out of the field.

Upgrade 1.Name: Flamethrower
Upgrade 1.Description:
Blow flames in a designated direction, dealing damage to enemies hit every 0.25s and slowing Ho-Oh's movement speed by 15%. This move may be held for up to 4s to blow flames for longer. This move's cooldown increases the longer flames are blown for. If enemies are hit, the user recovers HP. If enemies are hit thrice, they are burned, refreshing on additional hits of flamethrower.

  Burned enemies take damage over 3s at 0.5s intervals. Burned enemies also have their movement speed decreased by 15% for 1.5s, their attack decreased by 20% for 2s, and their special attack decreased by 20% for 1.5s. Enemies burned by Flamethrower will leave behind a scorched area. Enemies traversing the scorched area are slowed by 15%. Enemies that touch the area will also receive burns but this burn will not spread the scorched area.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increases the length of time flames may be blown to 5s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Sky Attack
Upgrade 2.Description:
Ho-Oh spreads their wings and charges in a loop. While charging, deal damage to enemies hit and burn the ground along the flight path for 4.5s. The burning ground deals damage to enemies that touch it every 0.5s and slows them by 30% for 1.5s. If this move is used again or if another move is used mid-charge, then the user stops in place.

  During the flight, Ho-Oh receives 30% less damage.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: While the Ho-Oh is on burning ground, gradually restore HP.

Unite Move.Name: Rekindling Flame
Unite Move.Description: When a nearby ally is knocked out, a feather is left in their place until they respawn at base. When Rekindling Flame is used, Ho-oh spreads their wings and consumes all of the Aeos energy held to revive knocked-out allies where their feathers are for 60% of their maximum HP. Rekindling Flame may only be used if there are feathers nearby. The number of available revivals are based on how much Aeos energy is consumed. One ally may be always revived. Up to two allies are revivable if at least 9 energy is consumed. Up to three allies are revivable if at least 17 Aeos energy is consumed. Up to four allies are revivable if at least 25 Aeos energy is consumed.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 80% Movement Speed, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Magician
Passive Ability.Description: In battles where the map is divided into an ally team side and an opposing team side, this ability creates a hole under one of the berries on the opposing team's side (chosen at random) and warps it in front of Hoopa (40s cooldown). If there are no berries, but there is Aeos Energy on the ground, then some energy is warped in front of Hoopa instead. In the event that no berries from the opposing team's side are warped, the cooldown of this ability is reduced to 20s. Berries last 30 seconds and take 2 seconds to appear after magician's activation.

Hoopa.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing damage to enemies by unleashing a beam of light.

Move 1.Name: Astonish
Move 1.Description: Deals damage to enemies in the designated area of effect, leaving them unable to act for .75s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Phantom Force
Upgrade 1.Description: Hoopa creates a portal ring under themself and warps to a designated location, dealing damage to nearby enemies at that location and shoving them. Hoopa then shoots two sinister flames that deal damage to enemies hit and decreases their movement speed by 40% for 2s. This move can be activated a second time within 3.5s and if activated, Hoopa can return to the initial ring's location. If there is a nearby ally that is also linked by Trick, that ally can warp to the initial ring's location and recover 15% max HP.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Become invincible for .6s when this move is used.

Upgrade 2.Name: Shadow Ball
Upgrade 2.Description: Unleash a shadowy blob in front of Hoopa, dealing damage to enemies hit and decreasing their movement speed by 50% for 1s and Sp. Defense by 30% for 3s. If Hoopa then hits the same enemy with a move or boosted attack within 4s, deal additional damage and leave the enemy unable to act for .8s. When using this move, if there is a nearby ally linked by Trick, this move will also unleash a shadowy blob at the same target from that ally's location.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: The shadowy blob will now explode before disappearing. Enemies hit by the explosion are affected as if they were hit by the shadowy blob itself.

Move 2.Name: Confusion
Move 2.Description: Unleash a telekinetic force in the designated direction, dealing damage to the first enemy hit. The telekinetic force clings to that enemy and then causes a delayed explosion. The explosion deals damage to enemies in the area of effect and decreases their movement speed for a short time.

Upgrade 1.Name: Hyperspace Hole
Upgrade 1.Description: Hoopa creates a large ring at the designated location, dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect. After 3s, Hoopa and any allies in the area of effect will return to their base, and their movement speed will be increased for a short time. These allies can also manually warp back to where the ring was created within 3s. An intact ally forwardmost goal zone can also be designated as the location where the ring is created. Creating a ring on the goal zone of the top path will also create a ring on the forwardmost goal zone of the bottom path for 6.5s, and vice versa. All allies (including Hoopa) can use these rings to manually warp between the two goal zones, and their movement speed will be increased for a short time after warping. After an ally or Hoopa warps, there is a 10s cooldown before that Pokémon can manually warp again. If a path's forwardmost goal zone is destroyed, the middle goal zone on the same path will take its place. This move cannot be used on base goal zones. Hyperspace Hole's portal usage cooldown applies only to Hyperspace Hole teleports, and is reset upon usage of Unite Move. If there are multiple effects that would allow you to teleport (ie Phantom Force and Rings Unbound), Rings Unbound will take priority. Hyperspace Holes can be seen by enemies on the minimap.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Also increases movement speed by 70% for allies near the ring when they are heading towards it.

Upgrade 2.Name: Trick
Upgrade 2.Description: Hoopa creates a link between itself and an ally, increasing both of their movement speeds by 60% for 3s, decaying 10% per second down to 40% increased movement speed, and granting them each a shield for 3s. For the next 7s, when Hoopa uses Shadow Ball or performs an auto attack, the ring on the linked ally also unleashes the same move or attack and if both attacks hit the same target, the second deals 50% damage. Hoopa can also use this move on themself, increasing movement speed and granting a shield for a short time. Additionally, increase the damage dealt by Shadow Ball while Trick is active.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Hoopa and the linked ally each heal for 10% of their own damage dealt. This effect lasts for 3s.

Unite Move.Name: Rings Unbound
Unite Move.Description: Hoopa becomes invincible for 0.6s while transforming into Hoopa Unbound, then becomes unstoppable for 0.3s as it opens a large portal ring at a designated location. Hoopa Unbound lasts for 15s, increasing max HP by 40% and changes Hoopa's regular moves to Hyperspace Fury and Psybeam. Hoopa Unbound cannot score goals or activate the Magician ability. The portal ring created stays open for 10s, and allies can warp to that location once within the duration of the ring. This portal is indicated on the mini map where all players may see where it is.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Sniper
Passive Ability.Description: When this Pokémon stays near a wall for 1s it becomes camouflaged, making opposing Pokémon unable to target it, and starts gaining critical counters. Sobble may only hold one critical counter. Drizzile may hold two. Inteleon may hold three. While camouflaged, Inteleon is slowed by 10%. A critical counter is gained as soon as Inteleon is camouflaged, with a new counter gained every 3s while camouflaged. Dealing or receiving damage breaks the camouflage and prevents Inteleon from starting to camouflage for 3s. When a critical counter is consumed, Inteleon's next attack or move that can critically strike is guaranteed to be a critical hit.  Critical hits deal 250% rather than 200% damage.

Inteleon.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing increased damage with 20% increased critical-hit rate.

Move 1.Name: Tearful Look
Move 1.Description: Decreases the Attack and Sp. Atk of the target Pokémon by 20% for 3s. Inteleon gains a critical counter and increases its movement speed by 40% for 3s (decreasing over time).

Upgrade 1.Name: Fell Stinger
Upgrade 1.Description: Inteleon fires a sharp stinger in the designated direction. The stinger stops at the first Pokémon hit or when it reaches a wall. Inteleon gains two critical counters if either a Pokémon is hit or a wall is hit. If it hits a Pokémon it deals damage. If it hits a wall, this move's cooldown is reduced by half and Inteleon is pulled to the wall and starts camouflaging.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Reduces this move's cooldown by 1s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Acrobatics
Upgrade 2.Description:
Inteleon glides in the designated direction. If it hits a Pokémon or a wall, it can glide in a designated direction a second time. If Inteleon hits a Pokémon while gliding, Inteleon deals damage to it and decreases its movement speed by 30% for 2s. Every time Inteleon glides in a designated direction, it gains a critical counter. If Inteleon bounces off a wall or Pokémon, Liquidation's current cooldown is reduced by 40%.

  This move can also be used while attacking with Liquidation.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increases the first glide's travel distance.

Move 2.Name: Water Gun
Move 2.Description: Inteleon squirts water, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon it hits.

Upgrade 1.Name: Snipe Shot
Upgrade 1.Description: Inteleon aims for up to 6s and then fires, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon it hits while partially ignoring their Sp. Def. by 15%/20%/25% depending on distance (close, mid, far respectively). Aiming reduces the possible spread of the shot, reaching maximum precision after aiming for 1.25s. The farther away the user is from the Pokémon it hits, the more damage it does. A maximum of three uses can be kept in reserve for this move. There is a 1.5s cooldown between uses.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Reduces the cooldown for charges by 1s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Liquidation
Upgrade 2.Description: Inteleon starts firing water projectiles at the designated Pokémon. Inteleon fires a total of 8 projectiles in 1.7s and is slowed by 40% while firing. Water projectiles can hit targets other than the designated Pokémon and only deal damage to the first Pokémon they hit. If this move hits the same Pokémon 5 times in a short time, Inteleon will deal 20% increased damage to this Pokémon for 3s.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increases the number of projectiles shot during the duration to 10.

Unite Move.Name: Azure Spy Vision
Unite Move.Description: For 10.5s, Inteleon can see nearby Pokémon that are in stealth or hiding in tall grass. While active, also doubles Inteleon's critical-hit rate, and gives 1 critical counter per second.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 20% Max HP Shield, 30% Movement Speed, 35% Attack Speed

Passive Ability.Name: Shell Armor
Passive Ability.Description: If Lapras would take a single instance of damage that would be greater than 10% of Lapras's maximum HP, this damage will be reduced by 20%.

Lapras.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, shooting water through the target and dealing increased damage to Pokémon hit by the spray. The boosted attack also heals Lapras.

Move 1.Name: Whirlpool
Move 1.Description: Create a whirlpool centered on Lapras that lasts for 3s, dealing damage over time to opposing Pokémon in the area of effect. The time between hits is shorter the farther opposing Pokémon are from the whirlpool’s center.

Upgrade 1.Name: Water Pulse
Upgrade 1.Description: Release a pulse of water centered on itself that spreads out, dealing damage to Pokémon it hits and decreasing their movement speed by 30% for 2s. For each opposing Pokémon hit by a pulse from this move, an additional pulse will be released the next time this move is used within 8 seconds, up to a total of 3 pulses. If the first pulse after activating this move hits a Pokémon, the user’s next basic attack becomes a boosted attack.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increases the maximum number of pulses to 4.

Upgrade 2.Name: Perish Song
Upgrade 2.Description: Sing an eerie melody that echoes around yourself, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon it hits. This move can be used up to three times consecutively within 5s of its last use. Pokémon hit all three times take additional damage equal to one Perish Song hit. If the additional damage would bring an enemy Pokémon below 10% of their max HP, that enemy Pokémon will take 40% of their maximum HP as True Damage.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: The next basic attack after using this move becomes a boosted attack.

Move 2.Name: Ice Shard
Move 2.Description: Hurl 5 chunks of ice in a forward direction, dealing damage to Pokémon they hit and leaving them frozen for 0.6s. If this move hits a Pokémon that is already frozen, it deals damage to it and shoves in the direction of the ice shards for 0.4s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Bubble Beam
Upgrade 1.Description: Create a bubble shield on Lapras for up to 4s or until the shield is broken, then spray 5 bubbles with a beam in the designated direction. Pokémon hit by the bubbles take damage and are enveloped by it, leaving them unable to act for 1s. After the bubbles fly a set distance, they slowly float for 3s. Pokémon hit by a floating bubble are enveloped by it and left unable to act for 1s, but will not be damaged.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increases the strength of the shield granted by this move.

Upgrade 2.Name: Ice Beam
Upgrade 2.Description: Unleash an icy-cold beam of energy in the designated direction, dealing damage to Pokémon hit and freezing the ground for 3s. Pokémon on the frozen ground take damage equal to the beam's damage every 0.4s they remain on it and have their movement speed decreased by 15% for 2s stacking up to 6 times. Pokémon become frozen for 1s if they remain on the frozen ground for 3 ticks. When Lapras is on the frozen ground, Lapras's movement speed is increased by 20%, lingering for 0.5s if Lapras leaves the frozen ground.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increase the duration Pokémon are Frozen for to 1.5s.

Unite Move.Name: Lapras Express
Unite Move.Description: Ride a wave quickly and continuously forward becoming Unstoppable for up to 15s. Lapras’s movement speed increases every second while riding but decreases if the user hits an obstacle. If this move is used again, the user stops and launches a wave that continues moving forward, dealing damage to Pokémon it hits and throwing them for 1.5s. If the user hits an enemy Pokémon while still riding, the user stops in place, dealing damage to and throwing the opposing Pokémon for 1.5s. While the user is riding the wave, one nearby ally Pokémon of the user’s choice within range may be picked up and can ride on its back. Ally Pokémon riding on the user’s back can dismount whenever they choose.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 20% Max HP Shield on activation, 40% Max HP shield and 30% Movement speed after stopping.

Passive Ability.Name: Levitate
Passive Ability.Description: After using a move: increases movement speed by 50% for 2s (decaying by 5% every 0.25s).  Increases movement speed by 10% while near an ally Latios. When not in combat, this Ability can be used to fly to an allied Latios. This Ability goes on cooldown for 90s after it's triggered for both Latios and Latias. While channeling this ability the user can move around, once the 2s channel is completed the user becomes unstoppable and flies to where Latios was when this ability was activated. If Latios is at the home base, the cooldown of Levitate goes down twice as fast for Latias.

Latias.Attack:
Shoots a psychic projectile at an opposing Pokémon, damaging them.

Latias has no boosted attack.

Move 1.Name: Confusion
Move 1.Description: Releases a weak telekinetic force in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon hit and decreasing their movement speed by 20% for 2s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Mist Ball
Upgrade 1.Description:
Releases a mist-like flurry of down in the designated direction. When used again or after 0.9s pass: the flurry of down bursts, creating a zone of mist in the area of effect dealing damage up to 2 more times. This move then goes on cooldown. The projectile and area of effect damages opposing Pokémon in it, decreases their movement speed by 40% for 2s, and marks them for 2s.

  Marked opposing Pokémon deal 25% decreased damage. If either Latias or Latios deals damage to marked opposing Pokémon: increases the duration of the mark by 1s. This duration extension can be continued indefinitely.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increased mark base duration to 3s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Dragon Cheer
Upgrade 2.Description:
Rallies the designated ally Pokémon for 3s. This move can be recast within 3s to rally a second designated ally Pokémon. Alternatively the user can target themselves, however the recast must be used on an allied Pokémon. The user and the rallied Pokémon gain a shield and the rallied Pokémon deals increased damage with their next hit. If the designated ally is Latios, then Latios will additionally gain 20% movement speed for 2s.

  When this move is recast; Latias will fly towards the designated ally. This move's cooldown begins once the recast is used or expires. The damage increase is based on the rallied Pokémon's level.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increased the strength of the shield.

Move 2.Name: Swift
Move 2.Description: Shoots star-shaped rays in a large area in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect.

Upgrade 1.Name: Dragon Pulse
Upgrade 1.Description:
After learning this move: Latias gains 2 Eon power for knocking out a wild Pokémon; or 2 Eon power per Pokémon from the opposing team hit by this move. When this move is used: Latias generates a beam in the designated direction, sweeping in a cone shape, damaging opposing Pokémon hit and restoring the user's HP once. While firing the beam, Latias moves 60% slower.

  This move gains 2 telekinetic projectiles at 25 and 100 Eon power, and gains 1 projectile at 50 and 75 Eon power for a total of 6 projectiles. Subsequent projectiles hitting the same target deal 15% less damage; further decreasing with each projectile to a maximum of 75% less damage. For every 1 Eon power accumulated beyond 100; the projectile damage increases by 0.5% (Eon power caps at 1099).
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: The beam now slows opposing Pokémon by 30% for 2s

Upgrade 2.Name: Dragon Breath
Upgrade 2.Description:
After learning this move: Latias gains 2 Eon power for knocking out a wild Pokémon; or 3 Eon power per Pokémon from the opposing team hit by this move. When this move is used: Latias exhales a mighty gust in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon hit, slowing them by 30% for 3s and decreasing their Sp. Def by 30% for 3s.

  This move gains increased range at 31 and 61 Eon Power. For every 1 Eon power accumulated beyond 60; the damage increases by 0.5% (Eon power caps at 1059).
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: The slow is increased to 40% for 3s

Unite Move.Name: Mist Blast
Unite Move.Description: Aims at the designated Pokémon from the opposing team and charges power for 1.8s before releasing a pulse, damaging all opposing Pokémon hit. Resets move cooldowns immediately after releasing the pulse, and increases cooldown reduction by 20% for 9.5s. If Latios is also aiming its Unite Move at the designated Pokémon from the opposing team, the pulses stack and explode, dealing damage around the target as well. If Mist Blast hits last then the explosion uses Latias' stats.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Levitate
Passive Ability.Description: After using a move: increases movement speed by 50% for 2s (decaying by 5% every 0.25s).  Increases movement speed by 10% while near an ally Latias. When not in combat, this Ability can be used to fly to an allied Latias. This Ability goes on cooldown for 90s after it's triggered for both Latios and Latias. While channeling this ability the user can move around, once the 2s channel is completed the user becomes unstoppable and flies to where Latias was when this ability was activated. If Latias is at home base, the cooldown of Levitate will go down twice as fast for Latios.

Latios.Attack:
Shoots a psychic projectile at an opposing Pokémon, damaging them.

Latios has no boosted attack.

Move 1.Name: Confusion
Move 1.Description: Releases a weak telekinetic force in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon hit and decreasing their movement speed by 20% for 2s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Luster Purge
Upgrade 1.Description:
Lets loose a ball of light that moves in the designated direction. When used again (automatically after 0.85s): releases the ball's light all at once, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect; and marking them for 3s. This move then goes on cooldown.

  Latios and any allied Latias deal 20% increased damage to marked opposing Pokémon. This mark can be cleansed.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increased mark duration to 6s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Telekinesis
Upgrade 2.Description:
Unleashes psychic power in the designated direction, damaging the first opposing Pokémon hit, decreasing their movement speed by 30% for 2s; and marking the target for 4s. This move may be used again afterwards. When used again: unleashes psychic power at the designated opposing Pokémon, decreasing their movement speed by 30% for 2s when it hits. This move goes on cooldown when the mark is consumed or cleansed.

  If the target of the second use is already marked by the first use or the first use missed: stuns that target for 1s when the psychic power hits, consuming the mark. If the target of the second use is a different, unmarked opposing Pokémon: the two targets are pulled a set distance toward each other over 0.7s. The two Pokémon are stunned for 1s while being pulled together. If they collide with one another, they are thrown away from each other and their marks are consumed.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Strengthened movement speed decrease duration to 3s.

Move 2.Name: Swift
Move 2.Description: Shoots star-shaped rays in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect.

Upgrade 1.Name: Dragon Pulse
Upgrade 1.Description:
After learning this move: Latios gains 2 Eon power for knocking out a wild Pokémon; or 3 Eon power per Pokémon from the opposing team hit by this move's boosted attack. When this move is used: Latios dashes forward, empowering the next basic attack used within 5s to be a special boosted attack that hits in a straight line, damaging opposing Pokémon hit. The move goes on cooldown when the boosted attack is used or after 5s.

  This move gains 2 telekinetic projectiles at 25 and 100 Eon power, and gains 1 projectile at 50 and 75 Eon power for a total of 6 projectiles. Subsequent projectiles hitting the same target deal 15% less damage; further decreasing with each projectile to a maximum of 75% less damage. For every 1 Eon power accumulated beyond 100; the projectile damage increases by 0.5% (Eon power caps at 1099).

  Against any opposing Pokémon: additional missing HP damage is capped at 300 per projectile.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Against any opposing Pokémon: additional missing HP damage is capped at 300 per projectile.

Upgrade 2.Name: Draco Meteor
Upgrade 2.Description:
After learning this move: Latios gains 2 Eon power for knocking out a wild Pokémon; or 3 Eon power per Pokémon from the opposing team hit during this move. When this move is used: 2 comets crash onto the designated area, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect with each comet.

  This move gains 1 additional comet for every 25 Eon power accumulated, with a maximum of 6 comets at 100 Eon power. Subsequent comets that hit the same target deal 70% less damage. For every 1 Eon power accumulated beyond 100: increases comet damage by 0.5% (Eon power caps at 1099).

  Against any opposing Pokémon: additional missing HP damage is capped at 300 per comet.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Against any opposing Pokémon: additional missing HP damage is capped at 300 per comet.

Unite Move.Name: Eon Blast
Unite Move.Description: Aims at the designated Pokémon from the opposing team and charges power for 1.8s before releasing a pulse, damaging all opposing Pokémon hit. Resets move cooldowns immediately after releasing the pulse, and increases cooldown reduction to 60% for 9.5s. If Latias is also aiming its Unite Move at the designated Pokémon from the opposing team, the pulses stack and explode, dealing damage around the target as well. If Eon Blast hits last then the explosion uses Latios' stats.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Run Away
Passive Ability.Description: Eevee has 10% increased movement speed when out of combat. (5s after leaving combat)
Passive Ability.Description 2: While Leafeon is not in tall grass, the Chlorophyll gauge charges over 9s. When the gauge is full, Leafeon's movement speed is increased by 15%.

Leafeon.Attack:
Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing additional damage.

When evolved, Leafeon can only access boosted attacks from Chlorophyll. When the Chlorophyll gauge is full, the next attack becomes a Chlorophyll boosted attack. This boosted attack leaps towards the target, dealing additional damage and slowing the Pokémon it hits by 30% for 2s.

Move 1.Name: Swift
Move 1.Description: Launches three stars in the designated direction in a cone, dealing damage to enemies hit. The first star that hits applies a debuff that lasts 1 second that causes subsequent stars to deal 70% reduced damage.

Upgrade 1.Name: Razor Leaf
Upgrade 1.Description: Launches a fan of five sharp-edged leaves in the designated direction in a cone, dealing damage to enemies hit before sticking into the ground for 2.5s. If this move is activated again, the leaves return, dealing damage to Pokémon they hit along the way. If the reactivation time is 1s or longer, the leaves will return and deal increased damage. If the move is not reactivated, the leaves will automatically return dealing increased damage. If five leaves hit the same Pokémon (outgoing or incoming) within 0.5s, Leafeon is granted a shield lasting 1.5s. Leafeon also receives 20% increased movement speed for up to 3s while the leaves are out. Each fan, the first leaf that hits applies a debuff that lasts 1s and causes subsequent leaves within the same fan (outgoing or incoming) to deal 70% reduced damage.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increase the strength of the shield when five leaves hit.

Upgrade 2.Name: Solar Blade
Upgrade 2.Description: Start gathering light and filling a blade with the light's energy. If this move is used again after light has been gathered, Leafeon brings the blade down in the designated direction, dealing damage to Pokémon it hits. The longer the blade is filled with light energy, the more damage is dealt. If this move is used when the Chlorophyll gauge is full, the blade is brought down immediately, dealing maximum damage and the cooldown for the next use of this move is reduced by 50%. The cooldown of this move is also reduced by 50% upon the Chlorophyll gauge being filled.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: While charging, Leafeon receives 50% damage reduction.

Move 2.Name: Quick Attack
Move 2.Description: Dash in a direction, dealing damage to enemies hit.

Upgrade 1.Name: Aerial Ace
Upgrade 1.Description: Dash in a direction, dealing damage to enemies hit. The next attack is a boosted attack non-Chlorophyll empowered. A maximum of two uses may be kept in reserve for this move and cannot be used more than once every 0.5s.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Reduces the cooldown for charges by 0.5s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Leaf Blade
Upgrade 2.Description: Dash and spin in a direction, slashing around itself and with a ring of sharp leaves, dealing damage three times. Enemies caught by the outside edge of the ring of sharp leaves take increased damage and are slowed by 40% for 2s. Enemies damaged by the outside edge also charge the Chlorophyll gauge by 1.2s per hit.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Reduces this move's cooldown by 1.2s for each hit dealing damage to more than one enemy on the outer ring

Unite Move.Name: Emerald Two-Step
Unite Move.Description: Leaps at a designated enemy, dealing damage to them and all enemies around them. These Pokémon are additionally slowed by 50% for 2s. After the initial leap, Leafeon leaps up and lands with force dealing damage to enemies in an area. Enemies hit by this area take more damage the closer they are to the center of this area. Leafeon is unstoppable during this move.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 80% Movement Speed, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Steadfast
Passive Ability.Description: If at 50% max HP or below: grants this Pokémon a shield and increases their movement speed by 20% for 5s (45s CD).

Lucario.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with increased range every third attack, hitting twice. The first hit damages opposing Pokémon with a normal basic attack; the second hit is a follow-up attack with a bone, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area a second time and throwing them for 0.5s.

Move 1.Name: Quick Attack
Move 1.Description: Dashes forward, damaging opposing Pokémon hit.

Upgrade 1.Name: Extreme Speed
Upgrade 1.Description:
Dashes forward, damaging opposing Pokémon hit; restoring HP for each opposing Pokémon hit. If an auto attack is used at the end of the dash (0.2s after the move is used): attacks in a circle around them, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon in the area of effect with a unique auto attack.

  After learning this move: nearby opposing Pokémon have an Extreme Speed marker automatically applied to them. If this move's dash hits an opposing Pokémon: resets this move's cooldown; and removes the marker from the first target hit for 10s (or until applied by other moves).
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increases the user's Attack by 7.5% for 2s when this move is used.

Upgrade 2.Name: Power-Up Punch
Upgrade 2.Description:
While held down: charges up power for up to 4s, reducing damage received by 30% and decreasing movement speed by 15%; reaches maximum charge after 1s. When released: dashes forward with a devastating punch, damaging the first opposing Pokémon hit, dealing additional missing HP damage to the target, and shoving them for 0.5s. Readies a boosted attack if this move hits. Reduces this move's cooldown by 1s each time one of their moves lands a hit. If not released after 4s or canceled, this move goes on a 1.4s cooldown.

  Against wild Pokémon: additional missing HP damage is capped at 1000.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Becomes unstoppable while charging this move.

Move 2.Name: Meteor Mash
Move 2.Description: Punches with the force of a meteor in the designated direction after 0.4s, damaging opposing Pokémon hit and shoving them in the designated direction, stunning those hit for 0.4s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Bone Rush
Upgrade 1.Description:
Rapidly strikes with a bone in the designated direction 3 times over 0.33s, damaging opposing Pokémon within melee range around Lucario, and in the area of the bone strikes in front; opposing Pokémon can be damaged twice per hit by being in the area where the bone strikes overlap with the attacks within melee range. Immediately after, throws the bone flying to land a short distance away, shoving opposing Pokémon in the way and stunning them for 0.4s. Cooldown starts upon first use. If used again within 3s of throwing the bone: dashes to the bone, then catches it, damaging nearby opposing Pokémon if the bone is grabbed.

  Landing one of the three initial strikes on opposing Pokémon applies an Extreme Speed marker to them.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Catching the bone with the second use resets the cooldown of Extreme Speed or Power-Up Punch.

Upgrade 2.Name: Close Combat
Upgrade 2.Description:
Becomes unstoppable for 1.4s, and rapidly punches in the designated direction 11 times, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area in front of them with each hit; restoring HP each time this move hits. The rapid punches start 0.4s after the move is used, with the last punch hitting 1.2s after the start of the move.

  Changes the next basic attack used within 5s after using this move. This auto attack gains increased range and lunges at an opposing Pokémon with a kick, dealing damage.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increases the damage of this move.

Unite Move.Name: Aura Cannon
Unite Move.Description: Becomes unstoppable for 0.6s and channels aura into a huge sphere, then launches the sphere in the designated direction, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon in its path. The aura sphere picks up speed as it travels; at close range, a target can be hit up to 4 times, while at max speed a target will only be hit once. If the user learned Extreme Speed: applies an Extreme Speed marker to targets hit by this Unite Move. If the user learned Power-Up Punch: strengthens the damage of the next attack of Power-Up Punch by roughly 20% and the shove duration to 1s when Power-Up Punch is released.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Guts
Passive Ability.Description: Increases Attack by 10% for 5s when afflicted by any debuff.

Machamp.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing increased damage when it hits. This boosted attack also decreases the movement speed of enemies by 50% for 1s.

Move 1.Name: Karate Chop
Move 1.Description: Machamp attacks in a straight line dealing damage to enemies hit.

Upgrade 1.Name: Close Combat
Upgrade 1.Description: Machamp unleashes a barrage of blows in a targeted direction for 1s, hitting multiple times and finishing with a single large strike. Machamp is unstoppable for the duration and can move while using Close Combat.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Deals 25% additional damage if the target is affected by a status condition.

Upgrade 2.Name: Cross Chop
Upgrade 2.Description: Machamp dashes forward, dealing damage to enemies hit. Cross Chop may critically hit and has a 5% higher Critical-Hit Rate. Cross Chop further increases Critical-Hit Rate by 5% for 3s on hit.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Machamp’s auto attacks increases Atk by 3 per target hit, permanently stacking up to 40 times.

Move 2.Name: Bulk Up
Move 2.Description: Machop buffs themselves for 3s becoming unstoppable, increasing attack by 15%, attack speed by 40% and movement speed by 30% inititally, diminishing gradually every 1s. Machop's next attack is boosted.

Upgrade 1.Name: Dynamic Punch
Upgrade 1.Description: Machamp jumps to target location, becoming unstoppable for 0.5s, stunning enemies hit for 0.5s, slowing them by 40% for 3s, and dealing damage four times in quick succession to the landing radius. Machamp’s Attack is increased by 15% for 5s and gains bonus movement speed of 40% diminishing by 20% over 3s when using Dynamic Punch. Machamp’s next auto attack is boosted.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Further increases movement speed by 30%, Attack bonus by 5%, and slow by 20%.

Upgrade 2.Name: Submission
Upgrade 2.Description: Machamp becomes unstoppable for 5s and gains 70% increased movement speed (diminishing every 1s by 20%) or until the next auto attack. Machamp’s next auto attack during submission is enhanced, hitting twice and slamming the target down behind Machamp. If this attack hits, Machamp also gains 5% increased Critical-Hit Rate and 40% Attack Speed for 3s.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Further increases Critical-Hit Rate by 5% and Attack Speed by 10%.

Unite Move.Name: Barrage Blow
Unite Move.Description: Machamp gains increased movement speed by 10%, Attack by 25%, Defense by 300, and Sp. Defense by 300 for 8s before unleashing an unstoppable combo attack that continuously shoves enemies in the area of effect.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 35% Attack Speed, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Thick Fat
Passive Ability.Description: When Mamoswine deals damage, Defense and Sp. Def are increased for 5s, stacking up to 3 times. When Mamoswine uses Ice Shard, Icicle Crash or Ice Fang, the next auto attack is boosted. If any of these moves creates a freezing area of effect inside an ally goal zone, the goal-scoring speed of enemies is decreased by 30% for 5s.

Mamoswine.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing damage and freezing enemies for 0.5s when it hits. Mamoswine's auto attacks deal increased damage for a short time to enemies recently frozen with one of Mamoswine's moves.

Move 1.Name: Ice Shard
Move 1.Description: Hurls 3 chunks of ice at the designated location, dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect and decreasing their movement speed by 40% for 1.5s. If an enemy is hit by all three chunks, they're left frozen for 0.5s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Icicle Crash
Upgrade 1.Description: Drops icicles on the designated location, dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect and decreasing their movement speed by 35% for 0.2s. The final icicle shatters after 1s or when hit by Mamoswine's other moves or boosted attacks, dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect and leaving them frozen for 1.5s if the icicle was shattered by Mamoswine, or 1s if it shattered on its own. If the icicle is shattered by Tackle or High Horsepower, the ground is covered in ice, which increases the movement speed of allies that run over it by 50%. The next auto attack is boosted.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: The final icicle leaves enemies hit unable to act for .2s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Ice Fang
Upgrade 2.Description: Uses cold-infused fangs to throw the enemy closest to Mamoswine, dealing damage and grabbing them, rendering them unable to act. Mamoswine can then designate a direction to slam the thrown Pokémon forward or backward, dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect and freezing them. The thrown Pokémon is frozen for 1s, and surrounding enemies are frozen for 1.5s. The next auto attack is boosted.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increases the area of effect in which enemies are left frozen after the slam attack.

Move 2.Name: Tackle
Move 2.Description: Mamoswine rushes recklessly in the designated direction; dealing damage to enemies hit and throws them in the air for 0.5s.

Upgrade 1.Name: High Horsepower
Upgrade 1.Description: Mamoswine rushes recklessly in the designated direction, dealing damage to enemies they hit and shoving them for 0.55s. Mamoswine then stomps their feet, dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect and leaves them unable to act for 0.35s. This stomping deals increased damage to frozen enemies.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increases the reckless rush's speed and the length of time enemies are left unable to act by .2s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Earthquake
Upgrade 2.Description: Mamoswine leaps up in the designated direction and lands forcefully, dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect and pulling them toward Mamoswine. Enemies that are hit cannot act for 1s.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Decreases movement speed of enemies by 30% for 2.5s when this move hits and increases the move's pulling power.

Unite Move.Name: Mammoth Mash
Unite Move.Description: Mamoswine jumps to the designated location then repeatedly stomps the ground four times, dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect and decreases their movement speed for 0.5s with each stomp. The first stomp slows enemies by 30%, the two mini stomps slow them by 20%, and the final stomp slows them by 40% and throws them in the air for 1.5s. Mamoswine is unstoppable for the duration of the move.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 40% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Solar Power
Passive Ability.Description: When the user uses a move, it deals additional damage but loses 5% of its current HP. This Ability's effect does not trigger when the user is in tall grass. When the user deals damage with a basic attack to opposing Pokémon that have been burned by its moves, the user restores 3% of its missing HP.
Passive Ability.Description 2: Charizard's passive ability changes to Tough Claws when it Mega Evolves, increasing Defense and Special Defense by 30%, and increasing the additional damage on moves without any conditions or drawbacks. Gain a boost counter each time a move hits opposing Pokémon (maximum of 3). Whenever an autoattack is performed, 1 boost counter is consumed (if available) to make all ticks of the basic attack, critically strike. When the user deals damage with a basic attack to opposing Pokémon that have been burned by its moves, the user restores 6% of its missing HP.

Mega Charizard X.Attack: Breathes fire at opposing Pokémon, dealing damage 4 times per basic attack. Charizard may move while attacking but is slowed by 5% while breathing fire. Charizard deals additional damage to opposing Pokémon that have been burned by the user's moves. This additional damage cannot land critical hits; additional damage benefits from regular lifesteal. Basic attacks gain increased range upon evolving into Charmeleon and into Charizard. When mega evolving into Mega Charizard X, basic attack range is decreased but width is increased.

Move 1.Name: Flame Burst
Move 1.Description: The user attacks with a flame in the designated direction which bursts on the first opposing Pokémon hit or after traveling max distance, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and burning them for 4s (dealing damage 5 times). When this move hits, the user's movement speed is increased by 20% for 3s. The Attack of opposing Pokémon burned by this move is decreased by 5%.

Upgrade.Name: Fire Punch
Upgrade.Description:
The user dashes with a fiery fist forward, damaging opposing Pokémon hit and shoving them, and burning the first opposing Pokémon hit for 4s (dealing damage 5 times).

  The Attack of the target burned by this move is decreased by 5%. When the user is mega evolved, instead burns all opposing Pokémon hit.
Upgrade.Enhanced Description: Reduces this move's cooldown by 0.4s per target hit every time the user's basic attack hits an opposing Pokémon. (1.6s total for an entire basic attack animation on a single target).

Move 2.Name: Fire Spin
Move 2.Description: The user shoots fire in the designated direction which bursts into a vortex of fire on the first opposing Pokémon hit or after traveling max distance, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect. The vortex of fire remains for 5s, dealing damage over time to opposing Pokémon in the area of effect every 0.5s (up to 10 times) and decreasing their movement speed by 25% for 1s when hit.

Upgrade.Name: Flare Blitz
Upgrade.Description:
The user charges at the designated opposing Pokémon cloaked in fire, damaging opposing Pokémon, throwing the target, and granting the user a shield for 5s when this move hits.

  When the user is mega evolved, reduces the cooldown by 40% of its current cooldown if it hits an enemy player and knocks up all opposing Pokémon hit by the explosion.
Upgrade.Enhanced Description: Decreases the movement speed of the target by 40% for 3s when this move hits.

Unite Move.Name: Seismic Slam
Unite Move.Description: The user briefly becomes unstoppable and grabs the designated Pokémon from the opposing team. The target is bound, and the user and the target become invincible as the user flies up then slams them onto the ground, damaging the target and nearby opposing Pokémon, dealing an additional 8% max HP damage to each opposing Pokémon hit. The user then mega evolves into Mega Charizard X for 20 seconds. During Mega evolution, Mega Charizard X receives 50% movement speed increase.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Blaze
Passive Ability.Description: Increases Attack by 20% for 5 seconds after Charizard gets hit.
Passive Ability.Description 2: Upon Mega Evolving, Mega Charizard Y creates a sunny area around it. While inside the sunny area, Mega Charizard Y does 10% increased damage.

Mega Charizard Y.Attack: Breathes fire at opposing Pokémon, dealing damage 4 times per basic attack. Charizard may move while attacking but is slowed by 5% while breathing fire. Charizard deals additional damage to opposing Pokémon that have been burned by the user's moves. This additional damage cannot land critical hits; additional damage benefits from regular lifesteal. Basic attacks gain increased range upon evolving into Charmeleon and into Charizard.

Move 1.Name: Flame Burst
Move 1.Description: The user attacks with a flame in the designated direction which bursts on the first opposing Pokémon hit or after traveling max distance, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and burning them for 4s (dealing damage 5 times). When this move hits, the user's movement speed is increased by 20% for 3s. The Attack of opposing Pokémon burned by this move is decreased by 5%.

Upgrade.Name: Flamethrower
Upgrade.Description:
The user attacks with a blast of fire in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon in a line and burning them for 4s (dealing damage 5 times). When this move hits, the user's movement speed is increased by 40% for 3s. The user is able to move freely when using this move. If the user is mega evolved, the user's movement speed is instead increased by 15% for 3s.

  The Attack of opposing Pokémon burned by this move is decreased by 5%.
Upgrade.Enhanced Description: Increases the damage of this move and its burns.

Move 2.Name: Fire Spin
Move 2.Description: The user shoots fire in the designated direction which bursts into a vortex of fire on the first opposing Pokémon hit or after traveling max distance, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect. The vortex of fire remains for 5s, dealing damage over time to opposing Pokémon in the area of effect every 0.5s (up to 10 times) and decreasing their movement speed by 25% for 1s when hit.

Upgrade.Name: Fire Blast
Upgrade.Description: The user shoots an intense blast of fire in the designated direction which explodes on the first opposing Pokémon hit or after traveling max distance, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect. The blast of all-consuming fire remains on the ground for 5s, dealing damage over time to opposing Pokémon in the area of effect every 0.5s (up to 10 times) and decreasing their movement speed by 30% for 1s when hit. The user is able to move freely when using this move. If the user is mega evolved, the area of effect of this move increases.
Upgrade.Enhanced Description: Increases the damage of this move and the damage over time.

Unite Move.Name: Seismic Slam
Unite Move.Description: The user briefly becomes unstoppable and grabs the designated Pokémon from the opposing team. The target is bound, and the user and the target become invincible as the user flies up then slams them onto the ground, damaging the target and nearby opposing Pokémon, dealing an additional 8% max HP damage to each opposing Pokémon hit. The user gains hindrance resistance and mega evolves into Mega Charizard Y the moment they slam into the ground and fly up into the air for 20s. While flying in the air, the user is able to use basic attacks as well as moves and is able to move freely over obstacles. Unite Move basic attacks burn opposing Pokémon for 1s (dealing damage 2 times). The user restores HP for 80% of the damage dealt with Unite Move basic attacks (excluding burns or additional damage). Damage dealt by burns from Unite Move basic attacks also benefit from regular lifesteal. The Attack of opposing Pokémon burned by this move is decreased by 5%.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 10% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Swift Swim
Passive Ability.Description: When the Pokémon uses a move, their movement speed increases by 30% for 3s. Each time this Pokémon knocks out an opposing Pokémon, scores a goal, or otherwise makes a contribution in battle, their effort gauge increases. Once the gauge is full, the Pokémon evolves into Gyarados.
Passive Ability.Description 2:
This Pokémon decreases the Attack of opposing Pokémon they damage by 30% for 3s.

Upon evolving, Gyarados passively gains bonus 1200 HP, 100 Attack, and 40% basic attack speed until the end of the battle; these stats are not affected by boost emblem color bonuses and are maintained when mega evolved.

Gyarados' passive changes upon mega evolving. Gain 10% Atk, 30% Def Penetration, 10% Def, and 10% SpDef.

Mega Gyarados.Attack:
Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing increased damage.

Magikarp and Mega Evolved Gyarados do not have a boosted attack. Mega Evolved Gyarados lunges when using a basic attack.

Move 1.Name: Flail
Move 1.Description: Flails on the spot, damaging nearby opposing Pokémon; damage strengthens for every 33% max HP the user is missing.

Upgrade.Name: Dragon Breath
Upgrade.Description:
Exhales a mighty gust in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and paralyzing them for 3s when it hits, decreasing their movement speed and basic attack speed by 30%. If this move hits, gains a buff for 5s; increasing the range and damage of auto attacks; and increasing basic attack speed by a minimum of 40%, strengthening by 15% for each additional opposing Pokémon hit (up to 2 times; maximum 70%).

  If the user is mega evolved, instead Mega Gyarados becomes unstoppable then chases down and performs 5 special auto attacks on targets hit by this attack.
Upgrade.Enhanced Description: Increases the damage dealt by this move and basic attacks.

Move 2.Name: Splash
Move 2.Description: Jumps to the designated location forward. A maximum of 3 uses can be kept in reserve, with a 2s cooldown between uses.

Upgrade.Name: Waterfall
Upgrade.Description:
Charges forward up to 3 times, damaging opposing Pokémon hit with each charge; waiting for at least 0.07s before dashing forward with the next charge. The first charge is a regular dash forward; the next movement within 2s after the last charge dashes forward with the same effect. Dragon Breath can be used within the 2s duration in between charges without interrupting this move's course. Using Dragon Current ends this move early. This move's cooldown begins when the move ends. If two charges hit opposing Pokémon, grants a shield for 2s. If all three charges hit opposing Pokémon, the third charge throws opposing Pokémon hit for 0.45s.

  If the user is mega evolved, instead the cooldown begins when the move is used. Additionally, the previous shield and throw effects are granted even if the move misses, and the cooldown of the move is reduced by 10% for each dash that hits.

Unite Move.Name: Dragon Current
Unite Move.Description: Becomes untargetable and dives underwater for up to 4s while this Unite Move is held, increasing movement speed by 45%. When the button is released, the user leaps up forcefully and attacks. If the user stays underwater for 1s, Gyarados strengthens the movement speed increase to 55% and creates a whirlpool when surfacing, applying a continuous slow to opposing Pokémon hit. If the user stays underwater for 2s, Gyarados strengthens the movement speed increase to 65% and creates a waterspout when surfacing, throwing opposing Pokémon hit for 1s. The longer the move is held, the larger the area of effect becomes. After using this Unite Move, the user Mega Evolves for 20 seconds.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Justified
Passive Ability.Description: When the user is damaged, their attack stat increases by 8% for 4s up to 4 times.
Passive Ability.Description 2: Lucario's passive ability changes to Adaptability upon mega evolving. When the user deals damage with moves, their attack stat increases by 5% for 4s up to 10 times.

Mega Lucario.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with increased range every third attack, hitting twice. The first hit damages opposing Pokémon with a normal basic attack; the second hit is a follow-up attack with a bone, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area a second time and throwing them for 0.5s.

Move 1.Name: Quick Attack
Move 1.Description: Dashes forward, damaging opposing Pokémon hit.

Upgrade.Name: Power-Up Punch
Upgrade.Description:
The user receives 30% reduced damage and decreases their movement speed by 15% as they charge up power for up to 4s, reaching maximum charge after 1s; then dashes forward with a devastating punch when released, damaging the first opposing Pokémon hit, dealing additional missing HP damage to the target and shoving them for 0.5s. If this move hits, the user readies a boosted attack. This move's cooldown is reduced by 1s each time one of the user's moves lands a hit. If this move is canceled or not released after 4s, it goes on a 1.4s cooldown.

  When the user is mega evolved; the move can hit multiple opposing Pokémon and can be overcharged for an additional 0.4s to throw all opposing Pokémon it hits for 1s.
Upgrade.Enhanced Description: Becomes unstoppable while charging this move.

Move 2.Name: Meteor Mash
Move 2.Description: Punches with the force of a meteor in the designated direction after 0.4s, damaging opposing Pokémon hit and shoving them in the designated direction, stunning those hit for 0.4s.

Upgrade.Name: Close Combat
Upgrade.Description:
The user becomes unstoppable and rapidly punches in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area in front of them (up to 11 times), and restoring the user's HP each time this move hits. The next auto attack within 5s after using this move gains increased range and causes the user to lunge at an opposing Pokémon with a kick.

  When the user is mega evolved; the move lasts longer dealing damage up to 16 times reducing this move's cooldown by 0.4s for each hit, can be slowly rotated, the last hit can be targeted in any direction, and this move can be ended early, after channeling for at least 1s, by activating the move again or by using Power-Up Punch. The first hit of this move has 12x the normal healing. Hitting an enemy with Power-Up punch reduces the cooldown of this move by 1s.
Upgrade.Enhanced Description: Increases the damage of this move.

Unite Move.Name: Aura Cannon
Unite Move.Description: The user becomes unstoppable and channels aura into a huge sphere, then launches the sphere in the designated direction, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon in its path. The aura sphere picks up speed as it travels; at close range, a target can be hit up to 4 times, while at max speed a target will only be hit once. After unleashing this move the user mega evolves for 25s adding additional effects to Close Combat and Power-Up Punch and changing the passive ability to Adaptability.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Pickup
Passive Ability.Description: Attacking Pokémon from the opposing team copies their battle item for 30s. Defeating a wild Pokémon instead copies a random battle item for 30s. The copied item temporarily functions as the user’s battle item, without replacing or affecting the user’s original item. Once an item is copied, this ability will go on cooldown for 30s.  Moving towards Aeos energy or gold coins increases the user's movement speed by 20%. Picking up gold coins increases the user's movement speed for 3s by 40% decaying by 5% every 0.5s to a minimum of 20%, and speeds up the rate at which Pickup's cooldown goes down by 13.5% for each gold coin picked up. Gold coins will stay on the field for 7s. The user can pick up an opposing Meowth's gold coins as if they were their own.

Meowth.Attack: Scratches at opposing Pokémon becoming a boosted attack with every third attack dealing increased damage and dropping a gold coin.

Move 1.Name: Scratch
Move 1.Description: The user scratches a designated Pokémon with its sharp claws, dealing damage.

Upgrade 1.Name: Pay Day
Upgrade 1.Description:
The user hurls a gold coin at the designated Pokémon, dealing damage, slowing down the target by 30% for 1.5s, and dropping a gold coin.

  2 uses can be kept in reserve, picking up a gold coin reduces the cooldown of a use by 4s.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increases the damage dealt by this move.

Upgrade 2.Name: Fury Swipes
Upgrade 2.Description:
The user applies a coin mark on opposing Pokémon they hit, the coin mark has up to 5 stacks and lasts for 5s. The user swipes twice with its sharp claws at the designated Pokémon, dealing damage, and granting the user a shield for 5s, and an additional shield per hit (up to 5x) for 5s. The number of swipes can be increased up to 5 if the coin mark is at 3 stacks or higher. Subsequent swipes deal half of the damage of the first hit. This attack will stun opposing Pokémon that have 1/2/3+ coin mark stacks for 0.3/0.5/0.8s respectively.

  If the maximum number of swipes hit, the cooldowns for Feint, Feint Attack, and Assurance are reduced by 1s per hit, the 5th hit will fully reset the cooldown. If the coin mark is filled up, this move will consume and reset the mark.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increases the damage dealt by this move.

Move 2.Name: Feint
Move 2.Description: The user dashes at the designated Pokémon, dealing damage to opponents hit.

Upgrade 1.Name: Feint Attack
Upgrade 1.Description:
The user pounces at the designated Pokémon and scratches them with their claws, dealing damage and stunning the target for 0.6s. When this move hits the user is granted a shield for 3s and can quickly move in a chosen direction.

  The user's next basic attack becomes a boosted attack. If the coin mark is filled up, this move will consume and reset the mark (although this move does not benefit from the coin mark in any fashion).
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Improves the strength of the shield.

Upgrade 2.Name: Assurance
Upgrade 2.Description:
The user applies a coin mark on opposing Pokémon they hit, the coin mark has up to 5 stacks and lasts for 5s. The user charges in the designated direction, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon hit and restoring the user's HP, furthermore the move will restore additional HP if the targets have a coin mark. The more stacks the coin mark has the more potent the heal.

  When this move is used on a Pokémon with a coin mark that has 5 stacks, the damage is doubled. If the coin mark is filled up, this move will consume and reset the mark.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Reduces this moves cooldown by 1s.

Unite Move.Name: Gold Coin Barrage
Unite Move.Description: The user becomes unstoppable and unleashes a barrage of gold coins toward the designated Pokémon from the opposing team, dealing damage in a small area up to 10 times. If another Pokémon on the opposing team stands in the way, they will be hit instead. During the attack, up to 4 coins will periodically drop near Pokémon hit by this move. This move can be cancelled early. Meowth can move while using this move, but is slowed by 110%.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 80% Movement Speed, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Overgrow
Passive Ability.Description: When the user is at 50% max HP or less, if they would take damage they instead disappear into leaves, becoming invisible for 1.5s or until attacking (60s CD). This effect also increases the user's movement speed by 15%, damage by 15% and heals by 15% of the damage dealt for 4s.

Meowscarada.Attack: Gains a boosted attack every 5 seconds that leaps towards the target dealing additional damage.

Move 1.Name: Leafage
Move 1.Description: Launch 4 leaves that deal damage to enemies hit and decrease their movement speed by 50% for 2.5s. When an enemy is hit by a leaf, subsequent leaves deal 20% reduced damage.

Upgrade 1.Name: Flower Trick
Upgrade 1.Description: Attach a flower bomb to an enemy that lasts up to 5s. This move can be used again to detonate the flower bomb at will. When it explodes it deals damage and additional damage equal to 18% of the target's missing HP. Against Wild Pokémon: The additional damage from missing HP is capped at 1000. If an enemy that has a flower bomb attached to them is damaged by Meowscarada, the explosion's area of effect and damage are increased. If the explosion knocks out an enemy player with this move, the move's cooldown is reset.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increases the range of application and explosion's area of effect. Also increases movement speed when planting the seed by 30% for 3s diminishing by 10% every 1s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Night Slash
Upgrade 2.Description: The users throws 3 slashing waves with their claws, dealing damage and applying a mark for 5s to enemies hit. Subsequent waves deal 50% damage of the first. Basic attacks by Meowscarada have 50% increased critical-hit rate on marked enemies. When Meowscarada deals damage to marked enemies with basic attacks, this move's cooldown is reduced by 0.5s and Meowscarada recovers HP. The HP recovery works in a cycle of 3 basic attacks; the first attack will heal 100% of the ratio, the second 50% and the third 10%, then the fourth will heal 100% of the ratio again.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increases the critical-hit rate on marked enemies to a 65% increase and restores additional HP from hitting marked targets.

Move 2.Name: Hone Claws
Move 2.Description: Dash in a designated direction while sharpening claws, increasing attack speed by 80% and increasing the damage of the next three basic attacks for 3s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Double Team
Upgrade 1.Description: Dash and create an illusory copy in order to befuddle enemies. The clone has the same HP and defenses as Meowscarada but takes 30% more damage and lasts for 3.3s. If this move is used again, the user swaps places with the illusory copy, dispelling the copy and creating an explosion of petals at both the clone and Meowscarada's positions that deal damage and leave enemies hit unable to act for 0.8s. Enemies may only take damage from one petal explosion. If the clone's HP were to reach 0 before a swap, the same type of petal explosion occurs at the clone's location only. Creating the clone also increases Meowscarada's movement speed by 70% for 3s diminishing by 10% every 0.5s. Cooldown starts when first used.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increases the duration of the clone to 4.6s and sets the increased damage the clone receives to 20%.

Upgrade 2.Name: Trailblaze
Upgrade 2.Description: Leap to the designated location, dealing damage to enemies hit and leaving them paralyzed, decreasing their attack speed by 40% and movement speed by 40% for 2s. If Meowscarada hits enemies with this move, Meowscarada's basic attack speed is increased by 100% for 4s and movement speed is increased by 60% for 4s diminishing by 5% every 0.5s down to minimum of 35%. When used from tall grass, this move's leap range increases. If Meowscarada knocks out an enemy player or makes an assist, this move's cooldown is reset.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Grants a shield that lasts 3 seconds when used.

Unite Move.Name: Floral Flourish
Unite Move.Description: Move instantly to the designated location, creating a whirlwind around Meowscarada for 3s that continually deals damage to enemies every 0.25s, up to 13 times. During the blink, Meowsacarda is Invincible. Then, Meowscarada will slowly walk forward with the storm. While using this move, the user cannot use other attacks or change directions without the use of Eject Button, and the move can be stopped if it is used again. Hits on enemy Pokémon reduce the cooldown of Night Slash and Flower Trick by 1 second per enemy hit.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 80% Movement Speed, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Clear Body
Passive Ability.Description: Reduces the duration of hindrance effects by 10% when enemy players are nearby. The more enemy players there are, the more the hindrance effects are reduced, up to a maximum of 5 enemy players (50% max).

Metagross.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, striking with an increased area of attack. When a boosted attack hits, the cooldown of Iron Defense, Meteor Mash or Gyro Ball is reduced by 10%. If multiple targets are hit, the cooldown is instead reduced by 20%.

Move 1.Name: Iron Defense
Move 1.Description: Gain a shield lasting 5s and gain a boosted attack. That boosted attack deals additional damage.

Upgrade 1.Name: Meteor Mash
Upgrade 1.Description: The user charges power in their fist, dealing damage to enemies in an area up to 4x and slowing them by 20% for 3s while granting the user a shield for 5s. Enemies may dodge the charging damage by moving out of the area. The more enemies that this move hits, the more shield the user gains (stacking up to 8 times) and the more damage is dealt with the next basic attack. The next basic attack hits with a hard punch fired like a meteor, dealing damage to enemies in an area of effect. The level of charge depends on how many hits were made during the charging.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Restores HP when the punch hits enemies.

Upgrade 2.Name: Gyro Ball
Upgrade 2.Description: Spin rapidly, dealing damage to nearby enemies. Hitting enemies with the outer edge of the spin grants a shield to the user for 4s. The shield stacks based on the number of targets hit up to a maximum of 6 times, with wild Pokémon granting 1 stack and enemy players granting 3 stacks.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: On expiration of shield duration, converts 30% of the remaining shield to healing.

Move 2.Name: Tackle
Move 2.Description: Scan in a designated direction. If the scan hits an enemy, the user then charges toward the enemy hit, dealing damage.

Upgrade 1.Name: Zen Headbutt
Upgrade 1.Description: Fires a psychic wave in a designated direction. If the move hits an enemy, the user then charges toward the enemy hit, dealing damage and throwing them for 0.8s.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: After dealing damage with Zen Headbutt, reduce incoming damage by 20% for 2s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Magnet Rise
Upgrade 2.Description: Levitates for up to 4s using electrically-generated magnetism, increasing the user's movement speed by 60% diminishing by 15% every second. If a basic attack is made while levitating, the user will fall to the ground forcefully, dealing damage to nearby enemies and knocking them up for 0.6s. This basic attack can lunge at a target crossing terrain and obstacles.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: While levitating, reduce incoming damage by 30%.

Unite Move.Name: Compute and Crush
Unite Move.Description: Quickly analyzes the position of nearby enemies, granting a shield based on the number of enemies analyzed and become unstoppable. When 2 or fewer enemies are analyzed, lunge towards the enemy with the lowest HP, leaving it unable to act for 0.8s and dealing damage to it thrice, with the third hit dealing damage based on the target's missing HP. If an enemy is knocked out by this move, the user recovers 30% of its Unite Move gauge. If there are three or more analyzed, lunge toward the enemy with the lowest HP, dealing damage to nearby enemies and creating a wall around the user. If a wall is created, Compute and Crash may be used again to take down the wall.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 30% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Synchronize
Passive Ability.Description: Each time Mew uses a move, Mew and nearby allies have their movement speed increased by 15% for 2s.
