Passive Ability.Description 2: When Mew reaches level 5, the Move Reset icon can be used to reset Mew's moves and learn new moves. This ability goes on a 25s cooldown after it's used. Each time Mew knocks out or makes an assist on an enemy player, or scores a goal, the Move Reset cooldown is reduced (Knockout: 40%, Assist: 20%, Goal: 5%). Using Move Reset adds 5000 Unite Move energy to Mystical Mirage.

Mew.Attack: Each time Mew uses a move, they gain a boost counter. A maximum of 3 boost counters can be stored. After 3 counters are stored (they have to be consumed within 8s or they disappear), Mew's next basic attack becomes a boosted attack that consumes all counters and launches a ball of psychic energy at an enemy. During the lock-on animation Mew can use moves. The further the ball travels, the more damage it deals (4% more damage per threshold, stacking additively). This ball pierces through wild Pokémon, but will stop traveling upon contact with the first enemy player.

Unite Move.Name: Mystical Mirage
Unite Move.Description: Mew becomes unstoppable and floats in the air for 1s, then becoming invincible and invisible for up to 6s until using an attack or move. A field is created around Mew for 5s This field travels with Mew. Mew and all allies within the area become stealthed for 4s. After the field expires, this move deals damage to enemies within the area-of-effect.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Upgrade 1.Name: Electro Ball
Upgrade 1.Description: Hurl an electric orb, dealing damage to enemies in the area-of-effect and leaving them paralyzed (40% slow, 10% attack speed reduction) for 2s. This move deals more damage the lower the enemies' remaining HP is.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Strengthens the effect of the paralysis inflicted by this move to 60% movement speed reduction and 30% attack speed reduction.

Upgrade 2.Name: Solar Beam
Upgrade 2.Description: Blast a bundled beam of light, dealing damage 3 times to enemies in the area-of-effect. If this move hits an enemy, Mew gains an additional boost counter.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Reduce this move's cooldown by 0.5s for each enemy hit.

Upgrade 3.Name: Surf
Upgrade 3.Description: Charge forward on a wave, shoving enemies for 0.5s and leaving them unable to act for 0.5s. Mew gains a shield for 3s and becomes immune to hindrances while using this move. At the end of this move, Mew can jump in a designated direction and becomes immune to hindrances for a short time. If this move hits an enemy, Mew gains an additional boost counter.
Upgrade 3.Enhanced Description: Strengthens the shield effect of this move.

Upgrade 1.Name: Coaching
Upgrade 1.Description: Teleport to an ally, granting them a shield for 3s and increasing basic attack speed by 40% for 2s. If this move is used on an ally who hasn't been coached within 7s, the cooldown of this move is reduced by 90%. If this move is used on an ally who has been recently coached, this move goes on cooldown. The cooldown of Electro Ball, Solar Beam, and Surf is reduced by 1s each time this move is used.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Reduce this move's cooldown by 1s and reduces the timer of recently coached on allies to 6s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Light Screen
Upgrade 2.Description: Create a translucent wall in the designated location for 4s that prevents enemies from passing and shoves them for 0.5s if they make contact with the wall. If Mew's Electro Ball, Solar Beam, or Surf passes through the wall, the effects of those moves will be enhanced (such as increased damage, range, and area-of-effect). If this move is used again within 4s, the wall is pulled towards Mew and follows them as they move for an additional 4s. While the wall moves with Mew, enemy attacks that pass through it will deal 25% reduced damage but will not prevent enemies from passing and does not shove them anymore.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increases the size of the wall.

Upgrade 3.Name: Agility
Upgrade 3.Description: Move quickly in a designated direction, increasing Mew's movement speed by 5% for 2s. Holds 2 uses in reserve and cannot be used more than once every 2s.
Upgrade 3.Enhanced Description: Increases the distance Mew moves in the designated direction.

Passive Ability.Name: Pressure
Passive Ability.Description: When Mewtwo deals damage to enemy players with a basic attack, the Mega gauge increases up to 8 times. As the Mega gauge increases, Mewtwo's Attack, Defense, and Sp. Def are increased by 2%, up to 10 times. If Mewtwo is level 5 or higher, and the Mega gauge has increased at least 8 times, it Mega Evolves. The Mega Evolution lasts 10s and increases Mewtwo's Attack by an additional 18%, Defense and Sp. Def by an additional 18%, max HP by 10%, movement speed by 5%, and has a fixed attack speed.  Consumes up to 30 Aeos Energy upon Mega Evolving. Mega Evolution duration is extended by 1 second for every 5 energy consumed. Energy is consumed regardless if you have the next multiple of 5. The Mega gauge does not deplete upon being KO'd.

Mewtwo X.Attack: When Mewtwo Mega Evolves, deal increased damage and becomes a boosted attack with every third attack.

Move 1.Name: Confusion
Move 1.Description: Deal damage to an enemy and leave them unable to act for 1s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Future Sight
Upgrade 1.Description:
Mewtwo pulls the designated enemy toward itself dealing damage, leaving them unable to act for 0.75s and locking on to them. The locked-on enemy has their movement speed decreased by 25% for 3s and takes 10% increased damage from Mewtwo. After 3s, Mewtwo deals damage to the locked-on enemy a second time, and additional damage equal to 50% of any damage they received while locked-on.

  Against Enemy Players: Maximum damage is capped at 2000.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: The locked-on enemy instead takes 20% increased damage.

Upgrade 2.Name: Psystrike
Upgrade 2.Description:
Mewtwo becomes unstoppable and starts directing psychic waves at the designated enemy, each hit dealing damage and decreasing their movement speed by 10% for 1s, stacking up to 5 times. While Mewtwo is directing psychic waves, it takes 15% reduced damage. At the end of the move, Mewtwo sends a final hit, dealing damage to the designated enemy and nearby enemies then throws them for 0.6s.

  If Psystrike is intercepted by an enemy that isn't the intended target, there's no explosion and the enemy hit is shoved instead.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Movement speed reduction on enemies is increased to 15% for 1s, stacking up to 5 times.

Move 2.Name: Barrier
Move 2.Description: Mewtwo gains a shield for 3s. While the shield effect is active, its movement speed is increased by 20%.

Upgrade 1.Name: Recover
Upgrade 1.Description: Mewtwo gains a shield for 3s. While the shield effect is active, movement speed is increased by 30%, and Mewtwo recovers HP equal to 20% of all incoming damage received from enemies while the shield is active. When Mewtwo takes enough damage for the shield effect to be removed, all of the user's move cooldowns are reduced by 25% of their current cooldown, and the Mega gauge increases twice.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increases the amount of HP recovered to 30% of incoming damage received.

Upgrade 2.Name: Teleport
Upgrade 2.Description: Mewtwo teleports to the designated location. For 5s, movement speed is increased by 30%, Mewtwo deals 10% more damage, and the Mega gauge increases 50% faster.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Damage dealt is increased to 20%.

Unite Move.Name: Infinite Psyburn
Unite Move.Description: Mewtwo becomes unstoppable while revealing enemy players and channeling a powerful attack on the enemies' current position. After 1s, Mewtwo brings down a powerful psychic beam on their original position, dealing damage to enemies around each point of impact, leaving them unable to act for 1s and decreasing their Defense by 20% for 3s. Each Pokémon can only be hit by 1 psychic beam.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Pressure
Passive Ability.Description: When Mewtwo deals damage to enemy players with a basic attack, the Mega gauge increases up to 12 times. As the Mega gauge increases, Mewtwo's Sp. Atk is increased by 1.5%, and attack speed is increased by 3%, up to 10 times. If Mewtwo is level 5 or higher, and the Mega gauge has increased at least 12 times, Mewtwo Mega Evolves. The Mega Evolution lasts 10s and increases Sp. Atk by an additional 10%, attack speed by an additional 35%, max HP by 10%, and movement speed by 5%.  Consumes up to 30 Aeos Energy upon Mega Evolving. Mega Evolution duration is extended by 1 second for every 5 energy consumed. Energy is consumed regardless if you have the next multiple of 5. The Mega gauge does not deplete upon being KO'd.

Mewtwo Y.Attack: When Mewtwo Mega Evolves, attacks have increased range and deal damage in an area-of-effect centered on the target. When an attack deals damage to an enemy, their movement speed is decreased.

Move 1.Name: Confusion
Move 1.Description: Deal damage to an enemy and leave them unable to act for 1s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Future Sight
Upgrade 1.Description:
Mewtwo shoves the designated enemy, dealing damage, leaving them unable to act for 0.5s and locking onto them. The locked-on enemy has their movement speed decreased by 35% for 3s and takes 10% increased damage from Mewtwo. After 3s, Mewtwo deals damage to the locked-on enemy a second time, and additional damage equal to 50% of any damage they received while locked-on.

  Additional damage is capped at 1500.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: The locked-on enemy instead takes 15% increased damage.

Upgrade 2.Name: Psystrike
Upgrade 2.Description:
Mewtwo becomes unstoppable and starts directing psychic waves at the designated enemy, each hit dealing damage and decreasing their movement speed by 10% for 1s, stacking up to 5 times. Psystrike damage is increased based on distance from the target enemy; the farther the projectile travels, the more damage it deals. At the end of the move, Mewtwo sends a final hit, dealing damage to the designated enemy and nearby enemies then throws them for 0.6s.

  If Psystrike is intercepted by an enemy that isn't the intended target, there's no explosion and the enemy hit is shoved instead.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Movement speed reduction on enemies is increased to 15% for 1s, stacking up to 5 times.

Move 2.Name: Barrier
Move 2.Description: Mewtwo gains a shield for 3s. While the shield effect is active, its movement speed is increased by 20%.

Upgrade 1.Name: Recover
Upgrade 1.Description: Mewtwo gains a shield for 3s. While the shield effect is active, movement speed is increased by 30%, and Mewtwo recovers HP equal to 40% of the damage dealt from Basic Attacks. If at the end of the 3s the shield hasn't been destroyed, all of the user's move cooldowns are reduced by 25% of their current cooldown, and the Mega gauge increases once.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increases the amount of HP recovered to 50% of damage dealt with Basic Attacks.

Upgrade 2.Name: Teleport
Upgrade 2.Description: Mewtwo teleports to the designated location. For 2s after the first cast of Teleport, movement speed is increased by 30%, Mewtwo deals 20% more damage, and the Mega gauge increases 50% faster. During those 2s, Mewtwo can teleport again once.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Damage dealt is increased to 30%.

Unite Move.Name: Infinite Psyburn
Unite Move.Description: Mewtwo becomes unstoppable while revealing enemy players and channeling a powerful attack on the enemies' current position. After 1s, Mewtwo brings down a powerful psychic beam on their original position, dealing damage to enemies around each point of impact, leaving them unable to act for 0.6s and decreasing their Sp. Defense by 15% for 3s. Each Pokémon can only be hit by 1 psychic beam.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Disguise
Passive Ability.Description: Mimikyu starts the game in Disguised Form. While in Disguised Form, when Mimikyu would take damage from an enemy, Mimikyu instead takes 5% remaining HP as piercing damage, becomes Impervious for 0.5s (immune to damage but not hindrances) and changes to Busted Form. A revenge mark is applied on the enemy that broke the disguise. Mimikyu's movement speed increases by 10% when approaching revenge-marked enemies and deals 10% increased damage to them. After 50s in Busted Form, Mimikyu returns to Disguised Form. The time it takes to return to Disguised Form is reduced by 25s when Mimikyu knocks out an enemy player and is fully reset upon respawning.

Mimikyu.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack or when using a move, striking twice with an increased area of attack.

Move 1.Name: Astonish
Move 1.Description: Shout in a startling fashion, dealing damage to enemies hit.

Upgrade 1.Name: Play Rough
Upgrade 1.Description: Mimikyu dashes in a designated direction. If Mimikyu connects with an enemy, Mimikyu latches on, becoming invincible and follows the target, slowing them by 30% for 1s and dealing damage to them 5 times. Mimikyu will then leap off of the enemy in a designated direction. Hits after the first deal 70% reduced damage.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increases Mimikyu's movement speed by 20% for 3s after the attack is finished.

Upgrade 2.Name: Shadow Claw
Upgrade 2.Description: Mimikyu slashes in front of themself with sharp claws, dealing damage to enemies hit. Each hit decreases enemy movement speed by 20% for 1.5s, stacking up to 3 times, and restores the user's HP. Whenever Mimikyu hits at least one enemy with a basic or boosted attack, this move's cooldown is reduced by 1s, and the number of hits when this move is used again increases. Up to 4 of these additional hits can be stored and are lost after 5s without auto attacking or after using this move.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: At the end of the move, deal an additional hit of damage equal to 12% of missing HP. This damage is capped at 500 against wild Pokémon.

Move 2.Name: Scratch
Move 2.Description: Mimikyu charges in the designated direction, dealing damage to enemies hit and decreasing their movement speed by 20% for 2s. For 5s after using this move, Scratch can be used a second time, making Mimikyu attack in front of themself, dealing damage to enemies hit and additional damage based on their missing HP. Additional damage is equal to 10% of the enemy's missing HP. Against Wild Pokemon: The total damage is capped at 500.

Upgrade 1.Name: Shadow Sneak
Upgrade 1.Description:
Mimikyu moves backwards a short distance and extends their shadow, marking an enemy hit as a shadow target for 3s. If the shadow passes through tall grass or a wall, the shadow extends even further. If Mimikyu deals damage to an enemy who is marked as a shadow target, each hit dealt will deal additional damage equal to 6% of the target's missing HP. If this move is used again, Mimikyu moves to the enemy marked as a shadow target, fears them for 0.25s, deals damage to enemies in an area, and refresh the duration of that enemy's shadow mark. If the marked target gets knocked out Shadow Sneak's cooldown is reset and Mimikyu recovers HP.

  Against Wild Pokemon: The % missing HP damage is capped at 150.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Reduces this move's cooldown by 1s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Trick Room
Upgrade 2.Description: Leap to a location and create a bizarre area around Mimikyu in a square for 6s. If a slow would be applied to Mimikyu within the area, Mimikyu instead receives a movement speed increase equal to the slow rate. While inside the Trick Room, Mimikyu receives 50% reduced damage from enemies outside of the Trick Room. This move can be used as often as desired while inside the Trick Room, teleporting Mimikyu a set distance with each use.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Reduces this move's cooldown by 1s.

Unite Move.Name: Play With Me...
Unite Move.Description: Mimikyu leaps at an enemy and traps them inside Mimikyu's rag, dealing damage over time and granting the user a shield. The trapped enemy is only affected by this Unite Move and effects applied by Mimikyu before using this Unite Move. If Mimikyu loses their shield, or if 2.8s passes, the user stops attacking and jumps in the designated direction. The maximum number of hits is 7, hitting every 0.4s. The Unite buffs occur after the move ends. This ability counters Unstoppable.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Hadron Engine
Passive Ability.Description: Create Electric Terrain around Miraidon for 10s when hitting an enemy player with a Move. If Miraidon has Aeos Energy, up to 40 energy (in multiples of 10) will be consumed when the Electric Terrain is created, increasing the size of the Electric Terrain. Miraidon and Pokémon cannot be put to sleep on Electric Terrain. Miraidon on the Electric Terrain deals 30% additional Move damage while allies will deal 10% additional Move damage. Electric Terrain also strengthens ally team goals' healing and shielding by 30% and weakens enemy team goals' healing and shielding by 30%. This ability goes on a 30s cooldown after it's triggered.

Miraidon.Attack: Miraidon does not have a boosted attack.

Move 1.Name: Thunder Shock
Move 1.Description: Fire a jolt of electricity in a line in the designated direction, dealing damage to enemies hit.

Upgrade 1.Name: Charge Beam
Upgrade 1.Description: Charge power before firing an electric beam in a designated direction. If this move hits an enemy, Miraidon's Sp. Atk is increased by 10% for 6s and stores electric power, stacking twice. If electric power is stored twice within a short time, Charge Beam becomes Boosted. Boosted Charge Beam can be held for up to 10s and continuously fires an electric beam in a designated direction, dealing damage to all enemies in the area of effect and granting Miraidon Hindrance Resistance. Miraidon may move while firing the electric beam but may not change the original direction. A maximum of 2 uses can be kept in reserve. There is a 1s cooldown between uses.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Reduces the cooldown to charge by 0.5s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Electro Drift
Upgrade 2.Description: Race forward while spinning, dealing damage to enemies in the path. If this move hits an enemy, Miraidon stores electric power. If electric power is stored twice within a short time, Electro Drift becomes Boosted. Boosted Electro Drift can be held for up to 10s and homes in on a designated enemy with the spinning attack, dealing damage to any enemy hit. This move deals increased damage instead if the remaining HP of the targets hit are below 50%. During this move, Miraidon is Hindrance Resistant. A maximum of 2 uses can be kept in reserve. There is a 1s cooldown between uses.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Reduces the cooldown to charge by 4s.

Move 2.Name: Thunder Wave
Move 2.Description: Discharges electricity at a designated enemy, dealing damage and leaving them paralyzed, decreasing attack speed by 10% and movement speed by 30% for 2s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Thunder
Upgrade 1.Description: Summon a cloud in the skies dropping thunderbolts at set intervals. The summoned cloud moves slowly towards the nearest enemy. Thunderbolts deal damage and apply a 10% slow to enemies hit.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increases the slow effect to 20%.

Upgrade 2.Name: Parabolic Charge
Upgrade 2.Description: Floods the area around Miraidon with electricity, dealing damage and applying a 50% slow to enemies hit for 2s. If this move hits an enemy, Miraidon recovers HP and 1 stored use of either Charge Beam or Electro Drift. The more targets hit, the more HP Miraidon recovers.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Grants a shield when this move is used.

Unite Move.Name: Bright Future Meteor Storm
Unite Move.Description: The user gains hindrance resistance and calls down up to 5 meteorites in a row, each at a designated area, damaging opposing Pokémon hit by each meteorite. If a meteorite hits an opposing Pokémon, it increases the damage of subsequent meteorites that hit by an additional 20% (up to 80% additional increased damage for the final meteorite if all preceding meteorites hit). The final meteorite damages opposing Pokémon in a wider area of effect and throws them for 1s when it hits. All effects related to Unite Move use activate when the first meteorite is called down. This Unite Move ends when released, consuming 10% of the Unite Move gauge. Each meteorite called down consumes at most 30% of the Unite Move gauge.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Filter
Passive Ability.Description: Upon casting a Move, Mr. Mime takes 10% less damage for 2s.

Mr. Mime.Attack: Gains a Boosted Attack every 5s, dealing increased damage and throwing enemies in the air for 0.5s.

Move 1.Name: Fake Out
Move 1.Description: Mr. Mime claps, damaging and knocking back enemies hit for 0.4s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Confusion
Upgrade 1.Description:
Mr. Mime fires a wave of psychic energy, damaging and knocking enemies back. Enemies hit into a wall take bonus damage and are stunned for 1.5s. Enemies debuffed by Power Swap take bonus damage and are stunned for 0.7s, but are not knocked back.

  Normal damage will apply to targets that are unstoppable or unstunnable. (Example: Drednaw & Zapdos)
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increased damage.

Upgrade 2.Name: Psychic
Upgrade 2.Description: Mr. Mime pulses energy, dealing damage in an area around themself, any target affected by Power Swap, and any Barriers or Light Screens. After three pulses, a final pulse will damage enemies and stun them for 1s. Enemies hit by the pulses have their SpDef lowered by 5% for 3s with each hit (maximum 8 stacks).
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Enemies hit by the pulses are additionally slowed by 30%.

Move 2.Name: Light Screen
Move 2.Description: Mr. Mime creates a wall that prevents enemies from passing. If an enemy is near the location where the wall is created, they are shoved and left unable to act for 0.5s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Barrier
Upgrade 1.Description: Mr. Mime creates a wall that prevents enemies from passing. If an enemy is near the location where the wall is created, they are shoved and left unable to act for 0.5s. Holds 2 uses in reserve and cannot be used more than once every 2s.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Stores 3 uses in reserve instead.

Upgrade 2.Name: Power Swap
Upgrade 2.Description:
Creates a link between Mr. Mime and the target this move hits. While the link holds, Mr. Mime's movement speed increases by 10% and their HP is continually restored. The link will continue to hold for as long as the linked target stays in range or until another target is Power Swapped. Damage and healing ticks at a rate of 0.5s.

  If the linked target is an ally, this move increases their movement speed by 8%, increases the amount of damage they deal by 15%, and continually restores their HP. If the linked target is an enemy, this move decreases their movement speed by 8%, decreases the amount of damage they deal by 15% and deals damage over time to them. Power Swap can be cleansed.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increases the amount of damage dealt by allies to 20% and decreases the amount of damage dealt by enemies to 20%.

Unite Move.Name: Showtime
Unite Move.Description: Mr. Mime leaps forward and begins a performance; stunning enemies for 0.5s, dealing damage in a large area around him 4 times, and becomes unstoppable for the duration. The final hit deals double damage and stuns enemies for 1s.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 30% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Iron Fist
Passive Ability.Description: After this Pokémon hits with a move, the next auto attack will be enhanced, dealing increased damage and restoring the user's HP.  Fighter Mode: After this Pokémon hits with a move, the next auto attack will be enhanced. The user lunges towards the target Pokémon, dealing increased damage and increasing the user's attack speed by 30% for 8 seconds. This effect can stack up to 2 times and the duration refreshes when gaining another stack.

Pawmot.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, lunging at an opposing Pokémon and dealing increased damage.

Move 1.Name: Nuzzle
Move 1.Description: The user nuzzles their electrified cheeks against the designated opposing Pokémon, dealing damage and leaving them paralyzed. The movement speed of opposing Pokémon paralyzed by this move is decreased by 30% for 2s and their basic attack speed is decreased by 10% for 2s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Thunder Punch
Upgrade 1.Description:
Unleash an electrified punch in the designated direction, dealing damage, slowing opposing Pokémon hit by 40% and reducing their attack speed by 10% for 2s.

  Fighter Mode: This move has a shorter range and no longer applies a slowing effect, but instead deals increased damage.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increases the damage dealt by this move.

Upgrade 2.Name: Supercell Slam
Upgrade 2.Description:
The user charges up receiving 30% less damage and becomes unstoppable, then dives toward the designated area after releasing, gaining a shield for 3.5s, dealing damage and slowing opposing Pokémon hit by 30% for 2s. If this move misses, the user takes 3% of their remaining HP as damage instead. When this move hits, the move can be used again; when used a second time, the user unleashes a punch in front of themself, dealing damage and shoving opposing Pokémon hit.

  Fighter Mode: The first stage of this move no longer applies a slowing effect and the area of effect is decreased, but this move deals increased damage and no longer has a charge time.

  Fighter Mode: Further increases damage dealt by this move.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Fighter Mode: Further increases damage dealt by this move.

Move 2.Name: Scratch
Move 2.Description: The user attacks a designated opposing Pokémon with sharp claws, dealing damage.

Upgrade 1.Name: Volt Switch
Upgrade 1.Description:
The user cloaks themself in electricity and dashes at an opposing Pokémon, dealing damage and moving behind them. For a short time after using this move, this move can be used once more.

  Fighter Mode: This move cannot be used more than once before going on cooldown, but the user's movement speed is increased by 40% for 3s instead.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Reduce this move's cooldown by 1s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Mach Punch
Upgrade 2.Description:
Dash at blinding speed towards the designated direction, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon, shoving them, and leaving them unable to act for 0.6s. This move's cooldown is reduced every time a basic attack hits.

  Fighter Mode: This move no longer shoves or leaves opposing Pokémon unable to act, but the number of attacks for this move is increased.

  Fighter Mode: Increases damage dealt by this move.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Fighter Mode: Increases damage dealt by this move.

Unite Move.Name: Zip Zap Full-Charge Spark
Unite Move.Description: Charge toward the designated Pokémon from the opposing team, dealing damage to the target and nearby opposing Pokémon. After using this move, the user enters Fighter Mode for 8s and resets the cooldown of all other moves. The Unite Move gauge will only charge when the user's basic attacks and moves hit opposing Pokémon. Basic Attacks against Pokémon from the opposing team increase Unite Move gauge by 4% and moves increase the gauge by 8%. Basic Attacks against wild Pokémon increase Unite Move gauge by 1% and moves increase the gauge by 2%. Fighter Mode: Basic attacks and move effects change, and the Unite Move gauge does not charge. Gain 30% omni-vamp while Fighter Mode is active.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 50% Movement Speed, 35% Attack Speed, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Static
Passive Ability.Description: When damaged, paralyzes nearby opposing Pokémon (30s CD).  The movement speed of opposing Pokémon paralyzed by this Ability is decreased by 30% for 2.5s and their basic attack speed is decreased by 10% for 2s.

Pikachu.Attack:
Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing increased damage and paralyzing the opposing Pokémon hit.

The movement speed of the opposing Pokémon paralyzed by boosted attacks is decreased by 30% and their basic attack speed is decreased by 10% for 1s.

Move 1.Name: Thunder Shock
Move 1.Description: Releases electricity at the designated opposing Pokémon, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and paralyzing them when it hits. The movement speed of opposing Pokémon paralyzed by this move is decreased by 30% and their basic attack speed is decreased by 10% for 2s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Electro Ball
Upgrade 1.Description:
Hurls an electric orb at the designated opposing Pokémon, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect, dealing additional missing HP damage, and paralyzing them when it hits.

  The movement speed of opposing Pokémon paralyzed by this move is decreased by 50% and their basic attack speed is decreased by 10% for 2s. Against wild Pokémon: additional missing HP damage is capped at 1200.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increases the damage of this move.

Upgrade 2.Name: Thunder
Upgrade 2.Description: Drops wicked thunderbolts at the designated area, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon in the area of effect every 0.5s over 2.5s (up to 5 times).
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Deals damage over time more frequently, hitting opposing Pokémon in the area of effect up to 7 times over 2.5s.

Move 2.Name: Electroweb
Move 2.Description: Launches an electric net at the designated opposing Pokémon, damaging the target and immobilizing them for 1.5s when the net captures them.

Upgrade 1.Name: Volt Tackle
Upgrade 1.Description: Becomes unstoppable and dashes at the designated opposing Pokémon, damaging the target 5 times and throwing them in the air for 1.4s; then leaps a set distance back, becoming vulnerable to hindrances and increasing movement speed by 60% for 2s (decaying by 10% every 0.5s; minimum 30% for 0.5s) after the leap.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Reduces this move's cooldown by 2s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Thunderbolt
Upgrade 2.Description: Strikes with a strong electric blast at the designated area, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and stunning them for 1.25s when it hits.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increases the damage of this move.

Unite Move.Name: Thunderstorm
Unite Move.Description: Becomes unstoppable and jumps into the air, then casts down bolts of lightning 4 times over 3s in a radius around Pikachu. The first cast targets all Pokémon on the opposing team in range with 1 bolt each; these bolts damage up to 1 target each. The following 3 casts target up to 2 random Pokémon from the opposing team in range; these following bolts deal damage to opposing Pokémon in a small area around them, but targets can only be damaged once for each of the following 3 casts. Pikachu can act freely once the first bolts of lightning are cast down.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 30% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Swift Swim
Passive Ability.Description: When damaged by a Pokémon from the opposing team; increases movement speed by 40% for 2s, decaying by 10% every 0.5s (minimum 25% increased movement speed) (10s CD).  This Pokémon's headache gauge increases by 1% for every 0.5% max HP damage received by Psyduck or nearby ally Pokémon from Pokémon on the opposing team. This gauge fills at a rate of 30% per 1s (requiring a total of 3.33s to fully charge). When the headache gauge is full, a mysterious power is triggered, interrupting Psyduck from casting moves, cleansing status conditions on themself, becoming unstoppable and decreasing their movement speed by 30% for 1s; then shoving nearby opposing Pokémon away for 0.8s, and resetting this Pokémon's move cooldowns. The mysterious power stays active for 10s, boosting moves and giving them 20% cooldown reduction. When the mysterious power ends, Psyduck cannot use moves or attacks, or charge their headache gauge for 2.5s.

Psyduck.Attack:
Attacks with a shot of water.

Psyduck has no boosted attack.

Move 1.Name: Confusion
Move 1.Description: Releases a weak telekinetic force in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon and stunning them for 1s when it hits. While the mysterious power is active, deals increased damage.

Upgrade 1.Name: Surf
Upgrade 1.Description:
Creates a wave in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon and decreasing their movement speed by 30% for 2.5s when it hits; if opposing Pokémon already have their movement speed decreased when this move hits, they are also shoved for 0.5s. Rides the wave for at least 0.6s and until this move is used again or for up to 5s, moving forward and increasing movement speed by 30%; the user can use basic attacks and moves while riding the wave. Ally Pokémon who touch the wave while Psyduck is riding it have their movement speed increased by 70% for 3s (decaying by 10% every 0.5s over 2s; minimum 30%). When this move is used again, stops in place and creates another wave in the designated direction.

  While the mysterious power is active, creates two waves in the designated direction each time this move is used.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Decreases the damage dealt by opposing Pokémon hit by this move by 25% for 2.5s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Bubble Beam
Upgrade 2.Description:
Forcefully ejects a spray of bubbles in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and attaching a mark with 3 bubbles to those hit for 5s. When a teammate damages opposing Pokémon with bubbles attached to them with auto attacks, a bubble bursts, damaging the target. When all bubbles on a target burst from auto attack damage, they are stunned for 0.5s and their movement speed is decreased by 30% for 2s.

  While the mysterious power is active, strengthens the damage dealt when bubbles burst.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Decreases the movement speed of opposing Pokémon hit by the beam by 30% for 2s.

Move 2.Name: Tail Whip
Move 2.Description: Wags their tail at the designated opposing Pokémon, damaging them and decreasing their movement speed by 30% and their Sp. Def by 20% for 2s. While the mysterious power is active, strengthens the Sp. Def decrease to 30%.

Upgrade 1.Name: Disable
Upgrade 1.Description:
Releases electricity at the designated opposing Pokémon, damaging the target and stunning them for 0.2s. Opposing Pokémon hit by the electricity from this use of the move have a mark applied to them for 5s which has a disabling effect tied to it; the disabling effect increases the cooldown of the last move used by a marked target by 2s, or the next move used if no move is on cooldown (once only). When the disabling effect occurs, the target's movement speed is also decreased by 30% for 2s. The electricity spreads to a nearby opposing Pokémon up to 4 times; the electricity can only spread to the same target up to 2 times.

  While the mysterious power is active, the electricity can spread up to 6 times; the electricity can spread to the same target up to 2 times.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Strengthens the stun duration to 0.5s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Psychic
Upgrade 2.Description:
Decreases movement speed by 10% and releases a strong telekinetic force in the designated area, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and stunning them for 0.6s when it hits. Continues to release a telekinetic force at the Pokémon from the opposing team closest to the center of the area of effect when this move hits, marking them for 2s. If this move is used again or after 2s and the user is in range of the marked target, pulls the target a set distance in the designated direction (pulling them toward the user's location if no direction is designated), stunning them for 0.85s during the pull.

  While the mysterious power is active, stuns the target marked by this move for 0.2s after being pulled.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Decreases the Sp. Def of opposing Pokémon hit by the area of effect by 25% for 2s.

Unite Move.Name: Full-Power Psy-ay-ay!
Unite Move.Description: Releases three mysterious psychic waves around themself, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and decreasing the damage dealt by them by 30% for 3s when hit. After using this Unite Move, increases the headache gauge by 50% as a consequence of Psyduck unleashing their full power.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Prankster
Passive Ability.Description: When Sableye is outside the visual range of enemy players, Sableye enters stealth and gains 10% increased movement speed. When Sableye enters the visual range of enemy players or enemy goal zones, Sableye does not immediately become visible but instead remains in stealth for 1.7s. Sableye exits stealth when attacking.

Sableye.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing damage to enemies hit and decreasing their movement speed by 20% for 2s. If Sableye is in stealth when hitting an enemy with a boosted attack, Sableye will deal damage and apply a fear effect for 1s. Enemies affected by fear will be forced to move away from Sableye with 40% reduced movement speed. When Sableye enters stealth, they will ready a boosted attack immediately and hold it.

Move 1.Name: Thief
Move 1.Description: Dashes in the designated direction, dealing damage to any Pokémon hit and slowing 20% for 2s. If this move hits an enemy, Sableye receives 5 energy and removes up to 5 energy from the enemies hit. If those enemies did not have any Aeos energy, they will be left unable to act for 0.5s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Knock Off
Upgrade 1.Description: When either activation of this move hits enemies that do not have Aeos energy (or are wild Pokémon), those enemies will be left unable to act for longer periods of time. Sableye dashes in the designated direction and then back again while attacking around themself, dealing damage to enemies hit and leaving them unable to act for 0.4s or 0.6s if they have no Aeos energy. This move can be used again within 6s attacking in front of Sableye with their claws, dealing damage to enemies hit, pushing them away and leaving them unable to act for 0.6s or 1s if they have no Aeos energy. When either the first or second activation of this move hits an enemy, they will drop 5 Aeos energy (total 15: 10 from first activation, 5 from second) and be left unable to pick up Aeos energy for 4s. While using this move, Sableye receives 40% reduced damage.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Aeos energy picked up within 5s of using this move recovers 9% Max HP (one time per activation) and increases movement speed by 40% for 2s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Shadow Sneak
Upgrade 2.Description: Apply a 6.5s duration buff that stealths Sableye after 1.5s increasing Sableye's movement speed by 10%. If the initial stealthing is interrupted by a hindrance, Sableye will not enter stealth. When the buff first stealth's Sableye, Sableye is granted a readied boosted attack that deals additional damage. While the buff is still active, if Sableye exits stealth and is not immobilized or incapacitated by a hindrance, they will enter stealth again after 2s.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increases the duration of this move’s effects to 7.5s. While this move is active and Sableye is in stealth, Sableye will also restore 1% max HP every 0.5s.

Move 2.Name: Astonish
Move 2.Description: Sableye attacks in a cone in front of themself, dealing damage to enemies hit and decreasing their movement speed by 30% for 2s. If this move hits enemies from behind, this move deals increased damage and applies a greater decrease in movement speed to 60%.

Upgrade 1.Name: Feint Attack
Upgrade 1.Description:
Throw dummy Aeos energy to a designated location. While dummy Aeos energy remains at a location, that location and the area around it will be visible to the user. Dummy Aeos energy can remain at up to five locations at a time. If an enemy walks on top of dummy Aeos energy, that energy explodes, dealing damage-over-time 9 times over 4s in an area and decreases the movement speed of enemies hit for 4s by 70% decaying by 20% every 0.5s to a minimum of 10%. Holds 3 uses in reserve and cannot be used more than once every 1s.

  Note: Placing the dummy energy does not break stealth. Stealth is only broken when an enemy takes damage from the dummy energy.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: If an enemy is knocked out while affected by this move, they will drop more Aeos energy than they normally would.

Upgrade 2.Name: Confuse Ray
Upgrade 2.Description:
Fires a sinister ray in the designated direction, dealing damage to enemies hit. If this move hits enemy players, they are also left confused for 2s. While confused, enemies are unable to act and continuously attack nearby enemies with basic attacks. Confused enemies will target nearby enemies in the following order of priority: first, their allies; then, wild Pokémon; last, Pokémon on Sableye's team. Knock outs for wild Pokémon will be attributed to Sableye, stealing the effects of the wild Pokémon being knocked out as well as the Aeos energy.

  While confused, outgoing damage is decreased for auto attacks and move 1 by 50%. If the confused target knocks out a Wild Pokémon, Sableye receives the KO.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Also increases target's movement speed by 30% and attack speed by 50% while confused from this move.

Unite Move.Name: Chaos Glower
Unite Move.Description: Sableye becomes unstoppable for 1.2s and shoots light from both eyes, dealing damage to enemies in a cone in front of themself. Enemy players hit by this move who are facing Sableye are left unable to act for 3s and start preparing to return to base. If they take damage before returning to base, the return effect is cancelled, and they are left unable to act for 1.5s. Enemies hit by this move who are not facing Sableye have their movement speed decreased by 50% for 2s.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Technician
Passive Ability.Description: After this Pokémon uses a move, the next auto attack will deal two consecutive auto attacks instead. The second of these deals decreased damage. Technician lasts 5s and has no internal cooldown.

Scizor.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, decreasing enemy movement speed by 30% for 2s when it hits and increasing Scizor's Defense by 40% for 6s. This Defense increase can stack additively up to 3 times and the duration refreshes when gaining another stack.

Move 1.Name: Fury Cutter
Move 1.Description: Slashes twice dealing damage with its scythes in a cone. The second slash deals more damage than the first.

Upgrade.Name: Bullet Punch
Upgrade.Description: Dash in the designated direction and strike enemies, reducing this move's cooldown by 40% of its current cooldown if the attack connects and recovering a portion of HP with each hit. If Bullet Punch is used again within 8s, the number of punches increases. The number of punches increases from 3 to a maximum of 5.
Upgrade.Enhanced Description: Also grants a shield for 3s if this move hits an enemy.

Move 2.Name: Quick Attack
Move 2.Description: Dashes in designated direction dealing damage to enemies hit along the way.

Upgrade 1.Name: Double Hit
Upgrade 1.Description:
Jumps in the designated direction, dealing damage to enemies during the jump and applying a mark to that enemy until they leave combat. After hitting an enemy, jump again. An enhanced auto attack is prepared on landing that has increased range and charges at the enemy being attacked. This enhanced attack is available for 5s.

  If a marked enemy is knocked out, all of the user's move cooldowns are reset. The mark may be cleansed.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Reduces cooldown by 1s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Swords Dance
Upgrade 2.Description: Dashes a short distance, increasing Attack by 15% for 5s. While Swords Dance's attack buff is active, after basic attacks or abilities make contact 8 times, the user launches an area-of-effect attack that pierces through enemies in a line.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Reduces the damage the user receives by 50% while dashing (0.3s).

Unite Move.Name: Red Illusion Dive
Unite Move.Description: Target an enemy and punch them, dealing an initial hit of damage, decreasing their movement speed by 40% for 3s. Then create 5 copies that dash away from Scizor. If a copy hits a non targetted enemy while dashing out, it deals damage, decreases that enemy's movement speed by 40% for 3s, then disappears. If untouched, the illusory copy will remain on the battlefield for 8 seconds. Enemies that come in contact with an illusary copy will detonate the copy, having damage dealt to them an slowing them for 40% for 3s. For 8s after activation, this move may be used again, dashing in a designated direction dealing damage to enemies hit. The enemies hit are also grabbed and carried while Scizor continues dashing. At the end of the dash, Scizor punches the ground dealing damage in an area-of-effect. If the grabbed enemy hits an illusory copy during the shove, they will be dealt damage and be left incapacitated for 2s.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Technician
Passive Ability.Description: After this Pokémon uses a move, the next auto attack will deal two consecutive auto attacks instead. The second of these deals decreased damage. Technician lasts 5s and has no internal cooldown.

Scyther.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, increasing Scyther's movement speed by 40% for 3s.

Move 1.Name: Fury Cutter
Move 1.Description: Slashes twice dealing damage with its scythes in a cone. The second slash deals more damage than the first.

Upgrade.Name: Dual Wingbeat
Upgrade.Description: Slashes in front with scythes, dealing damage in an X-shaped area-of-effect. If the second slash deals damage to an enemy in the center, restore the user's HP. If this move hits an enemy, it can be activated again within a set amount of time. If this move is used again, the user dashes in the designated direction, dealing damage to enemies hit. The dash deals more damage the lower their HP is.
Upgrade.Enhanced Description: Increases the damage dealt by this move.

Move 2.Name: Quick Attack
Move 2.Description: Dashes in designated direction dealing damage to enemies hit along the way.

Upgrade 1.Name: Double Hit
Upgrade 1.Description:
Jumps in the designated direction, dealing damage to enemies during the jump and applying a mark to that enemy until they leave combat. After hitting an enemy, jump again. An enhanced auto attack is prepared on landing that has increased range and charges at the enemy being attacked. This enhanced attack is available for 5s.

  If a marked enemy is knocked out, all of the user's move cooldowns are reset. The mark may be cleansed.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Reduces cooldown by 1s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Swords Dance
Upgrade 2.Description: Dashes a short distance, increasing Attack by 15% for 5s. While Swords Dance's attack buff is active, after basic attacks or abilities make contact 8 times, the user launches an area-of-effect attack that pierces through enemies in a line.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Reduces the damage the user receives by 50% while dashing (0.3s).

Unite Move.Name: Green Illusion Dive
Unite Move.Description: Target an enemy, slashing through them dealing an initial hit of damage and creating 5 copies a set distance away. Copies deal damage to enemies they make contact with and apply a mark to them for 5s. After 5s, the copies return to Scyther, dealing damage to enemies they make contact with and healing Scyther for each hit. This move may be used again within 5s of activating as a dash in a designated direction dealing damage to enemies hit. The copies then dash to the end location of the user's dash. If a copy makes contact with an enemy while returning to Scyther, the copy deals damage to that enemy and disappears. If a marked enemy is knocked out, all of Scyther's move cooldowns are reset. Subsequent copies hitting the same target deal 70% reduced damage.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 80% Movement Speed, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Oblivious
Passive Ability.Description: Slowbro stores up lost HP for a short time (blue HP). Slowbro's Oblivious health remains for 6s and then decreases by 3% max HP every second. When dealing damage to an enemy with Water Gun, Scald, Surf, or Slowbeam - decrease their Sp. Def by 4% for 5s, stacking up to 5 times.

Slowbro.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack. When this boosted attack hits, deal damage to nearby enemies and decrease their movement speed by 30% for 1s.

Move 1.Name: Water Gun
Move 1.Description: Slowbro fires a stream of water, damaging and slowing enemies hit by 35% for 1s. This move can be channeled to increase its range and damage. Slowbro's movement speed is reduced by 30% while channeling. Restore some of Slowbro's Oblivious health (blue HP) once, after hitting an enemy.

Upgrade 1.Name: Scald
Upgrade 1.Description: Slowbro fires a stream of boiling water; damaging enemies hit, slowing them by 80% for 0.5s and creating a cloud of steam centered on the first enemy hit, which slows by 30% for 3s and applies a burn to all enemies inside. This burn reduces Attack by 60% for 3s. Restore 10% of Slowbro's Oblivious health (blue HP) once per stream instance after hitting an enemy (maximum 3 times).
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increases the size of the steam cloud.

Upgrade 2.Name: Surf
Upgrade 2.Description: Slowbro rides on a wave, damaging, knocking enemies back, and throwing them in the air for .4s. Two more waves follow after the first, damaging and slowing enemies by 30% for 1s. Restore 10% of Slowbro's Oblivious health (blue HP) per wave, when hitting at least one enemy (maximum 3 times).
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: The second and third waves will now also throw enemies in the air for .75s, and the second wave will knock them back.

Move 2.Name: Slack Off
Move 2.Description: Slowbro begins channeling a nap and gains a heal over time, healing 2% max HP every 0.5s for 3s. While Slowbro remains channeling its nap, all self-healing is doubled (including Slack Off healing). Slowbro can be manually or forcibly woken up from their nap.

Upgrade 1.Name: Amnesia
Upgrade 1.Description: Slowbro briefly becomes unstoppable, gaining +250 Defense for 4s and restoring 17.5% of Slowbro's Oblivious health (blue HP) every second for 4s.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Also increases Slowbro's Sp. Defense by 125.

Upgrade 2.Name: Telekinesis
Upgrade 2.Description: Slowbro shoots a beam, causing the first enemy hit to float in the air for 2.3s, restoring 15% of Slowbro's Oblivious health (blue HP) every second for 5s. Slowbro can reactivate the ability to pull the enemy to themself, but otherwise cannot act for the duration.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increases the range and speed of the beam.

Unite Move.Name: Slowbeam
Unite Move.Description: Stare at an enemy and attack continually, dealing damage every .5 seconds for 3s and applying 'Bound' to them. This ability counters Unstoppable. Grants a shield (10% max HP) and makes Slowbro unstoppable while using this move.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 40% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Gluttony
Passive Ability.Description: When facing nearby Berries or food, increases movement speed by 25%.  Doubles the HP restored from eating Sitrus Berries. Restores an additional 1% max HP + 0 x (Lv. - 1) + 23 HP from eating Oran Berries (from Greedent Cheek Pouch). Alcremie's Recover heals 10% more HP than usual.

Snorlax.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, belly flopping forward to deal increased damage to opposing Pokémon and decrease their movement speed by 20% for 1s when it hits.

Move 1.Name: Tackle
Move 1.Description: The user readies a boosted attack and dashes belly first forward, damaging opposing Pokémon and shoving the first opposing Pokémon hit for 1s. The boosted attack from this move remains readied until used.

Upgrade 1.Name: Heavy Slam
Upgrade 1.Description: The user jumps up and slams down at the designated location, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and throwing them for 1s.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increases the damage of this move.

Upgrade 2.Name: Flail
Upgrade 2.Description:
The user increases their movement speed by 80% for 3s (decaying by 10% every 0.5s over 2s; minimum 40% for 1s before this buff ends) and decreases the movement speed of nearby opposing Pokémon by 50% for 1.5s, and starts flailing about for 5s.

  While flailing about, auto attacks deal increased damage, with damage strengthening for every 20% max HP the user is missing. Basic attacks used while flailing about also decrease the movement speed of opposing Pokémon hit by 20% for 1s; boosted attacks decrease movement speed by 50% for 1s.

  
              Against Wild Pokemon: The total damage is capped at 2000.
            

  
              Against Wild Pokemon: The total damage is capped at 2500.
            

  When the user is below 40% max HP, auto attacks also restore the user's HP for 30% of damage dealt.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: When the user is below 40% max HP, auto attacks also restore the user's HP for 30% of damage dealt.

Move 2.Name: Rest
Move 2.Description: The user becomes unstoppable and falls asleep on the spot for 3s, restoring 8% max HP every 1s over 3s (maximum 24% max HP). While using this move, opposing Pokémon cannot pass through Snorlax. This move cannot be used within an opposing Miraidon's Electric Terrain.

Upgrade 1.Name: Block
Upgrade 1.Description:
The user gains a shield for 3.5s; becomes unstoppable, decreases their movement speed by 30% and creates a wall with their arms spread wide in the designated direction for up to 4s. Opposing Pokémon cannot pass through the wall from behind, and those that contact the wall from the front are shoved and stunned for 0.45s; targets cannot be shoved more than once every 1s (maximum 4 times).

  The user can use this move again to drop the wall early, becoming vulnerable to hindrances and returning to normal movement speed. This move's cooldown begins when the wall ends.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increases the user's Defense and Sp. Def by 35% while holding up the wall. Shoves opposing Pokémon contacting the wall from the front not more than once every 0.5s (maximum 8 times).

Upgrade 2.Name: Yawn
Upgrade 2.Description:
The user lets out a huge yawn in the designated direction, putting opposing Pokémon in the area of effect to a deep sleep for up to 2.5s.

  Targets that are hit after their deep sleep is halfway through wake up immediately.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Decreases the movement speed of opposing Pokémon waking up from a full deep sleep by 35% for 3s.

Unite Move.Name: Power Nap
Unite Move.Description: The user becomes unstoppable and slams onto their back fast asleep, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and throwing them for 0.6s; then continues to sleep for up to 4s afterward. The user starts snoring for the remainder of the Unite Move, restoring 10% max HP over time while fast asleep (up to 9 times; maximum 90%), damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect with a huge snore every 1.5s and decreasing their movement speed by 30% for 1s when hit. This Unite Move can be used again before the user snores a second time to flip over in the designated sideways direction and slam the ground, dealing an extra instance of snore damage in the area of effect and throwing opposing Pokémon hit for 1s. While the user is fast asleep, opposing Pokémon cannot pass through Snorlax. After the user flips over or snores a second time, the user can use this Unite Move again to stop sleeping early, becoming vulnerable to hindrances and returning to normal.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 40% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Pressure
Passive Ability.Description: Damaging a Pokémon from the opposing team below 10% max HP and frozen by Suicune deals an additional 15% max HP as true damage to the target (sufficient damage reduction can prevent the target from being knocked out). Using a move grants a shield for 5s (up to 2 times); separately increases the crystal gauge by 1 for 5s (becoming full when increased 2 times).  Flooded areas created by Whirlpool or Surf remain for 5s; opposing Pokémon in a flooded area are marked as drenched for 3s. Freezing a flooded area with a regular move (not Unite Move) also freezes opposing Pokémon in that flooded area for 1s. Freezing an opposing Pokémon marked as drenched removes the mark; targets frozen by a regular move or by a frozen area cannot be marked as drenched for 3s afterward. Deals bonus damage when freezing opposing Pokémon with a regular move or by being in a frozen area.

Suicune.Attack:
When the crystal gauge is full, readies a boosted attack for 5s as the crystal gauge decays to 0; increasing the crystal gauge refills it to full.

Boosted attacks shoot water forward, damaging opposing Pokémon every 0.25s over 1s (up to 4 times), dealing bonus damage to frozen opposing Pokémon with each hit.

Move 1.Name: Water Pulse
Move 1.Description: Fires a pulse of water in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon and shoving them for 0.5s when it hits. Marks targets as drenched for 3s when it hits.

Upgrade 1.Name: Whirlpool
Upgrade 1.Description:
Generates a vortex of water at the designated area, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect every 1s over 4s (up to 4 times), pulling them toward the center with each hit, and slowing enemies by 20% for 0.5s (refreshing on each hit). If used again within 4s, moves the vortex in the designated direction, flooding the area it passes through.

  Marks targets as drenched for 3s when hit.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Reduces this move's cooldown by 1s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Surf
Upgrade 2.Description:
Prepares an area for a big wave to pass through, then creates the wave and sends it in the designated direction after 0.75s, damaging opposing Pokémon hit by the wave and shoving them. The prepared area becomes flooded after the wave passes through it.

  Marks targets hit by the wave as drenched for 3s. Hitting a pillar of ice created by Icy Wind with the wave shatters it, damaging opposing Pokémon hit.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increases the damage of this move.

Move 2.Name: Avalanche
Move 2.Description: Creates snow to fall at the designated area for 1.5s, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect (up to 3 times) and decreasing their movement speed by 30% for 2s when hit. After 1.5s, drops a clump of snow at the designated area, damaging opposing Pokémon again. The clump of snow freezes drenched targets for 1s when it hits; freezes flooded areas it drops on after 1s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Ice Beam
Upgrade 1.Description:
Fires an icy-cold beam of energy in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon and decreasing their movement speed by 20% for 2s when it hits.

  This move freezes drenched targets for 1s when it hits; freezes flooded areas it hits after 1s. A maximum of 2 uses can be kept in reserve, with a 0.5s cooldown between uses.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Strengthens the movement speed decrease to 30%.

Upgrade 2.Name: Icy Wind
Upgrade 2.Description:
Builds up a gust of freezing air at the designated area for 0.5s, decreasing the movement speed of opposing Pokémon in the area of effect by 30% for 3s; then forms a pillar of ice, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and decreasing their movement speed by 30% for 3s once fully formed. The pillar of ice shatters after 4s, damaging opposing Pokémon again.

  This move freezes drenched targets for 1s when the pillar of ice forms or when it shatters. Forming a pillar of ice on a flooded area freezes that area after 1s. A maximum of 2 uses can be kept in reserve, with a 0.5s cooldown between uses.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Reduces this move's cooldown by 1s.

Unite Move.Name: Endless Ice Spikes
Unite Move.Description: Cleanses the user of status condition; then creates ice spikes in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and freezing those hit for 2s. After 2s, the ice spikes explode, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect again. This Unite Move does not directly interact with drench marks, nor does it freeze flooded areas. Suicune can be stunned after cleansing themself and before creating the ice spikes, canceling the Unite Move and refunding 90% of the Unite Move gauge.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Adaptability
Passive Ability.Description: Every time Eevee deals or receives damage, increase Sp. Attack by 5% for 1.5s, stacking up to 4 times.
Passive Ability.Description 2: Every time Sylveon deals or receives damage, increase Sp. Atk and Sp. Defense by 2.5% for 1.5s, stacking up to 6 times.

Sylveon.Attack:
Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing increased damage.

Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing increased damage. In addition, increase movement speed by 75% for 1s when this boosted attack hits.

Move 1.Name: Swift
Move 1.Description: Shoots 4 star-shaped rays at enemies, dealing damage to them.

Upgrade 1.Name: Mystical Fire
Upgrade 1.Description: Create four small flames while leaping in the designated direction. These flames shoot towards enemies one by one, dealing damage and decreasing their Sp. Attack by 15% for 1s, stacking up to 4 times. Each time a flame hits, reduce the cooldown of this move by 12% of the current cooldown. After the first flame hits, subsequent flames on the same target deal 28% damage. Wild Pokémon will only be prioritized if no enemy players are in range.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increases the number of flames by one.

Upgrade 2.Name: Hyper Voice
Upgrade 2.Description: Unleashes an attack of multiple sound waves that deal damage when they hit. The damage dealt increases the farther the target is from Sylveon. Every sound wave reduces enemy Sp. Defense by 20% for 1.5s (capping at 80%).
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Pokémon hit are slowed by 30%

Move 2.Name: Baby-Doll Eyes
Move 2.Description: Stare at an enemy with baby-doll eyes, dealing damage and decreasing their Attack by 15% for 1s and decreasing their movement speed by 60% for 1s for a short time when this move hits.

Upgrade 1.Name: Draining Kiss
Upgrade 1.Description: Blow a kiss at an enemy that goes back and forth between Sylveon and the target multiple times. When the kiss touches Sylveon, restore HP. When it hits the enemy, deal damage and decrease their movement speed by 50% for 1s on each kiss hit. This movement speed decrease decays by 15% after 0.5s If Sylveon and the enemy move too far away from each other, the kiss will disappear. The closer Sylveon and the target is, the faster the damage and healing occur.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increased healing.

Upgrade 2.Name: Calm Mind
Upgrade 2.Description: Sylveon quietly focuses their mind and calms their spirit, increasing movement speed by 30%, Sp. Attack by 40% and Sp. Defense by 10%. All buffs last for 3s.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: For up to 3s after using Calm Mind+ Sylveon can block one move (auto attacks will not be blocked), negating the first instance of damage and granting a shield for 3s. Hinderances and status effects will still be applied.

Unite Move.Name: Fairy Frolic
Unite Move.Description: Jump into the air, removing most statuses and becoming invincible. The moment Sylveon lands, lose invincibility and immediately gain Fairy Frolic buff, while dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect and healing for 60% of the damage dealt. Fairy Frolic buff: for 10s, 50% of the damage dealt by Sylveon is converted into HP. No HP is recovered if the damage is dealt to shields. Against Wild Pokémon: Damage is capped at 2000.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Gale Wings
Passive Ability.Description: While at 85% max HP or above, this Pokémon's movement speed is increased by 15%.

Talonflame.Attack:
Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, creating a fiery whirlwind around the user and damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect. This boosted attack remains readied until used.

Basic and boosted attacks lunge at the target opposing Pokémon.

Move 1.Name: Peck
Move 1.Description: The user dashes at the designated opposing Pokémon then pecks three times, damaging opposing Pokémon hit.

Upgrade 1.Name: Flame Charge
Upgrade 1.Description: The user dashes forward cloaked in flame, damaging opposing Pokémon in their path and increasing the user's movement speed by 30% for 2.5s if it hits.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increases the user's Defense penetration for 3s and reduces the movement speed of opposing Pokémon in the user's path by 30% for 5s if this move hits.

Upgrade 2.Name: Aerial Ace
Upgrade 2.Description: The user readies a boosted attack and dashes through the designated opposing Pokémon with a swift attack, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect around the user and restoring the user's HP when it hits.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increases the damage of this move.

Move 2.Name: Acrobatics
Move 2.Description: The user dashes toward the designated location then attacks the area around them three times, damaging nearby opposing Pokémon. The user can choose to dash in the direction of movement afterward.

Upgrade 1.Name: Fly
Upgrade 1.Description:
The user readies a boosted attack and flies up into the sky for up to 3s, becoming untargetable and increasing their movement speed by 65%. When this move is used again, or after 3s, the user dives at the designated location, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect.

  If this move hits a Pokémon from the opposing team, the current cooldown of this move is reduced by 40%.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Throws opposing Pokémon hit for 0.4s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Brave Bird
Upgrade 2.Description:
The user becomes unstoppable and dives at the designated location, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect when they land and receiving 5% remaining HP recoil damage if it hits.

  Opposing Pokémon hit by this move are marked for 4s. If the user hits a marked target with a boosted attack, the cooldown of Flame Charge or Aerial Ace is reset and the mark on the first target hit is removed.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Reduces damage received by 25% per opposing Pokémon hit for 5s (up to 3 times; maximum 75%).

Unite Move.Name: Flame Sweep
Unite Move.Description: The user performs an aerial somersault and sweeps forward, becoming unstoppable, receiving 50% reduced damage, damaging opposing Pokémon in their path and shoving them toward the end of the sweep, then damaging opposing Pokémon again. This Unite Move cannot go through walls.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 80% Movement Speed, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Mold Breaker
Passive Ability.Description: When damaging an opposing Pokémon with an active shield effect, 30% of the damage dealt to the shield is dealt as additional damage to the target's HP.  This Pokémon's hammer strengthens every time they hit Pokémon from the opposing team with boosted attacks or moves, increasing this Pokémon's Attack by 0.5% per target hit (up to 60 times; maximum 30% Attack). After the hammer is strengthened 20, 40, and 60 times; Rock Smash, Gigaton Hammer, and Smack Down gain increased range.

Tinkaton.Attack:
Becomes a boosted attack after 12s, swinging the user's hammer in a circle around them, dealing increased damage and restoring 24% of the user's missing HP when it hits. This boosted attack remains readied until used. The time until the next boosted attack is readied is reduced faster when hit by opposing Pokémon's auto attacks.

The hammer's size and basic attack range increase upon evolving into Tinkatuff and into Tinkaton.

Move 1.Name: Rock Smash
Move 1.Description: The user swings down their hammer with rock-crushing force, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and stunning them for 0.15s when hit. The stronger the hammer, the larger this move's area of effect.

Upgrade 1.Name: Gigaton Hammer
Upgrade 1.Description:
The user becomes unstoppable and decreases their movement speed by 50% as they charge power for up to 1.95s, becoming fully charged after 1s, before swinging down their hammer in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and throwing them when hit. This move deals more damage and the throw duration is strengthened the longer it is charged.

  The stronger the hammer, the larger this move's area of effect.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Reduces this move's cooldown by 1s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Smack Down
Upgrade 2.Description:
The user decreases their movement speed by 30% as they charge power for up to 2.4s, becoming fully charged after 0.8s, then uses their hammer to hit nearby enemies in front of the user and send a rock flying to the designated area, damaging opposing Pokémon at the rock's point of impact and decreasing the movement speed of those hit by 50% for 3s (decaying by 10% every 0.5s). The longer this move is charged, the farther the rock can fly. This move deals increased damage at maximum charge. If this move is canceled, it goes on a 2s cooldown.

  The stronger the hammer, the larger this move's maximum range.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Reduces this move's cooldown by 1s.

Move 2.Name: Fairy Wind
Move 2.Description: The user stirs up a fairy wind in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon hit and decreasing their movement speed by 20% for 1s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Ice Hammer
Upgrade 1.Description: The user leaps in the designated direction and swings down their freezing hammer at the designated location, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect, decreasing the movement speed of those hit for 2.5s by 70% decaying by 10% every 0.5s to a minimum of 40%, as well as their Attack by 30%, and their Sp. Atk by 15% for 2.5s.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Strengthens the Attack decrease of opposing Pokémon hit to 50% and the Sp. Atk decrease to 30%.

Upgrade 2.Name: Thief
Upgrade 2.Description:
Increases the user's movement speed by 20% for 3s, strengthened to 40% for 5s when moving toward an opposing Pokémon affected by hindrances; and empowers the user's next basic attack for 5s, swinging their hammer in front of them and dealing boosted attack damage to opposing Pokémon hit. If this Thief empowered basic attack hits a Pokémon from the opposing team, the user gains a Thief buff for 5s, increasing their Defense and Sp. Def by 10% per target hit (up to 5 times; maximum 50%). While the user has the Thief buff, the movement speed increases remain in effect; the user readies boosted attacks after 2s, and the time until the next boosted attack is reduced significantly when hit by opposing Pokémon's auto attacks.

  Pokémon from the opposing team hit with Thief empowered basic attacks have a separate Thief debuff applied to them for 5s, decreasing their Defense and Sp. Def by 10%. The duration of the Thief debuff on targets hit refreshes when hit by subsequent Thief empowered attacks, and the duration of the Thief buff on the user is refreshed when a Pokémon from the opposing team is hit with the empowered attack.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Strengthens the Defense and Sp. Def decrease on targets hit by the empowered auto attack to 25%; strengthens the Defense and Sp. Def increases on the user to 25% per target hit (maximum 125%).

Unite Move.Name: Kiss Bliss Kaboom
Unite Move.Description: The user first blows cute kisses at the designated Pokémon from the opposing team and their nearby allies, damaging and stunning them for 0.7s when Kiss Bliss hits a target. The user can then use the Unite Move again, leaping up forward and slamming their hammer down at the designated location, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect of Kaboom. Unite Move buffs apply when Kiss Bliss hits a target.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Natural Cure
Passive Ability.Description: When Trevenant deals or receives damage while at or below 35% max HP, a continuous HP recovery effect is triggered every 0.5s for 4s. This effect also reduces the cooldowns of Trevenant's moves by 1s every 1s. When this HP recovery effect ends, there is a 100s cooldown. However, this cooldown is reduced by 1s each time one of Trevenant's moves damage an enemy. This cooldown reduction cannot be triggered more than once every 0.5s.

Trevenant.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing increased damage to enemies and heal for 5% max HP when this boosted attack hits.

Move 1.Name: Will-o-Wisp
Move 1.Description: Shoot 3 sinister flames in the designated direction, dealing damage to enemies hit and leaving them burned for 3s. This burn reduces enemy Attack by 10% and Sp. Attack by 5% for 3s. The first wisp to hit a target deals full damage, and subsequent flame hits deal 50% damage.

Upgrade 1.Name: Wood Hammer
Upgrade 1.Description: Trevenant pulls back its arms and attacks, dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect and pulls them in front of Trevenant, leaving them unable to act for 0.5s. If this attack deals damage to at least one enemy, a follow-up attack will be available for 5s. This follow-up attack slams down a giant wooden hammer in front of Trevenant, dealing damage to any enemy it hits, and leaving them unable to act. The lower Trevenant's HP, the longer the enemy will be left unable to act. Every time this move is used, it consumes 5% of Trevenant's current HP.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: If an enemy is hit by the second hammer, the damage they deal is reduced by 20% for 3s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Curse
Upgrade 2.Description: Trevenant creates a cursed zone in exchange for 2% max HP per second for 6s, dealing damage over time to enemies in the area of effect every 0.5s for 6s and decreasing their movement speed for 1s, refreshing with each tick. The lower Trevenant's HP is, the greater the decrease in movement speed. While using this move, Trevenant builds up Curse gauge every time it deals or receives damage. Curse will deal additional damage to enemies in the area of effect when the Curse releases at the end of 6s or by manually detonating the Curse. If the Curse gauge is at maximum when it’s released, the cooldowns of Branch Poke, Horn Leech, and Pain Split are reset and opponents hit are unable to act for 0.6s.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increased radius.

Move 2.Name: Branch Poke
Move 2.Description: Trevenant jabs in the designated direction; dealing damage, decreasing their movement speed by 40% for 2s, and healing Trevenant for 9% max HP (over 3 ticks as 1 tick per second) when hitting an enemy.

Upgrade 1.Name: Horn Leech
Upgrade 1.Description: Charge forward, becoming unstoppable, dealing damage to enemies and shoving them while dashing in the designated direction for the duration of the dash. At the end of the charge, enemies that were shoved are dealt additional damage and then thrown for 0.75s. Colliding with an enemy while charging recovers Trevenant's HP 3 times, and the lower Trevenant's remaining HP the more HP that is recovered. After this move hits an enemy, Trevenant's next three auto attacks deal more damage and reduce this move’s cooldown by 0.5s when they hit.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: After using this move, Trevenant's movement speed is increased by 30% for 1.5s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Pain Split
Upgrade 2.Description: Creates a link between Trevenant and a designated enemy for 6s. While the link holds, a percentage of damage that Trevenant would take is mitigated and instead redirected to the linked enemy as True damage. The lower Trevenant's remaining HP, the greater the percentage of damage that is redirected. If Trevenant's percentage of remaining HP is lower than the linked enemy, this move continuously deals damage and recovers Trevenant's HP every 0.5s. If Trevenant and the linked enemy are too far apart, the link will disappear. Using this move increases Trevenant's movement speed by 35% for 2s decaying by 7.5% per half second.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Duration increased to 8.5s.

Unite Move.Name: Phantom Forest
Unite Move.Description: Briefly becomes unstoppable and creates a cursed forest, dealing damage to enemies in the area of effect and marking them, throwing them, and decreasing their movement speed by 50% for 2s. Trevenant and allies deal increased basic (and boosted) attack damage to enemies that were marked by this move (0.5s cd for each attacker). The mark lasts for 6s. Trevenant is also granted a shield for 6s when this move hits an enemy with the shield being strengthened for each enemy hit, up to 5 times. While Trevenant is shielded by this shield, HP recovery effects applied to Trevenant are increased by 50%.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Oblivious
Passive Ability.Description: Reduces the duration of hindrances inflicted on the user by an increased amount.
Passive Ability.Description 2: When a hindrance is inflicted on Tsareena; decrease the duration of the effect. Using a boosted attack or selectable move grants 1 stack of Queenly Majesty to Tsareena. After gaining 3 stacks, the Queenly Majesty buff is applied to Tsareena for 5s, which allows one of Tsareena's moves to be reused (these uses do not share the same cooldown as the base moves), dealing increased damage and applying an additional effect based on the move used. Boosted attacks will refresh the duration of fully stacked Queenly Majesty.

Tsareena.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, lunging at an opposing Pokémon, damage nearby opposing Pokémon and lowering the Defense of those hit by 20% for 1s.

Move 1.Name: Razor Leaf
Move 1.Description: The user pelts sharp-edged leaves in the designated direction, damaging opposing Pokémon hit up to 3 times. The critical-hit rate of this move is increased by 15%.

Upgrade 1.Name: Triple Axel
Upgrade 1.Description:
The user dashes forward with 3 spinning kicks, hitting opposing Pokémon in the area of effect of each kick; increasing the user's auto attack speed for 5s per opposing Pokémon hit (up to 3 times), and increasing the damage of the user's auto attacks and Triple Axel by 8% per opposing Pokémon hit before dealing damage (up to 6 times).

  Queenly Majesty Effect: Restores HP per opposing Pokémon hit with each kick.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increased damage.

Upgrade 2.Name: Stomp
Upgrade 2.Description:
The user jumps up high and stomps the ground, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect when they land and stunning them for 0.2s.

  Queenly Majesty Effect: Restores HP per opposing Pokémon hit.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increases the damage of this move.

Move 2.Name: Rapid Spin
Move 2.Description: The user dashes forward and spins, damaging opposing Pokémon in their path and increasing the user's movement speed by 30% for 1.5s when it hits.

Upgrade 1.Name: Trop Kick
Upgrade 1.Description:
The user dashes forward with a flying kick of tropical origins, damaging opposing Pokémon in the path of the kick and decreasing their Attack by 25% for 1s when it hits.
