At the same time, a muddy wake is left in the path of the kick, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of the wake (up to 7 times) and decreasing their movement speed by 35% for 1s.

  Queenly Majesty Effect: Grants the user a shield for 3s when this move is used.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increases the damage of this move.

Upgrade 2.Name: Grassy Glide
Upgrade 2.Description:
The user dashes forward with a gliding kick, damaging opposing Pokémon hit. The user then immediately kicks back in the opposite direction, damaging and shoving opposing Pokémon hit backward.

  Queenly Majesty Effect: Grants the user a shield for 3s when this move is used.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increases the damage of this move.

Unite Move.Name: Queen Ascendant
Unite Move.Description: Tsareena leaps toward an enemy player and kicks it high into the air before showering it with a series of kicks while airborne, dealing damage to them. The moment Tsareena lands on the ground, recover HP. While airborne, the enemy that is being kicked and Tsareena are not affected by other moves.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Guts
Passive Ability.Description: When Larvitar receives damage equal to at least 10% of max HP, Attack is increased by 30% for 3s. This Ability goes on cooldown after it’s triggered (40s cd).
Passive Ability.Description 2:
When Pupitar receives damage equal to at least 10% max HP, all status conditions are nullified and Pupitar is granted a shield worth 10% Max HP. This Ability goes on cooldown after it’s triggered (40s cd).

Summons a sandstorm around Tyranitar for 3s after using a move. This sandstorm increases Defense and Sp. Defense by 65% for 3s and deals damage to nearby enemies every .5s.

Tyranitar.Attack:
Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing increased damage when it hits.

After evolving to Pupitar basic and boosted attacks (and basic attacks during Tyrannical Rampage) have an additional 5% lifesteal that is also active when doing true damage.

Move 1.Name: Bite
Move 1.Description: Deals damage to enemies in front of the user. If the enemy HP is below 50%—or falls below that percentage as a result of this move—they become immobilized for 0.6s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Dark Pulse
Upgrade 1.Description:
Exhale a mist of darkness in a horizontal sweeping motion, dealing damage to any enemy hit. If the remaining HP of an enemy hit by this move falls below 50%, they become immobilized for 0.6s. If this move hits the same enemy again within 8s, it deals additional damage.

  If this move deals damage while Tyranitar's piercing strength is activated by Ancient Power, the 8s duration of piercing damage is refreshed.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Reduces this move's cooldown by 1s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Stone Edge
Upgrade 2.Description: Deals damage to enemies in a 90 degree cone, dealing more damage the closer the enemies are to the user. This move can be used up to 3 times with the cone widening to 135 and 180 degrees.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increased damage.

Move 2.Name: Rock Polish
Move 2.Description: Charge ahead in the designated direction, dealing damage to any enemies hit. If this move hits any enemy, all damage is increased by 15% for 3s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Ancient Power
Upgrade 1.Description:
Charge power before releasing a shock wave. The shock wave deals damage to nearby enemies and leaves them stunned for 1s. While charging power: Tyranitar becomes resistant to hindrances for 4s, movement speed is increased by 20% for 3s (stacking 3 times), and Tyranitar gains a shield (stacking 3 times and lasting up to 5s). If any enemies are hit by the shock wave, Tyranitar is granted piercing strength allowing damage dealt to ignore enemy Defense and shield effects for 8s.

  If this move hits an enemy, a second shock wave can be released in front of Tyranitar; dealing damage to enemies and decreasing their movement speed by 30% for 2s. If this second shock wave hits successfully, Tyranitar is granted another shield. The strength of this shield increases for each enemy hit, capping at 3 stacks.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Strengthens the effect of the shields granted by this move.

Upgrade 2.Name: Sand Tomb
Upgrade 2.Description:
Leap in a designated direction; dealing damage to any enemies hit and leaving them unable to act for 1.5s. When Tyranitar lands, the shock from landing creates a cloud of dust at the point of impact for 6s; dealing damage-over-time every 0.5s and decreasing movement speed of enemies hit by 35% for 1s every second.

  If this move is used again while Tyranitar is in the cloud of dust, enemies in front of Tyranitar will be pulled closer to it. Furthermore, while the user is in the cloud of dust, they take 15% reduced damage and can ignore the Defense and shield effects of enemies.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increases the length of time the cloud of dust remains at the point of impact to 8s.

Unite Move.Name: Tyrannical Rampage
Unite Move.Description: Briefly becomes unstoppable and explodes with anger, then goes on a rampage for 10s, gaining 50% tenacity for the duration. While rampaging, changes the auto attack pattern, dealing increased damage. Damaging a Pokémon from the opposing team below 20% max HP with these auto attacks deals 40% max HP as true damage to the target (sufficient damage reduction effects can prevent the target from being knocked out).
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Anticipation
Passive Ability.Description: When Eevee would be shoved, thrown or left unabled to act, that effect is negated. This effect goes on a 40s cooldown after being triggered and is reset after respawning.
Passive Ability.Description 2: When Umbreon would be shoved, thrown or left unabled to act, that effect is negated. Umbreon becomes unstoppable for 1.2s afterwards and also its Defense and Sp. Def are increased by 30% for 3s. This effect goes on a 40s cooldown after being triggered and is reset after respawning.

Umbreon.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack every third attack, lunging at a Pokémon and dealing damage. This boosted attack also heals the user's HP. The lower the user's remaining HP, the more HP is restored.

Move 1.Name: Swift
Move 1.Description: Shoot 1 large and 3 small star-shaped rays, dealing damage to Pokémon and applying a mark to them after the fourth star hits that lasts 4s. When near a marked Pokémon, Eevee receives a 15% movement speed increase. When Eevee deals damage to a marked Pokémon, its next basic attack becomes a boosted attack.

Upgrade 1.Name: Mean Look
Upgrade 1.Description:
Pins an enemy Pokémon with a dark, arresting look, slowing them by 30% for 2s. After a 0.5s delay, the enemy is surrounded by a black zone they cannot leave for 3s. While inside the black zone, Umbreon’s basic attacks become boosted and deal increased damage. The black zone is removed if the target enemy is knocked out.

  Mean Look is cleansable if the cleanse is used when the laser connects and before the area appears on the ground.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increases the duration of the black zone to 3.5s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Foul Play
Upgrade 2.Description: Charges in a direction, dealing damage to Pokémon hit and slowing them by 15% for 2.5s. If the charge hits a Pokémon, this move can be used again within 6s and it will note the highest Attack stat of all enemies hit. If this move is used again, Umbreon sweeps in front of itself with its tail, dealing damage to Pokémon hit, slowing them by 30% for 2.5s and shoving them for 0.6s. If the highest enemy Attack was greater than Umbreon's Attack when the first stage hit, the second stage deals damage using the noted Attack. Otherwise it uses Umbreon's current Attack.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Umbreon's next basic attack after using this move becomes a boosted attack.

Move 2.Name: Fake Tears
Move 2.Description: Feigns crying, dealing damage to nearby Pokémon and decreases their Defense and Sp. Def by 20% for 2s. Also grants a shield for 4s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Wish
Upgrade 1.Description: Wishes for an ally Pokémon or Umbreon. For 2s, that Pokémon receives 15% reduced damage, then afterward, the wish comes true and heals them. If the targeted Pokémon is knocked out before the wish comes true, a different ally Pokémon near them takes the wish instead.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increases the damage reduction to 25% and amount of healing when the wish comes true.

Upgrade 2.Name: Snarl
Upgrade 2.Description: Becomes hindrance resistant and begin snarling for 1.5s, dealing damage to enemy Pokémon in the area around Umbreon and decreasing the affected Pokémon's Attack and Sp. Atk stat by 3% for 1.5s and movement speed by 15% for 2s. Also grants the user a shield for 2s. Umbreon is slowed by 30% while snarling. The final shout leaves enemy Pokémon stunned for 0.7s and further decreases their Attack and Sp. Atk by 15% for 3s. The small shout Attack and Sp. Atk decreases can stack up to 6 times and stack with the big shout's Attack and Sp. Atk decreases.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increases the stun duration of the final shout to 1s.

Unite Move.Name: Moonlight Prance
Unite Move.Description: Umbreon briefly becomes unstoppable, leaping up and absorbing 50% of the shields from enemy Pokémon in an area around Umbreon, taking them for the user. Umbreon then lands, dealing damage to Pokémon in an area-of-effect, and stuns them for 1s. For 5s, enemy Pokémon in the area around Umbreon are slowed by 30%, and if an enemy Pokémon in that area is granted a shield, Umbreon absorbs 50% of the shield for themself. Additionally, after learning this move and while not in combat, Umbreon continually recovers 1% Max HP every second. Note: Umbreon cannot steal shields granted by Rayquaza or Assault Vest.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 10% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Inner Focus
Passive Ability.Description: Reduces the duration of hindrances inflicted on Kubfu by 15%.
Passive Ability.Description 2: When Urshifu deals damage to an opposing Pokémon with an active shield effect, 30% of the damage dealt to the shield is dealt as additional damage to the target's HP.

Urshifu.Attack:
Becomes a boosted attack with increased range every third attack, lunging at an opposing Pokémon and dealing increased damage.

Becomes a boosted attack with increased range every third attack, lunging at an opposing Pokémon, dealing increased damage and granting the user a shield for 3s when it hits.

Becomes a boosted attack with increased range every third attack, dealing damage with two consecutive blows and reducing the user's move cooldowns by 1.5s when it hits.

Move 1.Name: Rock Smash
Move 1.Description: The user receives 20% reduced damage as they charge power for up to 2s, increasing power levels until reaching maximum charge after 1s; then punches in the designated direction when released, damaging opposing Pokémon hit. If this move is canceled or not released after 2s, it goes on a 0.9s cooldown.

Upgrade 1.Name: Wicked Blow
Upgrade 1.Description:
The user becomes unstoppable, receives 20% reduced damage and decreases their movement speed by 30% as they charge power for up to 2.5s, becoming charged after 1s; then strikes in the designated direction with a fierce blow when released, readying a boosted attack if it hits. When uncharged, the cooldown of this move is reduced by 50%; and the user strikes in a small line area of effect, damaging opposing Pokémon and decreasing their movement speed when it hits.

  When charged, the user strikes in a larger cone area of effect, dealing increased damage to opposing Pokémon and dealing additional missing HP damage to those hit. Opposing Pokémon in the center line area of effect receive a critical hit and are shoved. If this move is canceled or not released after 2.5s, it goes on a 2.1s cooldown.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Strengthens damage reduction while charging this move to 40%. If this move is charged when released, opposing Pokémon in the center line area of effect are also stunned with the shove.

Upgrade 2.Name: Surging Strikes
Upgrade 2.Description:
The user dashes forward and strikes with a flowing motion, damaging opposing Pokémon hit. This move can be used up to two more times within 4s of the previous use. Opposing Pokémon hit by the third use receive a critical hit and are thrown.

  Each time this move is used, the user readies an enhanced boosted attack which restores the user's HP per hit.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Receives 30% reduced damage while using this move.

Move 2.Name: Headbutt
Move 2.Description: The user dashes forward with a headbutt, damaging opposing Pokémon and shoving them when it hits.

Upgrade 1.Name: Throat Chop
Upgrade 1.Description: The user readies a boosted attack and dashes forward, damaging opposing Pokémon in their path and stunning them for 0.7s when it hits.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Reduces this move's cooldown by 40% of its remaining cooldown when Wicked Blow hits.

Upgrade 2.Name: Liquidation
Upgrade 2.Description: The user stomps the ground, damaging nearby opposing Pokémon and decreasing their Defense by 30% for 3s; and granting the user a shield for 3s if it hits, strengthening per opposing Pokémon hit (up to 3 times).
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Reduces this move's cooldown by 1s.

Unite Move.Name: Ebon Fist
Unite Move.Description: The user becomes unstoppable and the cooldown of Wicked Blow is reset when this Unite Move is used. The user dashes at the designated Pokémon from the opposing team, stunning them, then chooses whether to designate a direction to move or not. If no direction is chosen, the user pushes them slightly and delivers an uppercut, damaging the target, throwing them and stunning them when they land. If the user chooses a direction, the user instead delivers a more powerful blow to the target, dealing increased damage and shoving them in the designated direction. The shoved target also deals reduced damage to opposing Pokémon they collide with and throws those hit.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Run Away
Passive Ability.Description: Restores the Pokémon's HP and nullifies damage from Pokémon from the opposing team. This Ability goes on a 30s cooldown after it's triggered.
Passive Ability.Description 2: Grants a water barrier after 30s. If the Pokémon takes damage from the opposing team while the water barrier is active, the shield nullifies the damage and restores the Pokémon's HP instead (30s cd). Hitting a Pokémon from the opposing team with a move will reduce this Ability's cooldown by 2s, and by 1s with a boosted attack

Vaporeon.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing increased damage.

Move 1.Name: Swift
Move 1.Description: Has the user shoots 6 star-shaped rays in the designated direction, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon hit and reducing their movement speed by 35% for 0.3s. The user is slowed by 30% while casting this move. The slow duration is extended by 0.3s for each star that hits the same Pokémon.

Upgrade 1.Name: Hydro Pump
Upgrade 1.Description:
Has the user continuously launch a huge volume of pressurized water in the designated direction, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon hit and shoves them for 0.1s. The move ends by unleashing a powerful blast of water, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon hit and shoves them for 1s. The user is slowed by 30% while casting this move.

  This move slows opposing Pokémon hit by 50% for 0.3s, further extended with each hit.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Reduces this move's cooldown by 1s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Muddy Water
Upgrade 2.Description: Has the user splash muddy water around itself, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon, slowing them by 30% for 1s, and throwing them for 0.6s.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increases the duration of the slow by 1s.

Move 2.Name: Tackle
Move 2.Description: Has the user charge in the designated direction, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon hit and shoves them for 0.25s. The distance this move travels is cut short when colliding into opposing Pokémon.

Upgrade 1.Name: Aqua Ring
Upgrade 1.Description:
Jump in a designated direction, creating continuous waves centered on self for 2.25s. Ally Pokémon who come in contact with the a wave are enveloped by a veil of water that continually restores HP.

  The veil of water lasts 1.5s and heals 3 times. Touching a wave refreshes the veil.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increases the amount of HP restored.

Upgrade 2.Name: Flip Turn
Upgrade 2.Description:
Has the user cloak itself in water for up to 3s, reducing damage received by 15% and increasing movement speed by 40%, ramping up by 5% every 0.25s up to 60%. This move can be used again within 3s to charge in a designated direction, dealing damage and shoving opposing Pokémon for 0.6s before jumping back in the opposite direction and gaining a shield.

  Vaporeon cannot auto attack or cast other moves whiile cloaked in water.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increases the damage reduction to 30%.

Unite Move.Name: Aquamarine Splash
Unite Move.Description: Has the user jump up high and dive underwater, creating a current that pulls in nearby opposing Pokémon for 0.3s. Afterward, the user leaps out of the water, dealing damage to nearby opposing Pokémon and throws them for 1s.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 40% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Overgrow
Passive Ability.Description: When HP is 30% or less; increase all damage dealt by 20%.

Venusaur.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, becoming a vine whip that strikes twice, pulls enemies between both vines, and stuns them for 0.4s, then applies a 20% slow for 1.5s.

Move 1.Name: Seed Bomb
Move 1.Description: Venusaur hurls a large seed to the designated location, damaging all enemies in the radius.

Upgrade 1.Name: Sludge Bomb
Upgrade 1.Description: Venusaur hurls toxic sludge to the designated location, damaging, slowing movement speed by 50% for 2s (stacking with the radius slow), and poisoning all enemies in the radius when it lands. The sludge lingers; damaging enemies every 0.5s for 5s in the radius, slowing them by 50%, and reducing their Sp. Defense by 40% for 2s (refreshes every tick).
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increased radius.

Upgrade 2.Name: Giga Drain
Upgrade 2.Description:
Venusaur emits a cone-shaped blast in the designated direction, damaging enemies and restoring health when it hits. Venusaur also takes 40% reduced damage for 2.5s.

  This move's healing is not increased by Venusaur's passive.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increased healing.

Move 2.Name: Razor Leaf
Move 2.Description: Venusaur launches a barrage of sharp-edged leaves in the designated direction, damaging enemies 10 times over 0.75s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Solar Beam
Upgrade 1.Description:
Venusaur charges for 0.7s before firing a beam of light in the designated direction, damaging enemies five times over 0.3s.

  Against Wild Pokémon: Each tick is capped at 450 damage and the total damage is capped at 2250.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Reduced cast time to 0.6s and base cooldown is further reduced by 1s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Petal Dance
Upgrade 2.Description: Venusaur scatters petals around themself for 4.8s, increasing movement speed by 80% and damaging enemies every 0.3s in the radius (for a total of 16 damage ticks). This movement speed increase slowly decays during the duration of this move by 9% every 0.5s to a minimum of 17%. Petal Dance reduces the cooldown of Sludge Bomb or Giga Drain by 30% of the current remaining cooldown, per tick of damage that hit an enemy player (hitting multiple enemies reduces the cooldown more).
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increased radius.

Unite Move.Name: Verdant Anger
Unite Move.Description: Venusaur becomes unstoppable to hurl a massive seed to the designated location, damaging all enemies in the radius and slowing them by 35% for 1s. The seed then splits apart into 4 smaller seeds, each damaging all enemies in their radius.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Cute Charm
Passive Ability.Description: When hit by an enemy attack at close range, make that enemy infatuated for a short time (10s CD). Infatuated enemies become enthralled and approach Wigglytuff against their will.

Wigglytuff.Attack: Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing damage to enemies and stunning them for 0.5s when it hits.

Move 1.Name: Pound
Move 1.Description: Wigglytuff slaps the area in front of them twice (.3s apart), damaging enemies in a cone and slowing them by 40% for 0.5s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Double Slap
Upgrade 1.Description: Wigglytuff unleashes a barrage of slaps, damaging enemies in a cone 3-5 times and slowing them by 45% for 1.5s.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Slaps 4-6 times instead.

Upgrade 2.Name: Dazzling Gleam
Upgrade 2.Description: Wigglytuff emits a flash of fairy energy, dealing a small amount of damage in a cone after 0.6s followed by a large amount of damage.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Slows enemies hit by the first flash by 40% for 1s.

Move 2.Name: Defense Curl
Move 2.Description: Wigglytuff gains a 25% max HP shield for 0.5s and rolls forward a short distance, throwing enemies hit in the air for 0.5s. Hitting an obstacle while rolling will change the direction Wigglytuff is moving and reset the cooldown of Pound, Double Slap, or Dazzling Gleam.

Upgrade 1.Name: Rollout
Upgrade 1.Description: Wigglytuff gains a 25% max HP shield for 2.5s and rolls forwards. Wigglytuff becomes unstoppable for the duration of the roll, damaging and throwing Pokémon hit in the air for 0.5s. Hitting an obstacle while rolling will change the direction Wigglytuff is moving up to 5 times and reset the cooldown of Pound, Double Slap, and Dazzling Gleam. Also, the shield refreshes duration each time an obstacle is hit.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increases the amount of time enemies are thrown in the air to 0.7s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Sing
Upgrade 2.Description: Wigglytuff begins singing, slowing enemies around them by 15% for 2s per 'Note' and increasing Wigglytuff's movement speed by 30% for 2.5s. Enemies that stay inside the song's effect will be put to sleep (when reaching 4 Notes) for 1.5s, and have their Defense and Special Defense reduced by 25% for 1.5s.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increases the amount of time enemies are asleep to 1.75s and the duration of Defense and Sp. Defense reduction to 1.75s.

Unite Move.Name: Starlight Recital
Unite Move.Description: Begin performing a recital and become unstoppable for 3s, granting Wigglytuff and nearby allies a shield for 3.5s as well as removing all status conditions from Wigglytuff and the affected allies and granting them immunity to hindrances for as long as the shield is active. When the shield expires, allies are healed for 50% of the remaining shield value.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Intrepid Sword
Passive Ability.Description: If the goal scoring button is held down, Zacian charges its sword with Aeos energy. For a short time, its basic attacks become boosted attacks. In addition, during this time, Zacian can use a boosted version of one of its moves once (this use does not share the same cooldown as the base move). The longer the goal scoring button is held down, the more Aeos energy is charged into the sword, lengthening the duration of the boost effect on basic attacks and moves. This Ability goes on an 8s cooldown after it’s triggered.  Minimum 5 energy is required to charge with a maximum of 10 (except for Unite Move). Duration for buff window is 3s for 5 energy, 6s for 8 energy, 10s for 10 energy. Charging occurs at a rate of 1 energy per 0.1s.

Zacian.Attack:
When basic attacks are performed consecutively within 2s, additional effects are applied depending on the stage of the consecutive attack. If a Move is used, Intrepid Sword is activated, or Intrepid Sword expires, the time to perform the next consecutive attack is extended.

Boosted attacks have an increased area of effect and deal additional damage proportional to the opposing Pokémon’s HP.

Move 1.Name: Slash
Move 1.Description: Slashes target Pokémon and deals a small amount of damage to nearby Pokémon. When this move is boosted with Aeos energy, its area of effect is increased, deals increased damage and also slows of Pokémon hit by 60% for 0.5s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Metal Claw
Upgrade 1.Description: Releases a shock wave in the designated direction, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon hit and decreasing their movement speed by 30% for 3s. As the shock wave moves forward, projectiles from non-allied Pokémon it hits are negated. After releasing the shock wave, Zacian charges in that direction and deals damage to opposing Pokémon, stopping at the first opposing Pokémon hit. If the charge hits an enemy, Zacian's attack speed is increased by 80% for 4s or 6 attacks, whichever comes first. When this move is boosted with Aeos energy, the shock wave's size and travel distance are increased and the intensity of the slow is increased to 45% for 3s.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Reduces this move's cooldown by 1s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Sacred Sword
Upgrade 2.Description: Has the user slash around itself as if drawing a circle with the tip of its sword, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and slowing them by 20% for 3s. During this slash, Zacian briefly becomes unstoppable and reduces damage taken by 30%. After 1.5s the user then unleashes a slashing attack inside the circle, dealing damage to opposing Pokémon it hits and leaving them unable to act for 0.35s. After a flurry attack hits an opposing Pokémon, the user’s Attack is increased by 20% for 3s, and damage dealt by the user’s moves and basic attacks ignores 10% of the opposing Pokémon’s Defense. When this move is boosted with Aeos energy, its area of effect is increased, and the time until the slashing attack is unleashed is reduced to 1s.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Reduce the time until the flurry of slashes is unleashed to 1.2s for the base Sacred Sword+ and 0.45s for Boosted Sacred Sword+

Move 2.Name: Quick Attack
Move 2.Description: Zacian charges in the designated direction, stopping at the first Pokémon it hits and dealing damage. When this move is boosted with Aeos energy, it also leaves opposing Pokémon unable to act for 1s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Agility
Upgrade 1.Description: Dashes in the designated direction and increases the user’s movement speed by 30% decaying every 1s by 10% down to a minimum of 7.5% for 3s. Dealing or taking any damage extends this duration by 1 second per attack up to 6 seconds and bypasses the movement speed decay. When this move is boosted with Aeos energy, the user is granted a shield.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Further increases movement speed gain to 40% on use.

Upgrade 2.Name: Play Rough
Upgrade 2.Description: Leaps in the designated direction stopping at the first Pokémon hit and lands on the opposite side of them. The Pokémon hit is dealt damage and is stunned for 0.25s. Zacian deals damage to nearby Pokémon stunning them as well. If Play Rough connects, Zacian receives 25% reduced damage from the enemies hit for 3s after landing. When this move is boosted with Aeos energy, Zacian leaps further and through all Pokémon hit along the leap’s path. Pokémon hit will receive damage and be left stunned for the same amount as the base stun duration.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Increases the stun duration to 0.75s.

Unite Move.Name: Sovereign Sword
Unite Move.Description: Has the user ready its giant sword, charge the sword with Aeos energy, and then unleashes an Unstoppable slash in front of itself. The user becomes Hindrance Resistant, applying a 10% self slow while the Unite Move button is held down and the user is in its ready stance. The longer the user is in this stance, the more Aeos energy is charged into the sword, and the more damage this move deals. If a set amount of Aeos energy or more is charged into the sword, the Unite Move becomes boosted, and the slash’s area of effect increases. This boosted Unite Move deals increased damage to opposing Pokémon it hits who have been buffed by their own Unite Move. This move deals 15% decreased damage per additional target hit, capping at 30% less damage from hitting 3 targets.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 30% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Volt Absorb
Passive Ability.Description: Gains 8% of damage received as bonus Attack for 4s (maximum 200 bonus Attack from 2,500 damage received).

Zeraora.Attack:
Becomes a boosted attack with every third attack, dealing increased damage and paralyzing opposing Pokémon hit, and restoring 10% missing HP per target hit.

The movement speed of paralyzed targets is decreased by 15% for 2.5s and their auto attack speed is decreased by 25% for 1s.

Move 1.Name: Agility
Move 1.Description: Quickly dashes forward, and increases auto attack speed by 45% for 3s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Volt Switch
Upgrade 1.Description:
Dashes forward at high speed, damaging opposing Pokémon in their path; and increasing auto attack speed by 45% for 3s. Also marks the starting location of this dash for 3s.

  This move can be used again within 3s to dash back to the starting location, dealing increased damage to opposing Pokémon in their path; and refreshing the auto attack speed buff duration.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Increases the damage of both dashes. Strengthens the auto attack speed increase to 60% for 3s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Spark
Upgrade 2.Description:
Becomes unstoppable for 0.2s and dashes forward with an electrically charged leap, damaging opposing Pokémon in their path. If an auto attack is used before the leap ends; leaps to an opposing Pokémon, dealing increased damage to the target.

  This move can be used again within 4s of the last use, repeating the effects of the first use (up to 3 total uses).
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Restores 15% missing HP if leaping to an opposing Pokémon with an auto attack before reaching them with the dash.

Move 2.Name: Slash
Move 2.Description: Pounces toward the designated opposing Pokémon's location and attacks with 3 sharp claw swipes, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect and throwing those hit by the last swipe for 0.5s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Discharge
Upgrade 1.Description:
Discharges electricity around themself for 1.5s, damaging opposing Pokémon in the area of effect every 0.3s (up to 6 times), followed by a final discharge after 0.4s; granting a shield for 3s when this move hits.

  Pulls opposing Pokémon paralyzed by the user hit by the final discharge in toward Zeraora's position over 1s, stunning them for 1s during the pull; and dealing extra damage to them.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Decreases the movement speed of opposing Pokémon by 25% for 1s when hit.

Upgrade 2.Name: Wild Charge
Upgrade 2.Description:
Dashes forward. If this move hits an opposing Pokémon; latches onto the target, and becomes untargetable to unleash a combo of at least 3 attacks, damaging the target with each attack (switching to the closest opposing Pokémon if the target is out of range or unable to be attacked for the next attack). Receives 1% remaining HP recoil damage per attack; the initial hit deals 2 instances of recoil damage. Opposing Pokémon hit by one of these attacks receive 50% reduced damage from subsequent attacks from Wild Charge for 5s.

  Hitting an opposing Pokémon with boosted attacks, Volt Switch, or Spark applies 1 stack of a Wild Charge buff for 5s (up to 3 stacks); each stack of the buff adds 1 additional attack to the next use of Wild Charge (for up to 6 total hits). Zeraora is untargetable while attacking; for 1.2s at 0 stacks, 1.5s at 1 stack, 1.8s at 2 stacks and 2s at 3 stacks from this buff.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Deals 50% reduced damage to other nearby opposing Pokémon with each attack.

Unite Move.Name: Plasma Gale
Unite Move.Description: Becomes unstoppable for 0.5s and launches a bolt of lightning toward the designated target; damaging opposing Pokémon in its path toward the target and throwing them for 0.5s. Once the bolt reaches the target; damages opposing Pokémon in an area of effect and throws them once again. Creates a circular zone of plasma centered on the target's location for 5s when it hits; paralyzing opposing Pokémon inside it for 3s. While in the zone, also increases the user's auto attack range, and auto attack damage by 20%.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 30% Movement Speed, 20% Attack Speed, 15% CDR, 20% Max HP Shield

Passive Ability.Name: Illusion
Passive Ability.Description: When this Ability is used: cleanses status conditions and becomes unstoppable for 0.33s (15s CD); and takes the form of the nearest opposing Pokémon for up to 15s, prioritizing Pokémon from the opposing team. Returns to their original form earlier when damaged, using an auto attack or move, attempting to score, or returning to base.  The target of the illusion does not need to be in vision to take their form.

Zoroark.Attack: Becomes a boosted with every third attack, dealing increased damage.

Move 1.Name: Slash
Move 1.Description: Dashes forward, damaging opposing Pokémon hit.

Upgrade 1.Name: Shadow Claw
Upgrade 1.Description: Dashes forward, damaging opposing Pokémon in the path and stunning them for 0.05s when it hits; if hit at the endpoint of the dash, throw them for 0.4s instead.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Strengthens the duration of the throw at the endpoint to 0.5s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Cut
Upgrade 2.Description: Dashes forward, damaging opposing Pokémon; restoring HP when it hits.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Strengthened amount of HP restored.

Move 2.Name: Fury Swipes
Move 2.Description: Dashes forward, damaging opposing Pokémon hit. If this move hits, this move can be used again within 4s.

Upgrade 1.Name: Night Slash
Upgrade 1.Description:
Gains the Night Slash buff for 2.5s, changing the next movement to a dash attack, damaging opposing Pokémon in the path. If the dash attack hits: changes the next auto attack to a unique boosted attack with increased range. If Zoroark hits opposing Pokémon with Slash, Shadow Claw, Cut, or unique boosted attacks: resets the Night Slash buff duration to 2.5s, repeating this chain of attacks. This move ends if the user moves when they're unable to use the Night Slash dash attack.

  If Zoroark hits opposing Pokémon with a total of 6 valid attacks: cleanses status conditions and becomes invincible for 1.4s,  jumping into the air then landing after 1.2s. When the user lands: slashes a cross-shaped area of effect, damaging opposing Pokémon with two diagonal slashes, and dealing additional missing HP damage when it hits; restores HP once for each of the two diagonal areas of the cross slash that hits an opposing Pokémon (up to 2 times if both slashes hit).  This cross-shaped attack deals move damage if triggered by a final move hit, or auto attack damage if triggered by a final unique boosted attack. While jumping, the user is able to use Slash, Shadow Claw, or Cut to move a set distance.
Upgrade 1.Enhanced Description: Reduces this move's cooldown by 1s.

Upgrade 2.Name: Feint Attack
Upgrade 2.Description:
Dashes forward, damaging opposing Pokémon in the path and resetting move cooldowns when it hits. If this move hits, the location where the dash started is marked for 3s, and this move can be used again to return to the marked location with the same effects as the first dash. As long as there is a mark, using Slash, Shadow Claw, or Cut moves the mark to where that move started.

  If Zoroark hits opposing Pokémon 4 times with either Feint Attack or other normal moves without interrupting the chain of marking: changes the next use of Feint Attack for 3s. When used again: becomes unstoppable for 0.5s and leaps at the designated opposing Pokémon; then bounces in the designated direction forward off the target to perform a slashing attack, damaging the target and opposing Pokémon in the path, dealing additional missing HP damage to those hit.
Upgrade 2.Enhanced Description: Reduces this move's cooldown by 1s.

Unite Move.Name: Nightfall Daze
Unite Move.Description: Becomes unstoppable for 1.33s, and releases dark shockwaves with increasing areas of effect around themself 3 times over the first 1s, damaging opposing Pokémon hit with each shockwave.
Unite Move.Buff Stats: 80% Movement Speed, 20% Max HP Shield
